292 produits enregistrés
0
49 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
3
Recommandé
19.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 janvier 2022
长话短说，在我看来，本作是《Supraland》真正具有可以作为一个“系列”传承下去的能力的证明。

前言

首先简单介绍一下本作和《Supraland》之间的关系。

本作（《Supraland：Six Inches Under》）本应是《Supraland》的第二个DLC，是用来让新加入的开发人员磨合用的，但由于开发者们“不小心”把内容开发的太多了（开发工期甚至超越了《Supraland》），所以本作最终以一部独立作品的姿态发售了（这个故事很像另一个至今还没有发售日期消息的游戏啊）。因此本作和《Supraland》之间的关系较为复杂。

具体来说，本作主角的能力中，有大半部分沿袭自《Supraland》，也有小半部分是全新的能力。除此之外，本作不仅有和《Supraland》及其第一个DLC全然不同的场景和谜题设计，也具有一个独立完整的结构。因此无论你有没有玩过《Supraland》及其DLC，游玩本作都不会有什么问题。

简单来说就是这样，在接下来的评测中，我还会从多角度更细致地比较本作和《Supraland》，围绕一个核心点：本作“传承”了什么，又“创新”了什么。

本作的传承

在我看来，本作很好地将前作中最优秀的部分继承了下来。

据开发者说，本作玩法组成大概为：55%探索+40%解谜+5%战斗。我个人感觉，确实差不多如此。

和《Supraland》一样，在探索方面，本作沿用了“类银河城”式的设计，在结构上主要强调一种“层次感”，一种随着新能力的取得，世界在玩家面前徐徐展开的感觉。本作具有十足的开放性，即使有时为了让玩家熟悉新能力，游戏会将玩家限制在一个比较小的区域当中，解决特定的一些谜题之后才能出去，但很多时候，玩家理论上能到达的区域只会不断扩大，而不会缩小或发生其他变化。是前往新区域找新能力，完成主线，还是在已知区域中解决一些支线，完成其他谜题，选择权几乎完全在你自己手中。

和探索玩法结合的就是本作的“第一人称解谜”玩法。玩家需要使用各种神奇的能力，解开散落在这个字面意义上的“沙盒”世界中的，大大小小的谜团。这些解谜不太“常规”，很有《Supraland》的那种特色。谜题考察的范围兼顾观察、逻辑和脑洞，既要求玩家掌握手上的多种能力，以这些知识为基础进行纵向思考，也要求玩家能横向思考，有创意地使用自己的能力和关卡中的种种要素。本作的谜题能做到让我不停惊叫“还有这种操作”，但在游戏的逻辑框架内又十分合理。看似“随心所欲”的解法往往不是真的毫无来由，回过头来，发现绝大多数操作已经早有“伏笔”（比如相关的教学），不服不行。我可是玩过《Supraland》和它的第一个DLC的，这就不用我再多说了吧，我觉得我已经夸得很“肉麻”了，但本作值得这样的“肉麻”。

以上部分说的比较笼统，好像把它完全搬去形容《Supraland》也不会有问题，这就对了，毕竟我形容的确实是我个人看来，本作以及《Supraland》做得最杰出的地方。

那么接下来就说说：

本作的创新

在《Supraland》及其第一个DLC的“实验”中，有许多大大小小的瑕疵，或者干脆是设计问题。在我看来，本作的创新除了体现在全新的关卡和谜题设计之外（出于剧透原因，在这篇评测中就不展开了），就主要体现在对前作中这些问题的解决。

首先，前作中最大的问题恐怕就是“战斗”部分了。前作中的战斗并说不上有特点，攻击方式只有非常普通的两种：近战（剑）和远程（枪），敌人也缺乏多样性，怪能不能打得过一般而言和策略无关，而是和你有没有多完成支线和收集，提升各方面的数值有关。再加上有时战斗区域和解谜区域混在一起，使得在解谜时老是有怪烦人，这点是非常不好的。怪甚至是会重复刷出的，除非玩家有足够的能力破坏掉特定的刷怪点，但据我所知，这种特殊能力要在大后期的支线才有机会获得。

关于应不应该在主线中设置和支线收集有关的“进度锁”（可以看出，上面描述的战斗本质上和“进度锁”没区别）的问题稍后再谈，先说说战斗系统本身的进步。

本作的战斗可以说相对前作有了全面的更新和提升，解决了无聊以及上述的多种设计问题。本作中敌人种类丰富，这当然很好，但我觉得更重要、更本质的是，解决这些敌人的策略也多样化了。本作中，玩家终于有机会利用自己手上，用来解谜的那些个能力，来和敌人进行有策略的战斗。举个例子，玩过《Supraland》的玩家应该知道其中一个能力是可以连接木头的能量光束，在本作中，这个能力可以被用来解决一种敌人：总是举着一个木制盾的敌人。你既可以将敌人的盾和某块其它木头连接，让你能够绕到敌人后方造成伤害，也可以用能量光束拉拽敌人的木盾，将盾和敌人一同拉到危险的地形中（比如岩浆）。总之就这也已经比前作中的所谓“战斗”要好了，更别说还有其他多种创新。

除了战斗本身，和战斗相关的设计问题也得到了解决。本作中采用更多游戏中使用的刷怪方式，就是设计特定的“战场”区域，只有在第一次进入时，刷几波特定的怪，提供战斗挑战，在玩家解决这些敌人之后，就不再以任何方式继续刷怪。这就解决了之前说的战斗和解谜区域混在一起的问题，解决方式非常简单，就是将战斗区域和解谜区域分开。更深入地，这种设计也对这种探索型游戏的后期探索提供了方便，因为走过的区域不会再刷怪，这自然就提供了极大的便利。

所以本作的战斗确实是进步了，甚至对我这种有时对解谜游戏中动作成分要求非常苛刻的人来说，本作的战斗也已经是能让我玩得很开心的了，因此我很荣幸地宣布，我认为本作中战斗不再是一个“累赘”或“鸡肋”，而是融合在本作中的一个真正有趣的组分。

接下来要说的问题主要是在《Supraland Crash》，也就是《Supraland》第一个DLC的“实验”过程中出现的问题。

《Supraland Crash》一开始的版本中，结构中的“循环”非常清晰可见：火箭一次次发射，又一次次坠毁，需要重新找到一定数量的零件来继续。但这种结构存在的问题，一个是比较无聊，毕竟不管是“零件”还是什么，终究也只是一个数字而已，而另一个就是它和探索支线和收集要素有关。这本身并不算是问题，问题在于很多时候，收集掉明晃晃地放在新区域的谜题之后的零件之后，数目仍然不够，这时玩家就只能在之前已经走过的区域中搜索“隐藏区域”，找到剩余的零件，而这些零件有时不是放在显眼的地方，比如谜题之后，而是地图中的某些犄角旮旯，这点让当时的我比较恼火。

这就是之前提过的“进度锁”的问题，在我看来，使用和支线和收集直接相关的方式来创造“进度锁”并不是不可以，但我个人认为，至少和进度相关的这些支线不应该是“隐藏”的。

本作结构上的“循环”不如《Crash》那么明显，而更像《Supraland》本体中的那种方式。比《Supraland》更进一步的是，本作对什么应该是“主线”，什么应该是“支线”有了更深的见解。所有区域都充满了支线，当然也有需要拿到新能力后回归的支线，但是只有在中心区域——笼子镇（Cagetown）中，才存在同时满足“主线”和“需要拿到新能力后回归”这两个条件的谜题。只在这个需要反复回归的中心区域设计这样的谜题，这就既让所有玩家都知道了“拿到新能力后探索走过的区域”是有用的，又不会像《Crash》一样让大多数玩家满世界跑，起到了引导和指向的作用。

本作中也没有和隐藏要素直接相关的“进度锁”，至少程度轻微到我已经注意不到的程度了，正常玩，正常探索，目标非常明确，除了肉眼可见的主要谜题（和获取能力有关的谜题之上，往往挂着一大块非常显眼的，地标级别的水晶）之外，基本上没有什么东西阻挡你通关主线。

另一个方面就是寻找“隐藏”要素的无趣性。之前提过前作的战斗很无聊，许多隐藏要素又只是增加生命值或者攻击力这种数值，而且也仅仅是藏得比较深，并没有在解谜上有独特的展开，因此很难让人产生动力。而本作采取的改进办法是，首先是改进战斗系统（效果非常成功），然后是设计了和隐藏要素绑定的支线内容，比如支线谜题。对我个人而言，其实我想找的并不是那些奖励，而是伴随奖励而来的，卡在玩家和奖励之间的支线谜题（通常来说比主线谜题更难），那么自然，这种设计就让我非常喜欢。这两点都很好地解决了找隐藏过程的无趣，至少让我的动力提升不少。

这当然是最好的，因为本作中的“隐藏”可谓是非常的多，甚至有两个完全和主线无关的大区域，其中一个还只有在通关主线，并找到若干藏得非常苛刻的收集要素之后才能进入。在我通关主线时，收集完成度只有43%，在其他玩家的帮助下再仔细寻找才到了87%，如果没有更新、更难的额外内容作为动力，我估计不会这么努力去找吧。

目前我看到的就是这些。

总结

总的来说，本作既继承了前作中最优秀的部分（探索和解谜设计），又很好地解决了相当部分的前作中的瑕疵。在经历《Supraland Crash》的失望后，高质量的本作重新赢回了我的信任。对于将《Supraland》以几乎最完美的姿态展现在我面前的本作，我几乎不知道如何想象更好的作品，我能做的只有期待。

祝续作《Supraworld》开发顺利。

结论：强烈推荐。
 
OldCaptainWZJ

Recommandé
3.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 janvier 2022
《Supraland Six Inches Under》在Steam商店页面是这么介绍自己的：

一款混合了传送门、萨尔达以及密特罗德的游戏。

我本来还不信，要知道，它所列举出的游戏几乎都在关卡设计领域绝对出色的存在，而这样一款独立游戏就想轻易去挑战它们，我真的觉得是有些痴人说梦，尤其是密特罗德和塞尔达传说代表了2D，传送门代表了3D的情况下，我很难想象这款游戏到底是如何“我全都要”。

　欢迎关注 网易UU鉴赏家培养计划
　来这里找优质游戏、开黑日友、白嫖UU时长卡　
　加速Steam社区、游戏记得用UU哦_(:з」∠)_　

抱着试一试的心态，我来体验了《Supraland Six Inches Under》。在体验过后，我又稍作了解了一下这个系列的游戏，真的是惊掉我下巴。

一个不小心，它诞生了

《Supraland Six Inches Under》的诞生其实完全是一个意外，本来是作为前作《Supraland》第二个DLC开发的它，因为本意是让团队新人练手，结果一个不小心，内容做多到有些离谱，再加上这个DLC的工期已经超过了本体的工期，于是干脆就做成了一个独立的游戏，而不是按原计划仅仅是一个DLC。

虽然这么说，《Supraland Six Inches Under》依旧适合每一位未曾游玩过前作的玩家，你可以在《Supraland Six Inches Under》中体验到不少前作中的玩法，它们都得到了很好地传承，同时也能获得一些全新的体验，因为有至少一半的能力仅在本作中出现，它们也有着很多乐子，足矣你去进行大量的探索。

它真的做到了

在游玩《Supraland Six Inches Under》的过程中，我真正体验到了我曾在《塞尔达传说》《传送门》和《密特罗德》中体验过的优秀的关卡设计，这也让我知道了它绝不是说说而已，是真的有东西的，也难怪Steam好评率高达98%。

在《Supraland Six Inches Under》中，你需要使用场景中提供的各类物品，来与场景进行交互，以达到过关的目的，这样的箱庭式设计在这款游戏中非常常见。同时，就如《密特罗德》一样，能力藏在某处，你需要去寻找，然后再回头发现，你曾无法通关的地方，也能通关了。精妙的关卡设计使这一切显得不唐突，用精妙绝伦来形容一点都不夸张。

更让我佩服的是，《Supraland Six Inches Under》不在乎你到底会不会玩游戏，所有关卡简单化，以高密度的形式呈现在你的面前，这就和短视频的那种快速消费内容的乐趣相同，你不需要靠解开了某一个关卡来满足自己，而是陆续不断地接收来自制作组有趣的关卡设计，你就会默默沉迷进游戏中，这样的手法可以参考《极限竞速：地平线5》和《孤岛惊魂6》，既然我无法做到深度，那我就以数量取胜，《Supraland Six Inches Under》就是这么干的。

当然，解谜占游戏的比重并不多，更多的反而是交由玩家手上的探索，这也就让这款游戏的游玩时间跨度有着巨大的差异，可能几个小时，可能几十个小时。如何设计探索内容，《Supraland Six Inches Under》给出的答案是尽可能地搞笑、不正经，人们总喜欢看综艺，因为台上艺人的演绎、后期手上的剪刀和特效，共同让综艺变得有趣。《Supraland Six Inches Under》则是通过有趣的表演和场景设计，来让游戏足够能留住人，颇有点我之前玩过的《沙雕之路》的意思，正也因此，《Supraland Six Inches Under》给我留下了相当深刻的印象。

总结

《Supraland Six Inches Under》算得上是独立游戏中的无名小将了，虽然我并不理解为什么这么棒的游戏它的玩家只有这么点，但我真的很希望每一位玩家都能来试试它，绝对惊喜十足。

我已经在期待这部游戏的续作了！
 
Sayaka🌸

Recommandé
2.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 janvier 2023
I haven’t played the other Supraland games before but always got close to buying them on sale. I picked this up a few days ago as part of a bundle I believe and decided to give it a go on my Steam Deck.

I was intending just to play about 30 minutes but I got hooked. It kinda surprised me as I am not overly a fan of puzzle games. I don’t mind a few but lots mixed with platforming tend to get the better of me these days.

However this game didn’t do so. I don’t know if it was the cute art direction and style or something else but before I knew it over two hours had past.

Technically the game ran flawless on the Steam Deck. I had zero issues of any kind from boot through my full two plus hours of playing.

I highly recommend this game for anyone that likes puzzles and platformer games and say that even outside those that love those genres it is still worth checking out.
 
Motivia

Recommandé
35.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 mai 2022
Well I enjoyed it until I finished the main story. Then it just gets tedious. I don't mind finding new and exciting ways to reach different areas and I enjoy exploring. But running around listening to a beeper to find things and not even having any idea if they are in the same room or an adjacent area is frustrating, to say the least.
Add to that the mechanics of making a simple jump or things being just out of reach from a normal jump is maddening. You can see the goal, but can find no way to reach it.
I don't like being forced to finish the main story-line before exploring each area. You don't give me anything close to what I need to explore areas and I have to try and remember where I did and didn't get things. GRRRRR!

I guess if you just play to finish the story, it's enjoyable. But if you want to get all the achievements and find all the treasures it becomes more of a job than a game.

So I'm recommending with caveats.
 
CSaintD

24.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 janvier 2022
Produit reçu gratuitement

SUPRALAND 1.5

İlk oyunda kum havuzunu yaratıklardan kurtaran kırmızı prens, The Crash DLC'sinde ise rokete binip başka dünyalara gitti. Bu oyunda ise kırmızı prens uzaklardayken Kırmızı Kasabada neler olduğunu anlatıyor.

Hikayeye göre kırmızı prens roket yolculuğuna çıkar, kum havuzunun sahibi olan çocuk ise kum havuzunu alt üst eder. Bundan kaçmaya çalışan halk ise yer altına düşer ve kendi dünyalarının altındaki yepyeni dünyayla tanışırlar.

İlk oyuna kıyasla haritasının daha küçük olmasına rağmen oyun mekaniklerinin daha fazla olması dikkat çekiyor. Elbette ki ilk oyundaki bazı mekanikler bu oyunda da var.

Aslında Supraland'e DLC olarak çıkacak Six Inches Under, geliştiricilerin kendini kaptırması ile yeni bir oyun olarak çıkıyor. Supraland'e kıyasla haritasının çok daha küçük olduğundan bahsetmiştim, aynı şekilde oynanış süresi de kısa. Oyun yine keşfe dayalı ve bu sefer savaş öğeleri daha az bulunuyor.

Kısacası önceki Supraland yapımlarını beğendiyseniz bunu da beğeneceğiniz kesin. Gerçekten herkese hitap edebilecek kapasitede bir oyun olduğunu düşünüyorum.
 
Trident

Supraland вернулся!
Все 53 ачивки собраны: 140 сундуков, 25 улучшений, 79 секретов, 10 трофеев, 20 часов удовольствия!

Разработчики, большое спасибо =) Ждем SupraWorld!!!

UPD.
Многие негативные отзывы по игре объективны (подземелье вместо открытого неба, более простые головоломки до титров и т.д.).
Но если понимать (воспринимать), что Six Inches Under разрабатывался 3/4 времени как DLC, то все недостатки станут понятны. К тому же они не критичны.
 
🅶anesa (печалька)

its more supraland. which means its good. what a fantastic puzzle platformer. even funnier than the first game. so happy to return to this silly little world. the original supraland holds a very personal place in my heart. a game that really helped me in a very hard time of my life. i am overjoyed to go back to a game like this with new content again but unburdened.

22.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 juillet 2022
7 / 10

Is this a decent game? Yes. Is it better than the original Supraland? No. Do I recommend it? Sorta.

The original Supraland was awesome. One of my favorite games to date. Its fun and quirky and doesnt take itself too seriously. A lot of that transfers over to Six Inches Under. The main issue I have with it is is lacks that same...spirit of the original. Its not really open world like the original, it does not have nearly as much content, or RPG elements as the original neither. Does all that make this game bad? Absolutely not. Standing on its own like the devs decided to release it as just does not do it justice I feel.

This would have been better as to what Crash could have been. Crash was a rushed cookie cutter story DLC for the imaginative and sandbox Supraland. If this was DLC for Supraland, I would rate it more favorably as its more the same of Supraland than different. For me it just doesnt quite have that...."it" factor.
 
QuickAluminum

Final Frontier
0
32 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
15
Recommandé
11.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 janvier 2022
Gelungener zweiter Teil

Ich habe mich schon lange auf den Nachfolger gefreut und hoffte, das Spiel würde seinen Charme beibehalten.
Ich wurde nicht enttäuscht! "Supraland Six Inches Under" ist seinem Vorgänger treu geblieben und hat zudem sogar einige Verbesserungen bekommen.

Beispielsweise gibt es nun endlich eine Map der Spielwelt (welche durch Coins gekauft werden kann). Diese Map ist äußerst detailliert und es können sich sogar Notizen gemacht werden, was sehr praktisch ist.

Die Gegner können auf unterschiedliche Arten vernichtet werden, auch ihre Angriffsmuster sind unterschiedlich. Zudem wirken die Gegner nicht mehr so deplatziert und unwillkürlich wie im Vorgänger. Auch braucht man nun mehr Skill, um diese vernichten zu können. Teilweise kommt man auch erst weiter, wenn eine gewissen Anzahl an Gegner-Wellen bewältigt wurde, was meiner Meinung aber gut machbar ist.

In diesem Teil wird der Fokus auf die Hauptwaffe, die Spitzhacke, gelegt. Diese kann mehrmals aufgewertet werden (Von einer Holzspitzhacke bis zu einer Diamantspitzhacke). Dementsprechend sind in der Welt mehrere Arten von unterschiedlichen Gesteinen verstreut, welche je nach Art der Spitzhacke auch zerstört werden können, und gegebenenfalls zu Geheimverstecken oder Geld führen können.

Die Spielwelt ist wieder äußerst komplex und verwinkelt. Sehr viele Quests sind vorhanden, welche Anfangs noch gar nicht gelöst werden können und man sich gespannt fragt, wie das denn überhaupt funktionieren soll. Nach und nach schaltet man dann neue Fähigkeiten frei und bekommt ein umfassenderes Verständnis und kann von da an Wege einschlagen (im wahrsten Wortsinn), welche vorher noch nicht ergründbar waren. Diesen Aspekt schätze ich wirklich besonders, denn Supraland Six Inches Under sorgt bei mir für ein vollständiges entdecken wollen der Secrets.

Der Humor und die Anspielungen, welche mir schon in dem ersten Teil sehr gefallen haben, kommen in diesem Teil auch wieder sehr gut zu Tage.

Fazit
Ein gelungenes Spiel. Die Motivation, schnell in dem Spiel vorwärts zu kommen, ist durch die Vielfältigkeit stark gegeben. Es hat auf jeden Fall mehrere, süchtig-machende Aspekte und die Rätsel haben eine gute Qualität, nicht zu schwer, nicht zu leicht.

Ich gebe dem Spiel 96 von 100 Punkten

Ich liebe die Supraland-Reihe! <3 Danke, Entwickler-Team. :)
 
Nyko.dew
0
19 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante

Great game as expected and definitely recommend!
My minor bug bears, only as compared to the original Supraland because that is in my all time top 5.
- I did feel it was significantly shorter than the original
- The puzzles in the original I thought were more challenging
- I don't like how you get a few of the gadgets right away, kinda suffocates you. I liked how in the original you find them slowly and must master each one and then learn how to combine them to solves the puzzles.

Évaluation publiée le 14 janvier 2022
Non sono molti i giochi che garantiscono la possibilità di esplorare in modo soddisfacente un mondo interessante, né che presentino enigmi la cui risoluzione sia capace di stampare sulla faccia ripetuti sorrisi giganti di approvazione e stima per i designer.
Il primo Supraland era uno di questi giochi.
Six Inches Under è la dimostrazione che no, la genialità di Supraland non è stato un caso e la stoffa dei ragazzi di Supragames è davvero quella dei campioni.

P.S. Mi sono occupato della traduzione in italiano, ma come potete notare dalle ore spese sopra, il mio supporto e amore verso il titolo va ben oltre l'attività di adattamento.

Recommandé
26.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 janvier 2022
I have mixed feelings about this game. On its own its a fun game with interesting mechanics, and challenging puzzles. Compered to Supralend however, its just not as good. There are a few reasons for this, First of all difficulty VS reward feels unbalanced, You finally solve a complex multi-step puzzle then you get to the end, and there's a chest with a few coins. its sort of a let down.in Supraland the puzzles felt like they were getting you somewhere. Like they were mosltly all a part of the overall story. You could literally skip a third of the puzzles, in this game, and miss nothing but coins. I wasn't happy with the pacing either I just beat the game, and I'm sitting at 50% completion. I wasn't even trying to get to the end, it just sort of happened unexpectedly. So the rest is just filler. too much filler IMO . If you played the original Supraland I think you might feel at least a little disappointed. This one just doesn't come together quite as well for me.

14 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
26.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 janvier 2022
Produit reçu gratuitement

更新日：2021/1/22

プレイ状況：ベータ版からプレイ、合計２５時間ぐらいで３週。100%到達済み。実績はコンプ済み。

Supraland本編もレビューしてあるので、基本はそちらを読んでいただきたい。
https://steamcommunity.com/id/toyochzor/recommended/813630

ストーリーは時系列上Crash DLCと同時進行、プレイヤーはブルーの配管工となって砂箱の地下に広がる世界(溶岩とかどうしてるんだろう)を駆け回り、地上への脱出路を探すことになる。

今回は探索に最も大きく比重がかかっており、パズルはメインルート上のものならそこまで困難なものはない。
戦闘は本編/Crashと比べると敵が完全一新されたアリーナ型に変更され、よりクリエイティブな戦い方を要求される。

・変更点と良いところ
スタンドアロンのスピンオフなので、Supraland(とCrash DLC)を持っていなくても遊べる(ただしストーリー的にCrashを先にプレイすべき)。
敵はアリーナ式になり、敵の利用が必要なパズルを除けば全滅させるとリスポーンしなくなる(途中で逃げたりやられたりするとウェーブやり直しになる)。
新規アビリティは結構多めかつ、アビリティの入手順が本編/Crashから大きく変わっている。
本編/Crashと同様、よく作りこまれたパズルとマップデザイン。今回は探索重視。

・問題点
暗い場所が多くなったか。
操作不能なカットシーンはCrashよりはマシだけど結構入ってくる。
Supralandのシリーズ元であるスプラボールが一切出ない。鉄球はある。
コンテンツの半分ぐらいがエンディング後(または直前)にアクセス可能な構成。
本家をプレイしていないとわかりにくいパズル(色塗りマシン、キーカード、磁力の仕様など)が多め。

開発規模が拡大し、正当な進化を遂げたSupraland 1.5相当のスタンドアロン作品。
先に本編(DEMOでもいい)を遊んでパズルの基礎を把握しておくと良いかもしれない。

追記：これも翻訳してました。
 
Toyoch
0
31 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
3
Recommandé
76.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 janvier 2022
Produit reçu gratuitement

Another brilliant entry into the Supraverse. The developers have hit home AGAIN with the cleverly made puzzles that are both challenging yet achievable without needing to bash your head against a wall (although a couple of moments had me tempted.. courtesy of a certain developer who shall not be named! You know who you are). There is a fine line between puzzles being both fun and interesting and being both challenging and guiding you just enough to not get lost and yet again they've walked that line with confidence in itself as a game.

Supraland created a promise to the people. A promise of tone, atmosphere, exploration and pacing and Six Inches Under has done very well to deliver on that. It brings me great joy to see how far Supra Games has come, growing from the 1 person who made the first game to a team who hasn't strayed from the path David walked before them. This game kept all the elements from the first Supraland that made it so iconic for me and this is an incredibly fresh yet familiar experience.

The combat has been evolved to something far more sophisticated than what was given in the first game, enemies are now a threat instead of a mild annoyance but they've also become tools you'll learn to utilize as you venture off down under. This game has actually made me realise how underwhelming the combat system is in the original which I'd hate to say anything bad about it but I think it goes to show how much the developers listen and learn from what they've done before instead of becoming complacent with themselves. Growth and being transformative is essential for a franchise to not become stale.

I genuinely did love this game, I love the personality that's been thrown into it by the people who clearly love games like these, to describe this game as a mix of Portal, Zelda and Metroid is not a disservice to those franchises.

Once again, as a fan of puzzles and as a fan of exploration I am inspired and I look forward to what's to come in this developers future.

As someone with aspirations in game development I'd love to work for this company
 
Egasuas
318 produits enregistrés

0
Recommandé
18.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 janvier 2022
Тот же супраленд, что и всегда (то есть крайне затягивающее исследование, куча смешных шуток и "пораскидывание" мозгами, и всё это всего за 300 рублей), но в этот раз пара небольших моментов огорчили, по сравнению с прошлыми частями:

1. В оригинале можно было залезть куда угодно, здесь много невидимых стен, а так же ограниченные возможности персонажа. Нет двойного прыжка, нет уменьшенной гравитации, нет притягивания к своему собственному кубу.
2. Обещана половина нового арсенала, по факту из нового увидел только пару абилок, и то не сильно меняющих геймплей.
3. Визуально игра та же, а производительность значительно хуже+статтеры через некоторое время, думаю еще поработают над оптимизацией.

В целом я бы не назвал это "супраленд 1.5", как писал разработчик, скорее это такое же длц как crash.
Ждем полноценного супраленд 2 через пару лет.
 
Человек, измученный Нарзаном
483 produits enregistrés
5
13 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
20.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 janvier 2022
如果我给Supraland本体打9分，那Supraland Crash只能打5分，Supraland Six Inches Under可以打7分
所以DLC只是个DLC，而Supraland Six Inches Under能被开发者称为Supraland 1.5不是没有道理的
所以本评测主要是和Supraland 本篇进行对比，Crash被排除在外，因为通关后现在对DLC几乎完全没有印象了
我通关Supraland Six Inches Under时完成度是68%，完成100%全收集花费了20个小时

故事的剧情衔接了Supraland Crash的内容，红色王子在DLC经历了数次坠机后，还是要继续乘坐火箭飞向房屋（大约会是Supraland 2的内容），于是不出所料的在本作又双叒叕坠机了。同时，由于沙盒创造者的破环，整个红镇和蓝镇的成员都掉落到了一个地下六英尺深的世界里，本作的主角作为一个蓝色的水管工，要做的就是找到回到地面的方法， 带领红镇和蓝镇的居民重回地面

游戏相较于Supraland本篇有了很多改动
对于我个人来说有好有坏
  • 由于整个故事都发生在地下，所以几乎所有区域都是相对封闭的，不同于Supraland 本篇开放的环境，抬头就能看到的巨大的标志物，在地下就很难轻松的知道自己要朝哪个方向走、去什么地方。所以地图设计成了一个主节点和几个分叉的模式，以减少迷路的情况。

  • 一个很大的进步就是加入了地图，俯视角的地图非常的精美，早在玩Supraland本篇的时候我就想过，如此精美的和具有特色的场景和地图，不能俯视看到一个沙盒全图实在有些遗憾。
    同时，地图的加入也很好的处理了上一点中存在的问题，给玩家在地下世界中指明了位置。
    更好的一点是，地图还贴心的添加了画笔功能，可以将探索中遇到的一些无法解决的问题标注出来，让后续的探索更加方便。
    但是请不要在地图上画勾八
    我的通关地图
    Supraland Six Inches Under 
    Une capture d'écran de Supraland Six Inches Under
    Par : SMParadise

  • 近一步减少了战斗内容，仅在几个固定场景有战斗，并且在战斗中添加了一些解迷和与能力的联动。
    但是一次性战斗的改动这点说不上是好是坏，在Supraland本篇内容中，随着游戏的进行你能明显感受到自己在变强，每次回到这个区域，解决这些怪物都越来越简单和得心应手，甚至最后不但能解决怪物，还能解决掉刷怪点，这种巨大的成长这给人带来的体验也是极佳的。

  • 箱子中得到的升级奖励偏离了Supraland本篇的设计，对人物的提升变小，取而代之的是大多无关紧要的升级。
    在Crash中，甚至由于箱子奖励的过于敷衍，在发布一段时间后还通过更新修改过箱子奖励内容（虽然修改后的奖励也及其敷衍）。而在本作中，有很多的箱子都只是金币，道具的成长也比较少，更多的应用于解谜。
    “发现隐藏秘密的快感”很快就会被“就几个金币？”或者“好无聊的升级”的挫败感取代，也会让人失去探索秘密的欲望，变成为了收集而收集。
    虽然战斗部分从来都不是Supraland系列的主要游戏成分，但是不可否认的是，数值的积累和人物的变强也是能给人带来快感的。

  • 通关游戏更加简单，如果你不爱探索和舔图，直奔主线通关的话大概只需要30%的完成度。甚至连能力也不是通关必须的，而是作为给探索者的奖励和便利，没有打火机可用，火柴也是可以的嘛。
同时，Supraland Six Inches Under延续和发扬了Supraland一直以来优秀的探索和解谜内容，也塞满了遍布整个世界各处的秘密隐藏区域，还有各种各样的玩梗和彩蛋存在。整体的游戏体验极佳，可以让热爱探索、邪道、不同解谜思路的玩家超级满足。
DNA动了 
Une capture d'écran de Supraland Six Inches Under
Par : SMParadise

为什么我给Supraland Six Inches Under的评价没有Supraland高?
在完成Supraland后，回想整个游戏过程，我的感想就像下面的歌词
《平凡之路》 a écrit :
我曾经跨过山和大海 也穿过人山人海 我曾经拥有着的一切
转眼都飘散如烟 我曾经失落失望失掉所有方向
直到看见平凡才是唯一的答案
我曾经踏上最高的山巅，也跳下过最深的低谷，我的脚步遍布了整个世界
我解决了所有的难题，也得到了很多的能力，我了解了这个世界所有的秘密
最终我完成了100%的收集，然后还能做什么呢？
在红镇里养老，给孩子们讲我曾经的冒险故事
Supraland 
Une capture d'écran de Supraland
Par : SMParadise

而在完成Supraland Crash 和 Supraland Six Inches Under后，却没有如此激动和感想
或许这些是只有一次的，初见游戏才能给人带来的体验

希望Supraland 2开发顺利，早日发售，给人带来不一样的、更好的游戏体验

13 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
25.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 janvier 2022
Daha az savaş, daha çok keşif ve bulmaca. Daha fazla Supraland!

Portal, Metroid ve Zelda'nın müthiş bir karışımı olan Supraland'ı bundan birkaç yıl evvel, ilk çıktığında ayıla bayıla oynamıştım. Savaş mekanikleri gibi zayıf yanları vardı ama yaşattığı keşif ve macera hissi o kadar iyi, haritanın orasına burasına sakladığı yeni yetenekleri ve sandıkları aramak o kadar keyifliydi ki buna hiç aldırmamıştım.

Aslında bir DLC olarak tasarlanan fakat daha sonra kabına sığmayıp başlı başına bir oyuna dönüşen Supraland Six Inches Under da ilk oyundan kesinlikle aşağı kalmıyor. Hatta bazı şeyleri daha iyi bile yapıyor. Mesela savaşlar artık çok daha katlanılır olmuş. Siz tam bir bulmacayı çözecekken durmadan üstünüze saldıran düşmanlarla uğraşmak zorunda kalmıyorsunuz. Düşman çeşitliliği de arttırılmış, güzel olmuş.

Bunun yanı sıra kibrit çakıp kartonları yakmak, kazmayla bazı duvarları kırmak, silahımızı fırlatmak gibi birkaç yeni ve faydalı yetenek de eklenmiş oyuna. Tabii mor küpümüz gibi eski yeteneklerimizi de oyunda ilerledikçe yavaş yavaş geri kazanıyoruz. Bütün bunları bir arada kullanarak karşımıza çıkan bulmacaları çözmeye çalışıyoruz.

Yeni yeteneklerden bazılarını sevsem de bazılarıysa eskilere rahmet okutuyor. Örneğin çift zıplama artık yok. Küpümüzün üstünden sekip daha yüksek yerlere ulaşabilme yeteneği de gitmiş. Onun yerine teleport topu atan yeni bir silahımız var. Her ne kadar işe yarar bir alet olsa da çift zıplama gibi çok kullanışlı, standart bir yeteneğin gitmesi beni üzdü.

Six Inches Under'ın en güçlü yanı her zamanki gibi keşif yönünün çok kuvvetli olması. Tam tüm haritayı keşfettiğinizi düşünmeye başladığınızda size yeni bir yetenek, yeni bir oyuncak veriyor ve bir anda daha önce hiç gidemediğiniz, hatta aklınıza bile gelmeyen yerlere gidebilmeye başlıyor, buralarda daha fazla yetenek, sandık, para ve eşya buluyorsunuz. Haritaya bakış açınız bile değişiyor. İlk oyundaki gibi yani...

Bu sefer plaj, madenler, banka gibi farklı farklı haritalar da var ve hepsi yeterince büyük ve dolu. En güzeli de oyunu bitirdiğinizde buraları dilediğiniz gibi dolaşıp kaçırdığınız şeyleri arayabilmeniz. Oyunun esprili yapısı, ünlü yapımlara göndermeleri, aslında bir oyuncak olduğunuzu durmadan hissettirmesi gibi şeyler de onu daha özel ve eğlenceli kılıyor.

Keşfetmeyi, bulmaca çözmeyi ve haritaların her köşesini araştırmayı sevenlere şiddetle tavsiyemdir 8/10

Daha fazla incelememe göz atmak isterseniz Steam Küratör sayfamı ziyaret edebilirsiniz: Pikselatör
 
mit
0
14 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
29.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 janvier 2022
Produit reçu gratuitement

Une aventure bourrée de référence dans la continuité de Supraland 1

Aujourd'hui signifie le jour de sortie de Supraland Six Inches Under, un DLC qui à pris plus de temps à réaliser que le jeu Supraland original. (16 mois contre 27 mois de travail).
Autant vous dire que c'est plus un Supraland 1.5 comme les développeurs aiment à l'appeler, et je suis entièrement d'accord avec eux ! Rappelons également que c'est une petite équipe de 6 personnes, dirigées par David Münnich qui est à l'origine de ce jeu. D'ailleurs chacun des développeurs ont créer deux zones, donc le jeu est très expérimental et différent au fil de l'avancement dans l'aventure !
C'est une suite parfaite, les mécaniques restent les mêmes, quand bien même vous allez découvrir de nouvelles interactions, de nouveaux sorts, et pleins d'autres références encore !
Si vous avez aimé Supraland, vous n'avez pas de raison de ne pas aimer cette suite.

Personnellement j'ai eu la chance de Beta Test le jeu pendant ces dernières semaines pour que le grand public ait accès à un jeu formidable.
Il est également important de signaler que vous n'avez pas besoin d'avoir joué au DLC "Crash" pour suivre et comprendre l'histoire du jeu : Les histoires de Crash et Six Inches Under se passent absolument pendant le même moment, vous aurez quelques passages avec des petites références au précédent DLC mais rien d'important !
Pour ceux qui tombent simplement sur ce jeu pour la première fois sans connaître Supraland, je vous invite CHAUDEMENT à jouer au jeu Original qui est dans mon Top 3 des meilleurs jeux auxquels j'ai joué dans ma vie, une pure partie de plaisir !
Egalement pour ceux qui aiment compléter les jeux à 100.00% et obtenir tous les succès Steam, Supraland et ces DLCs sont parfaitement réaliser de manière à atteindre le 100.00% sans se casser le crâne.
En comparaison a Supraland 1 je l'ai un peu moins apprécié, mais je l'ai préféré a "Crash". Le jeu original restera sur le sommet du monde selon moi, encore plus de liberté, un monde plus ouvert encore, des déplacements plus satisfaisant. Mais louper ce DLC serait quand même un crime...

Notes/20
Histoire : 14/20 -> L'histoire prend place après Supraland 1 toujours dans le bac à sable de l'enfant.
Malheureusement pour les petits habitants, un tremblements de terre va retentir, vous emmenant "Six Pieds sous Terre" et votre but sera de revenir à la surface. L'histoire sera le fil rouge qui vous guidera doucement mais soyons honnête, je me suis pas trop attardé là dessus, j'étais plutôt
Bande Son : 15/20 -> Ne vous attendez pas à avoir une musique qui ambiancera vos soirées quand vous la réécouterez en boucle sur YouTube, mais la bande son colle parfaitement au jeu, très posée, agréable.
Graphismes : 18/20 -> C'est sublimement beau, tout est si parfaitement réalisé sur les modèles, les effets de lumières, les couleurs, le level design. Je n'ai pas mis 20 car certaines textures en bord de map sont moins détaillées, sinon c'est un parfait !
Ambiance : 16/20 -> Cette ambiance enfantine, avec une musique très agréable, des blagues et des références partout... Une super aventure à partager en famille (j'en fais un peu beaucoup là?)
Prise en main : 19/20 ->Compatible Manettes/Clavier avec très peu de touches à retenir.
Difficulté Combats : 5/20 -> Ce sera le cadet de vos soucis, les monstres sont plutôt facile à abattre, c'est une partie de plaisir !
Difficulté Énigmes : 14/20 ->Les énigmes varient en terme de difficultés, mais certaines pourraient vous prendre plusieurs heures si votre cerveau surchauffe !
Bugs : 5/20 -> Il existe quelques problèmes de collisions avec certaines textures, et quelques bugs persistent, mais les prochaines semaines devraient corriger l'intégralité des bugs puisque les développeurs sont très à l'écoute

Note globale de 15/20.
 
PatateVolante

19.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 février 2023
This was a fun supraland+ experience, but it's no supraland 2. Overall, felt less puzzly than the original, and my familiarity with the original game created some frustration. I'd still recommend the game, but unfortunately due to negatively bias, I remember the frustrating parts way more than the fun bits. Definitely worth 10-15 dollars for the humor and exploration, but I would've been disappointed if I paid more than 20 dollars.

Some nitpicks: the developer struggles to establish a clear "gameplay language" for players to connect the dots between (as per the metroid formula) certain upgrades the player doesn't have yet, and obstacles they encounter. Some are more obvious, such as the color coded major power ups. Others, however, frustratingly offer no clues to the player that they can't do what they want yet. Usually related to issues of mobility, where the original game offers a double, then triple, jump quite early. Comparatively, this game suffocates the player to an extent. Players might find themselves pixels within reach of certain tasks, only to find that they need they need to come back with some upgrade. The margins of what you can and cannot do are too thin to be communicative or informative in some areas/"puzzles". The game also likes to pull new rules out of nowhere with little to no introductory element to communicate that mechanic. It simultaneously leans HEAVILY on players remembering niche mechanics from the original version, and punishes players who keep waiting for certain upgrades to come back only to find they aren't in the game at all.

Also, as with the original, the graphic demands seem WAY disproportional to the reality of the game. Unsure if the game is heavily un-optimized, or the modern unreal engine is just too beefy. I can run most of the games I play at 200+ fps, but my pc struggled to hit 60 fps sometimes. My computer would be considered reasonably old by now, but it's still disappointing.
 
[shx.wav]

Non recommandé
10.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 février 2022
Go play Supraland and the (fully patched) Crash DLC, and skip SIU.

SIU isn't a bad game, but it's undoubtedly far from the quality of its predecessors. A lot of bland or too easy "yeah yeah, going through the motions" puzzles, rare surprise A-HA moments, lacks world interconnected-ness, lacks creative puzzle mixing / layering.

Also, after several patches (I played 1.1.5585), it still has noticeably more tech/quality issues than I ever faced in Supraland or Crash:
  • I did encounter quite a few collision glitches (seeing inside models, weapon going through environment) and a few softlocks.
  • Got a puzzle (tower + glass cage + beam + electricity + anvil) whose solution I found was so pixel-finicky that it must have been an unintentional one.
EDIT I just read the devs post-mortem, and yeah, I agree on a lot of things mentioned there. Good read, and bravo for the self-criticism. This post-mortem now makes me feel my review is a bit harsh towards the team (as from what I read, what differentiates SIU from SL/Crash is that the direction was looser). But hey, looks like learning happened, so that's good, and probably bodes well to avoid the same mistakes in Supraworld. ♥ Suprateam.

0
Recommandé
20.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 janvier 2022
Supraland Six Inches Under

Supraland’in yeri benim için ayrıdır. Bu yeni oyunun da duyurulduğundan beri sabırsızlıkla çıkmasını bekliyordum. Çıktığı gün, vakit kaybetmeden hemen satın aldım ve ilk fırsatta oynadım. Önceki oyunlarda olduğu gibi bu oyunda da bütün gizemleri bulup oyunu %100 olarak bitirdim. Bu süreçteki tecrübelerimi sizinle paylaşmak istiyorum.

Bu incelemeyi okuyorsanız muhtemelen önceki oyundan haberdarsınızdır diye düşünüyorum. Eğer değilseniz, Supraland’e bir göz atmanızı öneririm. Oyunların arasında kısmen hikâye bağlantısı bulunuyor ve yeni oyunun birkaç yerinde, ilk oyuna ve DLC’sine esprili göndermeler yapılıyor.

Giriş
Metroidvania türünü ve bulmaca-macera oyunlarını seven bir oyuncuyum. Supraland de bu türlerin güzel bir sentezi olduğu için her oyununa olumlu ön yargılarla başladım ve severek bitirdim. Zaten bu sevimli grafiklere olumsuz şekilde yaklaşabilen var mıdır merak ediyorum :)

Supraland’in her oyunu, sıkılmadan saatler boyunca oynadığım nadir oyunlardandır. Genelde çoğu oyunda, belli bir zaman oynadıktan sonra mola verme ihtiyacı hissediyorum ama bu oyunlarda zamanın nasıl geçtiğini bile anlamıyorum.

Giriş kısmını bitirmeden önce şunu da söylemem gerekiyor; oyunun Steam sayfasındaki açıklama kısmında yazanlar, oyunun içeriğini birebir anlatıyor. Bu oyun hakkında fikir edinmek istiyorsanız mutlaka o kısmı okumalısınız. Bu şekilde ne beklediğinizi bilirseniz oyundan alacağınız keyif en üst düzeyde olacaktır.

Oynanış
İlk oyundan oynanış ve grafiksel olarak pek farkı olmasa da açıklama kısmında da yazıldığı üzere, düşman çeşitleri tamamen farklı ve her düşmanın zayıf yönleri bile var. Önceki oyunda olan silahlarla beraber tamamen farklı silahlar da mevcut. Savaşlar, ilk oyuna kıyasla daha zor ama çoğu opsyionel. Yani bu sefer daha az savaşa giriyorsunuz. Ayrıca böyle şirin bir oyunda hiç beklemediğim yerlerde 2-3 kere jump scare ile karşılaştım. Bu şekilde oyuna farklı bir heyecan katmak istemişler.

Bir de opsiyonel bulmaca bölümleri var. Bu bölümlerden bulduklarımız, ana hikâyeyi doğrudan etkilemeseler de bazı yerlerde işe yarayabilirler. Zaten çoğuna oyun bittikten sonra erişebiliyorsunuz. Oyunu bitirdikten sonra opsiyonel kısımlara da bakmanızı tavsiye ederim. Hele bir bölge var ki gerçekten beni şaşırtmıştı :)

Bu noktada olumsuz bir eleştiri yapmam gerekirse, opsiyonel olan bölümlerin optimizasyonu, ana hikâye kadar iyi yapılmamış gibi hissettim. Önceki oyunlarda da bunu hissetmiştim ama belki de sonradan düzeltiliyor olabilir. Genelde Supraland oyunlarını ilk çıktığında oynayıp bitirdiğim için ilk hâline göre değerlendiriyorum :)

Hikâye
Oyunda büyük bir yeri olan hikâye hakkında görüşlerimi ayrıca belirtmek istiyorum. Hikâyeyle ilgili en ufak bilginin bile spoiler olduğunu düşündüğüm için hikâyenin içeriği hakkında hiçbir şey söylemeyeceğim. Sadece, önceki Supraland oyunlarında olduğu gibi bu oyunun da hikâyesini beğendiğimi söyleyebilirim.

Supraland oyunlarının hikâyesi her zaman tatlı ve esprilerle dolu oluyor. Bütün oyunların arasında temelde bir bağlantı olsa da hepsinin hikâyesi birbirinden farklı oluyor. Bu oyunda da yine farklı ve merak uyandırıcı bir hikâyeyle baş başa kalıyoruz.

Oyunun açılışı beni etkilemişti ve içimde güzel duygular uyandırmıştı. Fakat hikâyeyi bitirdikten sonra ilginç bir şekilde oyundaki birçok içeriği görmemiş oluyoruz. Yani oyunun bittiğini kabul edemedim. Hatta hikâye bittikten sonra geldiğimiz bölgede, oyundan sonra kalan bu kadar içeriğin nasıl olur da DLC olmadığına dair gönderme olan bir diyalog bulunuyor.

Bunların yanında, yukarıda bahsettiğim gibi ana hikâyeden sonraki kısımlarda kendine özgü hikâyesi olan küçük opsiyonel yerler bile var. Bu durum, benim gibi bulmaca çözmeyi seven oyuncular için güzel olsa da oyunu %100 yapabilmek için ana hikâyeden kopuk bir şekilde geri kalan gizemleri çözmek pek hoşuma gitmedi açıkçası.

Sonuç
İncelememin sonuna doğru gelirken oyunda Türkçe dil desteğinin bulunduğunu da hatırlatmak istiyorum. Ayrıca fiyatının da diğer oyunlara göre gayet uygun olduğunu düşünüyorum. Kesinlikle fiyatını hak eden bir oyun.

Supraland Six Inches Under, benim için ilk oyun kadar iyi olmasa da Crash DLC’sinden daha iyi olduğunu söyleyebilirim. İlk oyunun yeri bende çok başkadır ama tarafsız baktığımda bile içerik, hikâye bütünlüğü, ilerleme şekli ve bulmaca tarzı olarak ilk oyunun en iyisi olduğunu söyleyebilirim.

Zaten açıklamada yazmışlar ama benim yazdıklarımdan da anlayacağınız gibi bu oyun biraz deneysel kalmış. Kendi fikrimce bir sonraki oyunun çok güzel olacağını, hatta şimdiye kadarki en kaliteli Supraland oyunu olabileceğini düşünüyorum. Yine de bu oyunu çok beğendim. Sıradaki oyunu da çıkar çıkmaz alıp %100 yapmayı heyecanla bekliyorum :)
 
Sirâyet

Évaluation publiée le 8 février 2022
如果你还不知道这个游戏有多么优秀，那么我可以给你分享几个成就相关的数据：
全球有62.9%的玩家获得了通关主线的成就，而更为苛刻的宝箱全收集成就也有14.5%的玩家获得了

考虑到游戏在类型、体量以及玩家数量等方面的区别，我们当然不能拿这个数据直接去与许多声名赫赫的好游戏做比较。但在这个游戏多如牛毛的时代，无数的游戏在喜加一后甚至没被玩家打开过，也有无数的游戏打开后只被玩家草草玩了几次便不再打开，离通关仍有很大差距，更别提去做收集

而Supraland Six Inches Under这个游戏，却能在现如今，吸引大半玩家在游玩后一路打到故事的结尾，且仍有相当多的玩家愿意进一步去寻找收藏品，并且最终成功全收集。这两个数字，想来很好地展示了这个游戏的优秀性

Wie auch schon im ersten Teil von Supraland heißt es hier wieder: Rätsel lösen, Truhen und Geheimnisse finden, Waffen und Werkzeuge verbessern und natürlich die Story verfolgen. Und wie gewohnt alles mit Witz, Charme und ganz viel logischem Denken. Knallbunt und wunderschön. Ich liebe den Humor des Spieles. Und die Rätsel sind sowas von genial. Spiel ist sehr unterhaltsam und absolut empfehlenswert!

Évaluation publiée le 15 janvier 2022
Overall you get more like the first game with new things and stuff (but less and better fightning), but with (in my opinion) better world building in terms of shortcuts. game performance and gameplay fluid and wonderful, like always.

There are some references from first game, but i would say its not requiered to be played beforehand, but you should do it if you did not, because its really awesome too.

Playing just for the story is maybe too short, so i recommend going for 90-100% collectibles to see all the places and stuff. The story ends a little too abruptly, but there is more to explore afterwards.

Recommandé
27.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 aout 2022
An upgrade and downgrade from the first game in many ways. The map can sometimes be a little frustrating to navigate considering that it's all underground and some areas are extremely cluttered. The combat has definitely improved from the first game, adding in new abilities and actually making the enemies used towards completion of puzzles as apposed to them just being there to stop you. Some puzzles are quite difficult to figure out but once you realize how to do them, they will leave you sitting there wondering if your brain is working. One of the things I absolutely love about these games is that it really enforces you to use your brain and heightens your situational awareness. The puzzles were definitely improved and were still a hell of a lot of fun to complete.

This game is still pretty short, but worth playing every second. I absolutely enjoyed the story, as well as achieving 100% completion. I love these games and I'm excited to see what else David and his team bring to Steam.
 
Federated [#N1]

Yotek
0
10 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
11.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 octobre 2022
This game isn't Supraland 2 as much as it's "Supraland 1.5", or maybe 1.7 and the original DLC would be 1.3? Anyway, point is, you should only consider playing this if you've beat the original Supraland - it's a direct sequel, both mechanically and story-wise. That also means I'll be comparing stuff to Supraland 1 a lot.

In a nutshell: it's still fun, but it has nowhere near the amount of charm of the original. It didn't make me want to explore after I was done with the game, some latter puzzles were frustrating (beat them all by myself, in the end), and collecting chests felt pretty meaningless, more on that later.

Also, while Supraland 1 was a story about nothing really, this one's central theme is... class struggle? Don't get me wrong: I very strongly agree with the premise. But it's delivered with the subtlety of a freaking sledgehammer to the face, and it even has the rich bad guy say that fair treatment of workers is socialism. This ridiculous talking point is generally used in that weird country with the guns that I forgot the name of, due to their history with the Red Scare. Can we... not propagate those ideas, even to make fun of them?

Anyway, let's talk about the game proper.

The World
I'd say the main draw of Supraland 1 was the fun, interesting world - with plenty of little nooks and crannies that contained treasure. The hidey holes are still there, perhaps even better than before. But the world itself... it feels very insular? Small? Compact? Instead of having one huge area that contains many interconnected sub-areas, Six Inches Under is split into a hub area and a few "levels". For the most part, they aren't interconnected at all. There usually will be no reason to return to a previously finished area except to collect all the treasures that you missed. Some might like this approach, but not me.

Still, that also means that for the most part all the interesting pieces of a level will be in one place. Streamlined? Perhaps, but also boring - at least to me. Then again, I like walking sims, so rambling around is something I enjoy; you might not. The exploration aspect is just... not there.

On the other hand, the design is tight. It's pretty clear a lot of thought went into constructing the set pieces, especially when it comes to forcing you into a specific solution to a puzzle. Some might find this annoying, but I can't help but respect the way the game tells you "No, that's wrong. Find another way."

The Combat and The Chest Problem
This is probably the biggest change from the main game. There are no enemy spawners, no roaming baddies (for the most part); instead, the fights are taking place in designated arenas, and once you get rid of the enemies, they're gone. That allows the game to focus on the puzzles, which always was what Supraland was really about.

However: This, I feel, clashes greatly with one of the main appeals of Supraland 1 - collecting chests. See, chests always contain either some kind of upgrade, or money that you can use to buy upgrades in the shop. It's all about upgrades. Upgrades to what?

To your combat capabilities.

So even though the combat isn't really in the foreground anymore, you're still awarded for exploration with things like crit chance, extra health, ammo for your gun (which regenerates almost instantly anyway)... once you realise this, finding chests becomes a lot less exciting.

I feel like - considering the game's leftist undertone - this is a bit of a wasted opportunity. Near the hub area, there's an encampment of people cast out due to having no money, e.g. the homeless. Wouldn't it be nice if the chests contained gold that you could donate to help them build a better home? Everybody loves that kind of stuff. Or things like facility blueprints for clean water (they only have sewage). I want to get this chest so I can finally build Lv3 water processing plant and proper beds! I wish.

The Puzzles and The Tools
Here I feel like the design is much tighter - if a bit more difficult. Six Inches Under contains some of the same tools as Supraland 1, but it also has its own additions. In general, though, I felt as if I've seen a lot of that stuff before; many puzzles rely on the same old tools, even if used a bit differently.

What's nice is that there are these speakers next to the more difficult puzzles which tell you if you have all the tools that you need for this puzzle. This was also the case in the first game, but here they're more prevalent, and that's a good thing - you won't smash your head against a wall that you can't break.

Conclusion
Towards the end, the game kind of just fizzled out. I still beat it, but the ending caught me off guard - I guess I expected more? Especially since the last two areas were not that fun to me.

The writing is still great, maybe even better. There are unapologetic ♥♥♥♥ jokes, balls jokes, making fun of all sort of capitalist tropes. The game even makes fun of the first game's protagonist, highlighting his general "devil may care" attitude to, well, everything and everyone. This game's protagonist, Plumber "Indiana Jones" the Blue, is much more of a people's hero - well loved by everyone. That's also nice.

In the end, your enjoyment of the game depends on what you like about Supraland. Did you love the puzzles? This game's a refinement in that area. Did you like adventuring in the big world? That's what got downscaled. I liked the latter, so this one's a bit of a disappointment. See you in Supraworld, I guess.

Curator page
 
Vitlök
978 produits enregistrés

Évaluation publiée le 15 janvier 2022
Все тот же безумный Supraland, наполненный пасхалками, загадками и секретами. Пусть даже это и небольшая затравка перед второй частью, но сделана добротно и в духе серии. Темп игры все так же держит в тонусе, головоломки приятные, а персонажи все такие же колоритные. Думаю на этом этапе игра постепенно уходит от зельдовской романтики и выходит на остросоциальную сатиру, начало чего уже было положено еще в первой части. Играется бодро, впечатления суперские - рекомендую.

Помните! Не трогайте ничьи горячие шары и не пытайтесь разжечь костер, воткнув в него меч. Веселитесь)

ZachIsGreat
0
10 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
18.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 aout 2022
It's the most average parts of Minecraft, Mario and Zelda combined into one game.

Positives:
- A world of small objects is fun to explore, like jumping up lego bricks, magnetizing to nails and forks, and throwing around batteries.
- Going through the world multiple times to see if you missed things does not feel like a chore because there are a lot of movement upgrades that remove all of the early-game hurdles. It also helps that the world has a nice structure with a central town and areas branching out from there. With this and the help of the map (which you can draw on), you can easily keep a checklist of what parts you explored and where you think secrets are.
- There are a fair bit of neat references from other games and funny internet things.

Neural:
- A story about capitalism ... blrgh, I want to get away from those topics in my free time ... at least it's kept somewhat funny.
- It doesn't have the "wow" of the first Supraland. There, you can always look up, see the sky, the house, and sometimes the kid. You constantly get a sense for how small everything is inside the sandbox. Six Inches Under is (as the name suggests) mostly caves which are dark and labyrinthian and overall pretty bland.

Negatives:
- The overall progression is awful. The main story content houses about 50% of the collectibles (if you collect most things you come across), the rest is going out of your way to collect what's left after the credits.
- The main problem with this are the upgrades. From the hidden chests you mostly get combat upgrades (damage, attack rate, stun duration, ...) but there are ZERO difficult enemy encounters. By the time you collect most of them (after the credits), there are zero encounters period. Also you get a lot of health but you die in one hit anyways if you fall into lava (which you will often), so another basically pointless 20% of collectibles. You collect all of that for nothing. There is no ultimate battle or something that tests you on how much you collected or gives you an absurdly difficult challenge if you instead breezed through the game.
 
01proco
242 produits enregistrés
0
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
18.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 janvier 2022
Difficulté : 2.5/5 (Un peu dur)
Global : 4.5/5 (Excellent)

Supraland est de retour pour une seconde dose de FUN!

Dans cet opus, on retrouve le même principe que dans le premier Supraland : on explore une zone, on résout des puzzles pour trouver des améliorations qui débloquent la zone suivante etc. Le scénario et les personnages sont toujours bourrés d'humour et de références (on incarne le plombier du royaume cette fois d'ailleurs).

L'exploration est toujours extrêmement mise en avant avec un tas de secrets et coffres/pièces optionnels a trouver un peu partout et de zones à revisiter, un bonheur pour les complétionnistes.

Néanmoins la grosse amélioration par rapport au premier Supraland, c'est la dissociation du combat et des énigmes : fini les ennemis qui apparaissent sans arrêt dans toutes les zones et les tombes! Désormais il suffit de les tuer une seule fois, ils sont aussi plus intéressants à affronter et nécessitent des variations dans les armes utilisées (pas comme le bourrinage au pistolet du premier jeu...) Bien évidemment les combats ne sont malgré tout pas durs, ce n'est clairement pas le but.

Les énigmes ne sont pas redondantes avec Supraland 1, on partage quelques améliorations mais il y a largement assez de nouveautés et de choses faites différemment. Elles sont ingénieuses mais jamais difficiles, du moins dans l'histoire principale. Attention petit spoil! En effet il y a du contenu postgame cette fois-ci, et c'est clairement plus difficile que le reste (personnellement j'adore ça donc c’était un vrai plaisir et une très bonne surprise).

Les décors sont totalement différents vu qu'on est cette fois sous terre et non à la surface, et sont toujours aussi magnifiques. Les musiques collent toujours très bien au jeu.

Voilà, encore un excellent jeu qui incarne toujours aussi bien la définition du fun. En tout cas si Six Inches Under n'est qu'un DLC rallongé, ça promet sérieusement pour Supraworld. Et j'espère vraiment que la série gagnera en popularité, elle le mérite clairement.

Can't wait for Supraworld!

Non recommandé
29.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 janvier 2022
С удовольствием прошёл предыдущие части, но эта часть быстро утомила.

Боевая система очень сильно раздражает, так как она рассчитана на ближний бой. Дальнобойное оружие, в основном оглушает, затем приходится подходить и добивать киркой... Особенно раздражают летающие враги. Новые враги какие-то странные, не вписываются в настроение игры... особенно бесит пень :D

Финал наступает очень быстро, а дополнительный контент после него очень утомляет: сюжет перестаёт существовать, у персонажа мало способностей (по сравнению с первой частью) и ты понимаешь, что больше их и не будет, в секретных сундуках практически всегда золотые монеты, которые не на что тратить.

Я считаю, что смещение баланса в пользу исследования отрицательно сказалось на игре (DLC), потому что потерялась мотивация прокачивать персонажа и становиться более сильным и ловким.... а просто собирать монетки очень скучно.

Поставил "Не рекомендую", чтобы разработчик увидел комментарий.
 
bezzvuka
1
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
19.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 mai 2023
This is pretty much a straight upgrade from the first, already impressive, one. The puzzles and secrets are pretty excellent, there's fast travel (on top of movement stuff allowing you to go faster backtracking anyway), and at some point if you're a completionist there are tools to help you without having to scour every tiny pixel or consult a guide. There are a lot of puzzles where you'll just suddenly go "OH" and that even might unlock some other things you missed or weren't sure about an hour ago. I would say none of the required ones are too bad or frustrating at all.

Some of the optional / super secret puzzles do get frustrating, often requiring some unique interaction that maybe you could have accidentally discovered earlier but wasn't needed for anything, or straight up wasn't really usable outside of the secret area (something with the force beam stands out here).

My sole complaint against the first game was the combat - it felt tacked on, and at best pointless but more often annoying. I like a good combat game but it just seemed like it didn't need to exist. In the sequel, there is less combat overall, and it's more contained to arenas. That's an improvement, but at the end of the game I still felt like the only times I wasn't entertained were the combat bits. It again just begs the question of "why is this here?". There are plenty of great exploration / puzzle games with no combat (Sheepo springs to mind), and while there was ONE puzzle that did use enemies as part of the solution, that's not really worth the payoff. Considering the reduced frequency (and increased power you have to deal with them) it's less annoying less often but still feels pointless, but certainly not enough to recommend against the game.
 
Un développeur ou une développeuse a répondu à cette évaluation
Insanitys Muse
1,698 produits enregistrés

4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
14.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 juin 2022
Thoroughly enjoyed the original game (Though never played the DLC) And despite having played both that game and this one to completion; I can't say that Six Inches Under really comes close enough to the same enjoyment the original did. The end credits comes too soon (managed to get there about 6 hours in with 38% progress, and while the game does advertise having significantly more post-credits content, I don't think it's necessarily a fair assessment when it feels like it has much less pre-credits content, It does a very poor job tutorializing you on certain features in some areas; did you know that you can now place your force cube in lava and use it as a platform? the game certainly doesn't tell you, despite this not being a feature of the first game. Some of the major upgrades (fire redistributor) and more significant minor (elastic beam) are completely optional unless/until going for 100% the game itself also being advertised as Supraland 1.5 rather than 2.0 i feel is fair

All in all the game is enjoyable for the same reasons as the first, the fun of just messing around, exploring, puzzle solving, The story is lacking but that is not a strong complaint. When comparing the game to the first I personally can't recomend it unless on sale

p.s if you do want to go for 100%, for the sake of your own sanity just look up the location of the last chest, You won't find it with the (upgraded) chest detector alone
 
Deiidream
0
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
35.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 janvier 2022
パズルのヒントやリリース直後のバグなどを掲載しています。よければご参考に。

＜プレイ結果＞
本ストーリーは12時間でクリア。その時点で進行状況は40%程度。パワーアップ購入は半分にも満たない。全クリアは33時間かかりました。

＜感想＞
まごうことなきSupralandのDLC的続編。前作が楽しめたなら今回もきっと楽しめるはず。前作をしてない方でも、パズル好き・探索好きは楽しめるはずですが、ぜひ前作もプレイしていただきたい。ほぼ満点に近いですが、あえての不満点だけを記載しておきます

・進行上、エリアに閉じ込められてそこをクリアしないと次に進めないし前に戻れない場面が幾つかある
・岩陰など画面の一部が不必要に暗い。パープルのキューブを生成（LBボタン押しっぱなし）でライト代わりにはなりますが、やや面倒。
・敵はリスボーンしないがなんだかんだで戦闘は結構ある。
・一部パズル（というかシークレットエリア）へのアクセスが未だに謎。力技で解いた。
・最終的にコインが余る
・ラストボスとの戦いが、前作ではパズルの総決算といった演出だったのに、今回は普通の戦闘に終始してしまっていた。これが最も残念。

＜ヒント＞
前作プレイ済なので舐めてましたが、パズルによってはかなり難しくなっています。私が詰まったパズルの幾つか進め方のヒントを挙げておきます


・NPCのセリフはちゃんと聞こう。
・困っている人を助けるといいことがあります。温泉が冷たい人とかいろいろ。
・主人公の色は青です。ライフの回復も青い液体を浴びることで回復する設定です。この青を覚えておきましょう。
・前作をプレイしているとドハマリするパズルがあります。色を変えることに固執していると解けないものも。
・マッチ棒はマッチ箱をこする以外でも火が付きます。火があるところに近づいてみてください。
・一部の敵が持つ盾は木製です。盾と木材、盾同士で繋げたりもできます。
・パラソルの上でジャンプしたあと、しゃがむボタンを押してみよう
・NPCのキックは強力で、緑のトランスロケーターも蹴っ飛ばしてしまう
・溶岩エリアの進み方はけっこう力技。
・ビーチの船の鍵が見つからない場合は上から下まで探そう。
・フォースビームでくっつけたもの同士を引っ張る技、意外なところで使う
・フォースビームの上にもフォースキューブが乗る。ビームを消せばキューブが真下に落ちる。

＜バグなど＞
リリース直後にあったバグを下記に残しておきます。同様の不具合がある場合はアップデートや設定を見直してみてください。

・工場エリアのレースにて、相手が一切走らないバグ
・金庫エリアにて、ステラコイルを手に入れた際の敵との戦いが終わらない。
　（正しい終わり方は、相手にショックを与えてその隙につるはし攻撃で倒せる）
　何度かゲーム自体を起動しなおすと倒せるようになりました。バグ対応された？
・序盤で土管に登れない。
・ゲーム起動時に、モニターの解像度とデフォルトの設定が一致しない。これは初代でもあった現象です。カクカクしている場合は一度確認を。ちなみに水平にノイズのようなズレが生じる場合はV-syncをオンにしましょう
・パフォーマンス情報がデフォルトでONになっている
・日本語訳が一部変。
・エリア外のエリアの、「緑のりんご」のセリフ

Salvatore
236 produits enregistrés
0
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
36.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 mars 2022
As a big fan of the first Supraland (first game I cared about achieving 100% status), I was very excited for Six Inches Under. And, let me tell you, I was not disappointed. The game is almost as good as the first: good narrative adressing basic social issues, good ratio between combat, puzzle and exploration (as promised), engaging progression and nice music. The only setback is that it suffers from the same problems of almost any sequel: the difficult balance between inovation and continuation. The first Supraland, being the first, was literally awesome: everything was seen for the first time, producing a great feeling of amazement. While this second game was... well... more Supraland. Consistently, more GOOD Supraland. If you enjoyed the first one, go for it, you won't regret it. But still... I kinda missed that feeling of amazement, that made exploration much more interesting in the first game. I know it's hard to make a sequel maintaining a strong feeling of novelty, so I wouldn't say Six Inches Under is flawed, especially considering it was originally planned to be just a DLC. But bear in mind that you're gonna have just that: more of good old Supraland, with just a bit of recontextualization.
 
pratodeossos
0
20 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
6.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 janvier 2022
A very middle of the road thumbs up review for this installment of Supraland. While the main storyline puzzles are great, the experience is rather short lived; I saw the credits after 5 hours and approximately 29% completion! While you might think "wow, there's still a lot of puzzles left even after the credits", these puzzles are certainly more experimental and at times hard to follow due to wide open spaces or poorly lit corridors. Lastly, while there is "way less combat" than the first game, it's still 100% too much combat. Seriously, an option to disable all combat encounters would be a welcome addition as the only thing that the scripted wave-based encounters provides is a short padding to runtime.
 
oh!mg
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
14.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 mai 2023
100％撒花！这作的全收集大约在15h左右（前作是20h+dlc10h，仅个人数据供参考x）
打完前作大约半年后才来玩的1.5，然后看到连新作（Supraworld）的预告都出了，时间过得真快啊哈哈（x
但这作充斥着和前作联动的小彩蛋，各种经典的致敬，以及原汁原味的各种npc的破墙对话（很少见到有游戏能像这样让npc破墙得如此自然如此合情合理的哈哈哈），一下子就挑起了玩前作时的回忆，这系列真的很棒很喜欢！

首先要表扬的是，这作在战斗方面的变动还挺大的，全都改成了固定触发式的一次性战斗，在做别的探索解谜的时候不用被随机刷出的野怪干扰了，也不用为了100％通关做恶心的跑全图清墓碑了，真的非常棒！（不过同时也没法用野怪刷钱了，只能老老实实探索捡钱xd 不过钱也完全够用还会溢出很多所以不用担心）并且对不同怪的处理也做了区分，加入了一些解谜要素，非常不错。（通关后的一个地区还要靠野怪特性来进行解谜，这个设计也让我挺惊喜的w）

解谜不算太难，初见的机制或者比较难想的地方都会有npc给提示，所以整体游玩体验也很流畅。特别是玩过前作的话，因为很多能力都熟悉过了，会解得更快一些w。最终boss也依然是结合学过的所有能力的大型解谜（期末考试？），非常满足！

这作的全收集似乎难度比前作稍微低了一些…？（好像）也或许是俺已经接受这样的设定了所以会习惯性地去探索一些刁钻的角落（恶堕成抖m了呢）（苦笑）。值得一提的是通关后的内容还挺丰富的，有好几个在通关后才能到达的隐藏区域，甚至有一个能力都得在通关后才能获取。在获得通关成就时，看到它的成就描述上写着：“你大概只完成了50%”，然后我打开统计界面一看，哈，49％（）伤害性不大，但侮辱性极强。jpg
顺便，这作买不到前作的那种超高五段跳（幸福）了，后期只能依靠宝箱里开出的三段跳来提供一些探索上的便利。好在这作各个小地图都有管子和主城连通，通关后再回去摸箱子也挺方便的。（虽然最后一两个箱子仍然让我找得头疼但大部分都比较好找，多观察周围就是x

最后稍微提一下，这作似乎优化不太行（？）至少我的小破机子在战斗的时候会比较严重地掉帧。但就游戏内容来说，应该算是个比较合格的大型dlc了（？）（至少比前作的dlc好太多了，我记得那个剧情单调解谜还难收集更恶心）
总之推荐玩过前作Supraland的朋友尝试！如果没玩过前作但是能忍受解谜的时候野怪四处跑的话更推荐先体验前作！www
 
Titlark

Évaluation publiée le 9 mars 2022
满分10分打7分，比起前作在谜题上有所创新，游戏也是好游戏，但比不上一代那么经典。
因为有一半道具和一代一样，开宝箱时没有那么多的惊喜感。新道具在解密上远没有一代用法那么灵活，某些道具大量使用，而其他道具使用场合非常有限。说的就是你，电电枪
战斗方面的改动感觉一般，战斗难度低加上类似关卡的模式，我没有体验到获取战斗方面的升级以及战斗力提升虐怪的快感。战斗有关的升级比如生命值暴击率稿子穿透什么的让我觉得比较鸡肋。
优点的话，地图非常有用，是个很不错的功能。

Recommandé
16.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 juillet 2022
Overall = 7/10

It’s more Supraland, which is massive praise in itself, but this time, comes with some caveats. It’s more clever puzzles, open world exploration and spongy combat, but it all feels a bit too similar to what has come before. It’s the same process of unlocking the same tools to access more areas - there were no real surprises, no “aha!” moments and only a few moments where I was completely stumped as to how to progress. The combat has improved, but is still the weakest part of the game.

The story is fun and moral, but felt a lot more political this time around with hardly any gags. Too much of the content was post campaign - you get a fair amount of great content and some really great sequences, but spending 3 times as long collecting meaningless upgrades and money feels like a bad choice and was a chore at times. The additional areas weren’t as good either; some large and devoid of content, others like ‘cutting room scraps’. It’s also less polished than the other games, with characters clipping through each other, music playing over itself, and frequently getting stuck in the floor. Although still colourful, a lot of the areas were noticeably not made of toys or household items, the thing that made the series originally distinctive.

It sounds quite negative, but only because the bar is set so high. It’s a fun, entertaining, innovative and enjoyable game with its own charm and style and I definitely recommended it if you enjoyed the others, but the next game needs to be longer and go back to its roots, remembering what made it so special.
 
Substancer

i can't remember, that i needed any walkthrough or help on the first one...i really enjoyed it. for this one on the other hand i needed so much help, that i felt stupid and had no fun at all.

credits roll at 38 %, although i tried to collect and do everything i can. i guess you can go back looking for coins and chests, but to be honest, i am glad it is over. the puzzles were just not intuitive or logical to me.

for the first time in more than 30 years of gaming i did throw my controller trying to traverse that lava section.

i see all the positive reviews and i am happy for the small developer that the game is liked a lot, but it didn't work for me.

Non recommandé
14.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 janvier 2022
Not anywhere near as good as the first. I've been stuck trying to solve puzzles not realizing that bugs were preventing me from executing the mechanic. The game is far shorter than the first one, the claim for this is that in 6IU 60-70% is post game secrets and puzzles where as in the first game most of the puzzles were from the main quest. When I played the first game, my face would light up with a smile upon solving a puzzle because it made you feel clever. You were constantly using all the tools you had in the first game to solve puzzles while in this game you are given a electric gun! I shot one thing with it and that was it.... that was the only puzzle using that gun. Its so annoying because when I got the gun I was expecting to solve puzzles with it... nope it was just for combat. There were times, in the first game, where you had to combine two of your tools to solve a puzzle and use them in ways you didnt even realize, like, using your gun and beam together to shoot purple projectiles. In this game you combine your beam... with the cube... by putting it on top of the beam (you thought i was gonna say that you could attach the beam to the cube? No of course you cant do that, that would be ridiculous). Now the first game didnt do the best with the giving you great rewards for finding well hidden chest but even still, most of the chest you found in the first game contained something helpful for the player. Here you find tons of Health, Throw Pen, Throw Distance, Throw Sp.... why? There is, like, almost no combat in this game. If you havent played the first game yet I'd recommend that one instead, even with its flaws I'd argue that its a better supraland game, but if you have and want more supraland... Crash DLC maybe? IDK i didnt play it. This game is fun when it comes to the campaign but its a shame that it doesnt last very long, maybe 6 hours give or take.

Recommandé
12.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 juillet 2023
Supraland Six Inches Under takes players on another whimsical and clever adventure, where it brilliantly satirizes the concepts of capitalism and socialism with its sharp and witty humor. The game's engaging story, filled with quirky characters and imaginative scenarios, keeps players entertained and immersed throughout their journey. As players navigate the vibrant world, the improved map navigation compared to its predecessor streamlines exploration, ensuring a seamless and enjoyable experience that allows them to fully focus on the challenging puzzles and humorous interactions.

The puzzles in Supraland Six Inches Under shine with their ingenuity and diversity, offering a range of brain-teasers and physics-based challenges that captivate and reward players upon their successful completion. To aid players through the journey, the game *sometimes* provides helpful hints, striking a balance between difficulty and enjoyment. Additionally, the introduction of new abilities injects freshness into the sequel, providing innovative ways to approach obstacles and fostering a sense of creativity and agency. But certainly, there will be times that you will be befuddled.

While the game boasts numerous strengths, it does have a few shortcomings. The limited number of mimic chests is good in terms of how they are placed, however I think there should be a few others. Furthermore, the game's shorter length might disappoint those seeking a lengthier adventure. Additionally, some minor issues with buggy item movements could briefly frustrate players during gameplay. Despite these flaws, Supraland Six Inches Under remains a delightful and thought-provoking experience, inviting players to explore a fascinating world that cleverly intertwines humor and social critique.

Additional note: Using pipe for blocking water does not work on the bank stage to smuggle burnt gold (it is not implemented, despite being used on Fire Relocator),

Évaluation publiée le 17 novembre 2023
It's an amazing game, but at least for me it dims a little compared to the first game. Combat, although a bit different, still feels like the weakest link as it did in the first, but now there is less of it. For some it may be better like that, but for me it really diminished the value of finding combat related rewards. I'm pretty sure there are more combat related upgrades/powerups than there are enemy encounters in the game, so by the end of the game finding 15th hp upgrade felt shallow, especially when it basically does not matter outside of combat because other hazards barely exist or kill you instantly (falling into lava).
But yeah, this is the biggest nitpick in the game, which means this game is still awesome.
