Évaluation publiée le 15 avril 2022
Solid sequel to the original game. If you enjoyed Supraland and its DLC, then you will love this. Otherwise, I would probably recommend trying that first. I personally could play any number of sequels Supra throws at me, I love their style of gameplay and humor. The game doesn't babysit you and has a great balance of exploration and puzzle solving. I love how the game rewards exploration and also is very completionist friendly.

The only negative thing I'd have to say about this game is the combat. The description says "5% combat", but honestly if anything, I'd say it had almost more than the first game. The combat part felt tacked on and unnecessary.
 
P
1,933 produits enregistrés
0
8 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
11.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 janvier 2022
Aight, I'll preface by saying, I've never written a review before, also I'm bad at English. It will be mostly spoiler-free. Gonna mark the stuff that contains significant spoilers or something
If you want to complain about language usage or ♥♥♥♥♥♥ grammar feel free to do so and I may just even fix it. Please notify me if anything about the review is unclear and I'll do my best attempt to fix it.

Supraland Six Inches Under is more like the OG Supraland than the Crash DLC. First and foremost, you don't play as the protagonist from the first game but, you'll meet him on multiple occasions.

Story
The story is what I'd call meh. In the Supraland and the Crash DLC, you had a clear goal. In Supraland the goal was to confront the blue people about why they destroyed the red people's water source. The blue people have a water shortage and have decided to siphon off the water that was allocated to the red. Being the hero, you solve the problem for good. The objective being. Go to the blue kingdom and figure out wtf they are doing with the water and then be redirected to the source of the water shortage.
In Crash the story is simple. Explore, collect scrap, fix the rocket.
The story in Six Inches Under, after a brief tutorial that feels like something the dev team scrambled to make since it became a standalone entity. The tutorial happens concurrently with the "Rackening", which results in you being... well, six inches under the surface. You'll be confined under the surface until you beat the story. The content on the surface is minuscule. There is a Trophy area that reminds of the red coin area from Crash. It feels like an area with puzzles they couldn't fit anywhere else, which is sad since it's the zone with the most demanding puzzles of the entire game. You'll come across a multi-floored hamster cage. Each floor has a different social class, and it's your job to climb to the top to confront the baron who's siphoning all the money from the other classes. Which sounds ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ cool, but it just falls short since it wasn't fleshed out. Would have liked it ALOT more if something noteworthy happened. There are 3 floors in total, and you do the exact same thing on each floor if something like when you entered the blue kingdom from the first game happened, and you lost your equipment. Imagine if you were kicked off the top floor, and you had to find a different way to climb back up, but no. Progress further and out of nowhere, you reach the end. It felt like I had chessed something and gotten to the end a few hours before I normally should have, but nope. This "battle" is trivial, has a neat mechanic, and I enjoyed it a lot. Don't know how to word it, so I won't bother to try, but it feels like the NPC's control the actions you take. Sorta like mandatory side-quests.



Difficulty
The difficulty of the puzzles in the game is easy compared to the other two games. I got stomped on some later puzzles in the other two games. I got stuck for an hour or two while fighting the final boss in Supraland. I had a lot of problems in one of the loops in Crash getting to the city.
The 2 most notable puzzles in Six Inches Under is the Chest under the lava, it took me ages for my monkey brain to figure out you could rotate the jump pad,
The other being close to the aforementioned puzzle having to make cube go through 3 gates one of them being separated from the other ones, had to place a line to prevent the box from falling down, so the cooldown for the ability could refresh, so the box could be placed to activate the other 2 gates right after the only time in the game where I had to do something with the cooldown.
Another one was the bones on top of the white rock. I cheesed it, but from the achievement I got, I figured out how to do it legitimately. Maybe make those achievements hidden or something.
The thing I spent the most time on was trying to get the double jump thingy. You encounter the protagonist from the first game, and you see him open a chest. Observing the chest, you observe an ability that looks like a double-jump, with no way to enter the room. Earlier I discovered a way out of bounds. I went out of bounds and tried to find an entrance, couldn't find one. I took a break and returned to the room where you could see the ability. However, it had disappeared... SAD.
And this is after marathoning the game to 100% completion. Should have
more memorable puzzles but, ehh.



The feeling of being rewarded and mobility
This game suffers from the same problem as Crash, the rewards from exploring isn't nice, you get a bunch of coins but nothing to spend them on 100%+ damage to your guns I don't use the guns to fight enemies, ammo capacity and reload speed why not, nothing of the sort of increasing the firing speed until it becomes a laser or having near-infinite amounts of ammo capacity, just a little goodie and a clap on the shoulders. Not really any other way to put it just disappointed by the lack of excitement I had for when I found an unopened chest.
couple that up with lack of more mobility options like double jump, faster-walking speed, maybe an ability that unlocks running or something. Just feels sad compared to Supraland, this might also just be a fault of me and holding Supraland to that high of a standard.


The game has a nice atmosphere and sense of wonder when you initially start the game like all the other games from this series.


Definitely a Supraland game, But far from the original.
 
Nexsysis
1,653 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
11.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 janvier 2022
A Worthy Half-Sequel

Six Inches Under was originally designed to be released as Supraland’s second DLC, and with multiple direct story references to both Supraland and Crash, it’s easy to see the connection. While the main campaign is notably shorter than the first game, this is offset by a generous amount of post-game and optional content which more than justifies a standalone release. As promised on the Steam page, about half of the tools in the player’s arsenal are series mainstays, and the new abilities feel like natural complements to the existing toolset. There’s nothing too revolutionary on display with the game’s mechanics, but this hits the perfect sweet-spot I would expect for a “1.5” entry in the series.

As expected for a Supraland title, the world is beautifully designed and well-populated with charming characters. The puzzles are high quality, and I never once felt stuck or frustrated during my playthrough. That’s not to say that the solutions were always easy to come by: There’s a varied mix of difficulty on display. However, by making more of the game’s content available to be explored at the player’s own pace rather than directly linked to story progression, at any point in time there’s several alternate puzzles for you to tackle and then return with a fresh perspective.

Combat has a reduced presence in Six Inches Under but is integrated much more thoughtfully than in prior entries. Most combat encounters are now either entirely optional or slightly tucked away to offer a nice surprise without hindering the flow of the game’s puzzle elements. The enemies on display are also all new to the series, each with their move sets and weaknesses. While this extra variety is a welcome improvement over previous installments, the novelty of switching weapons to land a stun and then back to my main damage-dealer wore a bit thin as I approached the game’s end. I also experienced some stuttering during combat sequences, which I never encountered in either the original Supraland or Crash. However, neither of these were serious enough issues to decrease my enjoyment of the game, and I look forward to seeing how combat is further refined in Supraland 2.

Having been disappointed by the repetitive nature of the last Supraland entry, Crash, I was delighted to find that Six Inches Under exceeded my expectations in almost every regard. The Supra Games team has clearly been incorporating community feedback, and the result is a game that retains all the appeal of the original while further balancing combat and player freedom for a more polished experience. This is an easy recommend for both existing fans and newcomers, although I would still highly suggest playing through the first game both to fully appreciate some of the gags and to better ease into the game’s mechanics.
 
Frillard
627 produits enregistrés
0
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
1
Recommandé
52.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 janvier 2022
Ну что сказать ? Слов нет, одни эмоции, при том исключительно положительные.
- Первое, что хочу сказать, и это просто невероятно: этот разработчик игр ценит и помнит тех, кто играл в прошлые игры. Для тех кто шарит во вселенной, помнит прошлые приключения и любит быть "перфекционистом", оставили столько отсылок и пасхалок, что чувство эйфории разорвет вас в клочья, не оставив даже намека на негатив и печаль. Синергия с приключениями красного Принца (нас в дополнении Crash), это вообще отдельная тема, доставляющая эстетическое удовольствие в лучших традициях Нолана.
- Второе же... это прекрасная игра, с прекрасной сатирой, невероятной атмосферой и не особо глубоким сюжетом, но тем не менее весьма интересным и занимательным.
- Новые механики изобилуют отсылками и рофлами, графика все такая же приятная и стилистически подходчщаяя миру.
- Юмор - одна из главнейших плюсов данной серии. Ломание четвёртой стены тут не то что в порядке вещей, кажется что никакой стены нет, а фантомные воспоминания о ней есть лишь у нас.
- Локации... их не много... их дохренища! И все разнообразные, красивые, интересные, наполенные контентом и... БОЛЬШИЕ!
- Музыка все такая же милая и приятная, саундтек начального города все так же в моем сердечке, варум-варум, как же без него, и ещё ворох отличного аудио, попадающего в атмосферу локаций. Темы битв немного подкачали, на мой взгляд.
- Геймплей и свобода все такие же, право игрока на исследование все так же поощряется и вознаграждается. Если вы новичок, ситуации, когда вы случайно залезли куда-то не туда, куда разработчик не планировал вас пускать, будут возникать частенько, однако всякий раз вас будет ждать подтверждение того, что даже в самое труднодоступное место, вас привели за ручку разработчики, подсунув сундучок, монетку, или персонажа, который ехидно напомнит вам о смысле жизни, фелигранно разбив ещё парочку четвёртых стен.
- Есть и пара минусов: мало, хачу исчо, мне мала! Ну второй минус - цена... мне кажется, она занижена, если судить по современным меркам. Это все шутки, ясное дело, но минусов я найти не смог, уж простите... не помню, чтобы я от чего-то был не в восторге...
...и что самое интересное, по сути, это лишь начало, всвязи с показанными ранее ассетами второй части, которая получила название "Supraworld", нас ждет нечто ещё более замечательное и большое. Что уж говорить, все мы хотим попасть в дом... а разработчики уже там и готовят нам новую потрясающую " песочницу", хоть и без песка. Жду не дождусь! :)
 
Норд Берленски
2
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
23.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 janvier 2022
Ждал продолжения Supraland'a больше, чем чего либо в игровой индустрии в 2022-ом году. Серьезно. Без шуток. По сути, лично для меня вторая часть стала игрой года еще до того как вышла. Здесь есть всё то, за что фанаты Супраленда его и любят, плюс, добавили несколько новых механик, и даже новое оружие. В продолжении нас всё так же ждет классный сюжет, отличные головоломки и уморительные шутки. Приятно, что после прохождения основного сюжета есть еще доп.локации, где можно еще зависнуть на некоторое время. Игру я проходил неспешно, старался собирать все сундуки, но как же я офигел, когда после прохождения основной компании мне сказали что игра пройдена только на 48%. Куда они запихнули столько сундуков и даже и не знаю. Искать все, я, конечно же, не стал, но перфекционистам и адептам 100%-х прохождений предстоит пройти нелегкий путь в поисках оных. За всю игру попалось 2 неприятных бага. Один из которых был критичный с откатом сохранения в самом финале. При чем о том, что это баг, я понял после того, как потратил примерно час на поиски выхода с локации, и посмотрев в итоге прохождение на ютубе. Но если не брать в расчет эти баги, то придраться даже не к чему. Одни только плюсы: красивая графика, проработанные интересные локации с разными фишками и "приколюхами", сражения с новыми противниками и множество самых различных головоломок и мелочей (например, можно сжечь картонные шалаши бомжей живущих за пределами Клеттауна, а потом построить им более качественное жильё (или не построить), это не влияет вообще ни на что, но, да, можно так сделать). Короче говоря, Supraland Six Inches Under - это достойное продолжение первой части, сохранившее свою самобытность и готовое подарить вам ~20 часов незабываемых увлекательных приключений в мире красно-сине-бело-оранжево-фиолетовых человечков, живущих на заднем дворе одного маленького БОЛЬШОГО мальчика.
 
[ANI]☆BANZAI☆

Концентрированное развлечение, в котором нет ничего лишнего.
Прекрасный пример того, что сюжет - это далеко не самое главное; а игра в первую очередь должна базироваться на трёх китах: геймплей, импровизация и дизайн.
Если вам лень думать, а канал передачи сигналов от головы к рукам максимум рассчитан на удержание стакана или ложки, смело проходите мимо

Évaluation publiée le 3 novembre 2023
Bu oyun MÜ-KEM-MEL!!!!!!!!!!!!! Okadar sarıyor ki keşke hafızam silinsede tekrar tekrar oynayabilsem. Böyle yaratıcı oyunlar artık çok nadir çıkıyor. :( Uzun uzun yazacağım çünkü bu seri bunu tam anlamıyla hakediyor <3

Öncelikle Supraland'ın DLC paketi dahil bütün oyunlarını %100 başarımla bitirdim. Ana konusu başta olmak üzere, grafikleri, tatliş müzikleri, karakterlerin çıkardığı şubudibidub sesleri (:D) , mekanikleri muhteşem! İnceden inceye göndermeler çok iyi olmuş. 1. oyunda modern dizi filmlere, dini inançlara gönderme yaparken, 2. oyunda hiyerarşi temalı bir gönderme mevcut. Ayrıca 2. oyun DLC ile çok bağlantılı. ((Buradan DLC oynamayanlara sesleniyorum; DLC paketini oynamadıysanız 2. oyunun %50'lik bir kısmını anlayamayacaksınız. Çünkü bazı sahneler DLC ile direkt olarak bağlantılı (((hapishane sahnesi gibi.))) Onun haricinde oyun bana biraz Türkiye simülasyonu gibi geldi. :))

1. oyunda bilmceler daha zordu, 2. oyunda bu biraz hafifletilmişti. 1 ve 2'nin tek ortak noktası var ki oda sandıkların gizlendiği yerler. Özellikle 2. oyunda son sandığı bulana kadar göbeğim çatladı (bulamayan varsa yardımcı olabilirim.)

Buraya kadar okuyan kişilere güzel bir haberim var oda bu oyunun gizli bir sonunun olduğu :)) Şimdiden uyarayım internette bununla alakalı en ufak bilgi kırıntısı yok. Ben bile tesadüfen keşfettim. ((Hatta bununla alakalı bir başarım koysalardı diye düşünmeden de edemiyorum.)) Çünkü oyunu bitiren farketmiştir. Bütüüüüüün heryeri keşfedince görev kalmıyor ve ''eee yani bu kadar mıydı'' diye sap gibi kalıyorsunuz. Aslında oyun sizi gizli sonu keşfetmenizi istiyor. (bununla alakalı yardımcı olabilirim elimde ekran görüntüleri de mevcut.)

Türkçe dil desteğini de göz önüne alırsak 10 üzeri 9.5 hakeder. 1. oyununa 10 üzeri 10, DLC paketine ise 10 üzeri 9 veririm. Mükemmel! Steam USD geçmeden alın!!

His Majesty
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
13.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 janvier 2023
A Much More Notable Extension to Supraland!

Supraland: Six Inches Under is somewhat of a sequel to the Metroidvania Puzzle-Platforming Hybrid: Supraland. Taking place during the Beginning of the DLC: Supraland Crash, You play as a Blue Plumber who has fallen into a mysterious world just Six Inches under the previous game's sandbox. It introduces a lot of new moves and gameplay aspects to the formula of the previous game, as well as reusing tools and elements from the previous games with a new coat of paint. It's strange to call it a sequel as while it does a lot more than what Crash tried to do, it still feels like in a grey area between being a sequel and a much extended DLC.

As before, this game features many gameplay aspects so I'll cover each on it's own.

Puzzle Solving in Six Inches Under, is again fairly solid. With areas tailored for a specific puzzle and you're giving the tool on you or around you to solve it, with a few optional puzzles sprinkled in. As being a sequel in spirit, there's a only a few more concepts used to make puzzle solving interesting, Such as liquid based puzzles with a shower system. Most of the ideas here are retreads of puzzles used in the first game, like electricity puzzles, locator ball puzzles, or platforming puzzles. Which aren't bad mind you, it just more of the same in a way. Not to make a unfair comparison but Portal 2 was able to do this while keeping the core puzzle aspect of the 2 Portals. With the use Laser Puzzles, Goo Puzzles, Gravity Belts, and so much more. Six Inches Under definitely feels like it's another extension of the first game but with enough polish to make it feel completely different in comparison to Crash.

Combat here has objectively taken a huge decrease in comparison to the first game, At least in some ways. The enemy variety has gotten a fairly large increase with more distinct enemies than just the Skulls and Lava Monsters from the first game. They often encourage or downright require more in depth methods to defeat them instead of just shooting until they die. However where it kinda falls apart is due to two reasons. Firstly, the weapons are simply not as good from the previous entry. The Pickaxe is actually a fine improvement from the Doorknocker from the first game as it has a great ranged attack and has greater use in the exploration aspect of the game. The Tesla Cannon is such a downgrade from the ASMD-like Gun with it firing slower permanently and it's only trait being able to stun enemies, which is necessary for a few foes but isn't as fun as the first game's gun. Lastly for weapons the Flame Gun is straight up optional, so there is a high likely hood that you won't find it during your main playthrough, and it isn't even that useful in comparison to the pickaxe and barely has puzzles that require it. Secondly for the combat, the enemy spawners are straight up removed, this means all combat is fixed to one time arenas and also extremely rare in comparison to the previous title. Really it's some good, some bad and overall worst than the first game.

Lastly for gameplay is the Metroidvania aspect and it's probably the most consistent of everything here. You very frequently get rewarded for exploring and are able to see areas to keep in mind when you return with new powers. With the optional chests containing being minor upgrades and money, there's even some special upgrades for collecting items from Crash. It's overall pretty solid, though I think during the late/post-game is where it doesn't really work as well as the original. This is mainly due to the map's design, Unlike Supraland, you cannot easily get to one place to another by just walking over the level boundaries with your absurdly powerful movement options, you're kinda fixed to just using the fast travel system and it kinda takes away from the discovery of finding stuff way out of bounds. As the map no longer loops back around itself. It really makes getting all the chests a bit more tedious than it needed to be, but I wouldn't know how they would have solved this with the setting.

Now for the Style, Six Inches Under is just as good if not better than the original. With you being so small the game absolutely nails the whole normal human objecting being humongous to these clay people. The Unreal 4 Engine is use masterfully to make the objects shine without it looking down right ugly and with the cave setting, the use of darkness and light barely breaking from the surface is absolutely fantastic. Furthermore the sound design is also top notch with some extremely satisfying sound effects for a plethora of things like weapons, puzzle elements, and etc. Really the only style issue the game has is again the enemies looking extremely out of place in comparison to everything else, though it's again a issue you kinda just get used to as you place.

Overall, Six Inches Under, improved in some places and deduced in others. I think did it a much better job in terms of puzzle design and overall world than Crash but doesn't hit those same marks on why I really enjoyed the first game. I think one of the faults is just the shorter story, I mean the game even pokes fun at you probably being just 50% done. While more post content is nice, I feel like if the main campaign isn't as crafted and engaging it wouldn't make much of a impression than just having a large map that you can wander and discover new optional areas just from the urge to explore. With the newest upcoming game in the Supra Games franchise being the elusive Supraworld, I hope the developers can recapture what made the first game addiction fun while also having the great aspects that Six Inches Under introduced.
 
Kyezoar

İlk oyundan aldığım hazzı bunda da alırım diye düşündüm yani biraz hayal kırıklığına uğradım diyebilirim. Évaluation publiée le 26 janvier 2022
If you liked the other Supralands, you'll like this one. I don't know how they do it, but they deliver "more of the same" in the best possible way. The tools are slightly different from last time, but not in a significant way, and that's nice, too. I think the biggest nitpick is that most of the exploration abilities aren't available until end game (which makes sense given how powerful they are). There are also some super complex puzzles that you can solve with brute forcing the physics engine instead of doing it the intended way.

0.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 janvier 2022
«Не трогай шары моего сына!» © Серый человечек

Признаюсь, я не играл в Supraland, этот проект стал для меня первым, ознакомительным, и относился я к нему как к совершенно новой игрушке. В итоге он меня приятно удивил своей непринужденной атмосферой, юмором, порой весьма двусмысленным, и интересным сюжетом.

Первый взгляд и геймплей можете увидеть тут:
Vidéo YouTube™: Supraland Six Inches Under - ПУТЕШЕСТВИЕ ПОД ЗЕМЛЕЙ! | ГЕЙМПЛЕЙ И ПЕРВЫЙ ВЗГЛЯД 
Vues : 1,516
Всем привет, ребята, и добро пожаловать в Supraland Six Inches Under! Это новый проект, который появился в Стиме сегодня, и проект весьма интересный, стоит заметить ;) Нам предстоит путешествовать по...

Буду рад новым зрителям!

Итак, буду краток.
Я поиграл пока немного, не знаком с историей, окунулся в совершенно незнакомый мир. Но, судя по отзывам в Стиме, многие люди ждали эту игру и были очень рады, когда она вышла. А это уже многое говорит о продукте.
Поделюсь немного впечатлениями: игрушка однозначно очень годная, видно, что разработчики не просто выкатили абы что, а работали и вкладывали душу.

Очень понравилась механика прокачки в виде покупок новых навыков за монетки у местных торговцев. То есть в игре как бы и нет дерева прокачки, но ты прокачиваешься с помощью покупок. Это весьма удобно и подталкивает искать все монетки.

Стилизация просто бомба! Нет, серьезно. Я вообще без ума от всяких игр с мультяшной стилизацией, да и в целом с какой-нибудь необычной рисовкой. А тут такое чувство, будто окунулся в игрушечный мир, маленький и хрупкий, но со своей богатой историей и персонажами.

Юмор. Блин, ну тут конечно разработчики молодцы. С самого начала тебя уже подкалывают и показывают, что игра больше про настроение и приключение, нежели вдумчивый и монотонный геймплей. Всякие смешные выражения, фразочки и комичные ситуации – неотъемлемая часть этой игрушки.

В плане оптимизации, звуков, музыки, управления –что не возьми, всё отлично. Это прекрасный пример необычной игрушки в очень интересном жанре. Я рад, что познакомился с ней!

Однозначно рекомендую к покупке, даже тем, кто незнаком с предыдущей частью ;)
 
Evil Raccoon
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
55.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 janvier 2022
Один из фаворитов интеллектуальных игр, наряду с Portal.Но загадки стали легче и отсылок поубавилось

Сразу хочется сказать.Если вам понравились: Талос, Портал или первый Супраленд - берите однозначно.
Игра стоит каждого рубля.

И, хотя она и просела на 30% в интересе, это все те же эмоции и восторг. Лучше дополнения к 1 части =)
Закрывать достижения тут - все так же одно удовольствие.
Нельзя просто так взять и начать проходить сюжет перед сайдквестами *о* 
Une capture d'écran de Supraland Six Inches Under
Par : ```I```

На старте (первые 2 дня) были довольно неприятные баги, которые лично мне помешали пройти игру до выхода патча.Просто пропали предметы, которые нужны для взаимодействия. Примерно 15 часов всех стадий принятия, пока наконец не появились нужные вентили и трубы
Сесть в тюрьму, чтобы не получить от мамки лечебных звездюлей после родительского собрания. Смекалочка!) 
Une capture d'écran de Supraland Six Inches Under
Par : ```I```


Воспринимайте эту часть как Blueshift к Half-Life

Проснувшись с утра с осознаньем - Пора!
Настал день, что всех вас зажжет как искра
Но как бы не так, для кого-то игра -
Местами менять ваш уклад и тела

Забыт теплый дом и пропали друзья
Не время грустить, У ТЕБЯ ЕСТЬ ДЕЛА!
Чеканных монет звон то тут и то там
Правителя песнь взмыла ввысь к этажам

И чтобы спасти всех и не подвести
Сундуки собери и кости найди
Монстров круши! Все загадки реши!
Себя развивай, ты на верном пути
Теперь иди...и победи =)


7 отсылок к прошлой части из 10

0
Recommandé
18.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 janvier 2022
Another great game by the Supra team! This was gonna be a DLC for the first game but it got a little bigger and (among other reasons) ended up as a full game release, which I thought was the right move. But although a self contained game, I think playing Supraland and the Crash DLC first would make for a more smooth and cohesive experience. This one is a bit harder or not so straightforward which is good for those of us who have already played the others but maybe not the ideal first experience for a newcomer.
There's much to be liked here and the addition of more people to the team have paid off i think. Everything looks and sound a bit better and the game clearly shows the devs care for developing new interesting and original puzzles.
I also would like to compliment the Devs openness about the development via posts and updates that give a glimpse on some of the decisions and challenges an indie dev faces. Fascinating stuff.
Give this one a go if you already played the first one or otherwise get Supraland asap, it's great.
 
Omelette du Fromage
771 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
10.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 janvier 2022
Six inches under indeed.
- 90% health upgrades you will never need because at worst you get hit twice in a fight.
- Fewer cool upgrades through the course of the story compared to the first where you felt the world open up each time.
- More of a segmented world where getting around isn't as fun.
- Puzzles made easier, even end game ones.

I still had fun... but it wasn't as good as the first. I'd catch it on a (big?) sale.

Edit: The dev Dave responded and gosh darnit I just like leaving joke reviews but now I feel bad. I stand by what I said but I've changed my thumbs down to a thumbs up.
 
Un développeur ou une développeuse a répondu à cette évaluation
zzFuzzy
0
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
25.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 octobre 2022
Another good main entry to this series of games but does show restriction of thought a bit versus the first game. This is more a problem of the theme chosen I suppose.

Six Inches under, as implied by the name, Takes place 90% underground. This restricts movement a bit, though the game does really try to let you explore despite this. The powers are points of progress and like the first game they help you speed up exploring even previous areas, the game is still very good at having rewards littered everywhere. What it kinda fails on this time is a good number of chests are just coins. This takes away the impact of the treasure hunting a bit, not a ton but some.

The entire game is trying to accomplish a goal you get early on, to reach the top of cage town and reach the surface.... yes "cage town" in a town that's all about wages and trickle down, yes the social commentary is here and full force.... once again the message isn't bad but I don't play games to be tossed back into reality within 5 minutes...

Still the game is definitely fun and does eventually get to the original level of powers giving fun movement even if it takes most of the game. Still a solid entry to the series and worth a play.
 
ZelosZalis

和前作一样原汁原味，玩法和关卡设计都很棒，唯一的遗憾是和前作比没有加太多创新的东西，导致相当一部分解谜都是前作的旧套路，一眼就看懂怎么过了。游戏时间全花在了找箱子上，眼睛都要瞪瞎了

15.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 janvier 2022
Short main game but challenging post-game with plenty to do and re-find.
A few puzzles post-game had me stumped for some time but felt rewarding once completed.
Nice throw-backs to the Crash DLC as well which gave me a bit of a laugh.


Only gripe with the game is some areas you can get soft-locked and are not hard to get to either but the developers are working fast on updates, this also goes for adding in items to spend our gold on which is not as stingy as the first game to give making it easier to buy your upgrades.
 
Talon
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
16.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 novembre 2023
Для тех, кто не играл в предыдущие игры
Приятный набор пространственных головоломок. Не особо сложных, но иногда подумать приходится. Головоломки в относительно больших локациях, так что тот-самый-кубик-на-кнопку иногда надо достать из неочевидного места, да ещё и использовать в разных головоломках.
У игрока несколько инструментов, их применение надо обдумывать. Например, силовой луч. Его можно протянуть от игрока к деревянному предмету или между двумя деревянными предметами. По ПКМ луч сжимается. Всё просто, но в итоге его можно использовать как мост, лестницу, тарзанку, выключатель, открыватель дверей и электропровод. Но это самый интересный инструмент, другие похуже.
Все головоломки ощущаются "честными". Все механики понятны и прозрачны, пиксельхайтинга и применения всего на всё нет. Осмотрелся, подумал, решил!

Сюжет даже не рудиментарный, его просто нет.
И метроидванией я бы это не назвал: все инструменты выдают строго по очереди, по мере прохождения. А в побочных секретках лежит улучшение оружия, хотя боёв тут не 5% контента, их от силы 1%.

И, увы, вот эта часть описания - чистая правда.
"- Зато есть сотни шуток.
- Из них две реально смешные."
Игра натужно пытается шутить, получается редко.

А ещё игра короткая. Проблема это или нет - решать каждому самому.


Для тех, кто играл в предыдущие игры
Я прошёл первый Supraland и Crash на 100%
У оригинального Supraland две огромные проблемы.
1. Игрока ведут за руку, давай подсказки на каждом шаге. Место под фиолетовый кубик помечено фиолетовым пятнышком, а около дырки для зелёного шарика горит зелёная лампочка. И это не обучалка, даже около "финального босса" стоит мужик и чуть ли не прямым текстом говорит, что игроку делать.
2. Боёвка. Враги спавнятся постоянно повсюду. На перекрёстка, в тупике, перед головоломкой, после головоломки, даже около магазина. Притом боёвка - спам ЛКМ, даже неважно, какое оружие выбрано.

В Crash провели работу над ошибками. Дурацких подсказок нет. Есть общие фразы "за городом пещера, ты там ещё не был", да и их дают только по просьбе игрока. Боёвку к чертям выпилили. Ну, враги иногда бывают, но на 1-2 удара, медленные и мало. Бой длится пару секунд, и его пройдёт даже моя бабушка.
А ещё в Crash есть сюжет. Не бог весть что, но всё же многие персонажи имеют 1-2 черты характера. И юмор поэтому контекстный.

В Six Inches игрока за руку не ведут, но головоломки попроще. В целом, стало получше.
Боёвку переработали, теперь инструменты головоломок в ней используются, а враги стали разнообразными. Например, есть ребята с деревянными щитами, которых можно притягивать силовым лучом. Или связывать друг с другом. Есть даже один действительно интересный бой! Боёв чуть больше, чем в Краше. Кстати, вещи из секретных сундуков влияют на "голволомочное" оружие, делая решения... не проще, конечно, но чуть удобнее. В предыдущих играх в сундуках был только бесполезный хлам.

Но есть и проблемы.
Six Inches проходит под землёй. Коридор-пещера-коридор-пещера, развилок немного. Это убивает целый пласт игры. Попытки залезть на воооон тот красивый холмик — важная часть Supraland. Это убрали. Пожалуй, это был последний элемент метроидвании. Да и возвращаться назад игра почти не мотивирует.

Первый Supraland и, особенно, Crash имели приятную особенность. Из каждого инструмента и объекта локации выжималось всё. Условно, стоит поршень вертикальный. Вроде, просто лифт. Но в одной головоломке им надо предмет подбросить, на другой перекинуть через него мост лучом, а ещё под самим поршнем секретка есть. Кубик светится, кидается через узкие щели, тягается лучом и используется как батут.
В Six Inches такого ощущения нет. Новая механика: стальной шар можно нагреть, он потом горячий и светится. Ну и что? Это используется полтора раз после обучения. Дали электрическую пушку. здорово. Но она почти не нужна, в головоломках всё ещё ведёшь ток от генератора. В общем, новые инструменты гораздо хуже старых, а локации не комплексные.

Сюжет даже не пытались. НПС могут выдать буквально: "Я просто НПС, я ничего не делаю, я болванчик". Нежелание придумывать персонажей замаксировали шутейкой.

Итог? Все три игры в чём-то хороши и в чём-то плохи. Выделить лучшую невозможно.

PS
Последняя локация (после титров) микроскопическая и унылая. Местами как раз с дурацкими решениями и пиксельхайтингом. Как будто в другую игру играешь.
 
Gremlin

Recommandé
32.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 février 2023
Oyunu %100 bitirmiş biri olarak yorum yapacağım ve ayrıca ilk supraland oyununu da xbox game pass üzerinden bitirmiştim. Öncelikle supraland oyunları klasik metroidvania türüne sadık kalarak, yeni özellikler ve yetenekler açtıkça oyunda ilerleme kat etmeniz ve eski bölgelerde daha önceden giremediğiniz yerlere girebilmeniz üzerine kurulu. Oyunun ilk oyuna kıyasla daha rafine bir iş olduğunu belirtmeliyim. Çünkü ilk oyundaki gibi durmadan bir düşman saldırısına maruz kalıp puzzlelar arası duraksama yaşamıyorsunuz. İlk oyundaki çoğu özellik bu oyunda da mevcut (bir kaç çıkarılmış ve onların yerine eklenilmiş yeni geliştirmeler, itemler var.) Hikaye olarak ilk oyunun sonrasında geçiyor ve bu sefer yer yarılıyor ve içine düşüyoruz. Bu şekilde yer altındaki bölgeleri keşfetmeye başlıyor ve buradan çıkmaya çalışıyoruz. Ayrıca ilk oyuna göre %100 yapılabilme imkanı daha yüksek diye düşünüyorum çünkü ilk oyunun dünyası çok geniş ve çok karışık. Bu yüzden de ekstra zor geliyor diye düşünüyorum. Tamamen ilk oyun üzerine kurulmuş bir oyun olduğu gibi üstüne de bolca konulmuş ve güzel bir oyun ortaya çıkmış.
 
Saint Ali
565 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
28.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 février 2022
Produit reçu gratuitement

Alguns dias atrás tinha relembrado dessa franquia fantástica que eu pude ter o prazer de experimentar, e também tive a sorte de recebe-lo como presente.
Quem diria que um jogo que pra mim não tinha premissa alguma, que eu tinha achado aleatoriamente em meados de 2018, poderia ser um dos jogos mais divertidos que eu já joguei na minha vida toda.
Se não tiver jogado o primeiro jogo, jogue e depois venha para esse (tem a dlc do 1 ainda que eu não peguei, vou esperar uma promoção)
Se já, posso lhe dizer que o jogo manteve a base gostosa do primeiro supraland com diversas coisas e mecanicas novas, e uma historia (que é de comédia e banal, mas é estranhamente boa por sinal). Se eu fosse dar uma opinião final acho dificil declarar qual é o melhor, pra mim os dois tem a mesma alta qualidade.
Enfim, Supraland é do mesmo criador do enigma NotPron, talvez já tenham escutado falar. Sabendo disso, peloo jogo ser boa parte de puzzle, podemos assumir que os puzzles no jogo são MUITO bem planejados. A exploração, a sensação de tudo se conectar no mapa é mt boa. O combate é simples, mas divertido. As mecanicas são unicas e excelentes, pode conter minimos bugs mas ainda assim é genial.
Apenas jogue essa maravilha, não sabe oque está perdendo. Espero ansiosamente pelo Supraworld.
 
felipedays
130 produits enregistrés
1
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
16.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 janvier 2022
It's more Supraland. It clearly bears the scars of initially being designed as DLC with elements that feel extremely disconnected and vestigial when separated from the first game's mechanics, but despite that it's the same platforming and puzzle solving with the same janky physics and same frustrating inconsistency when calculating momentum. Some of the puzzles and secrets are still frustratingly esoteric with the line between "difficult hidden platforming challenge" and "blindly exploiting world geometry to accidentally skip a puzzle" being incredibly thin.

If you enjoyed the first game, this is more of that. If you didn't enjoy the first game, this won't convince you to change your mind.
 
Keith

bo
705 produits enregistrés
0
8 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
40.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 avril 2022
"Supraland Six Inches Under" is a good entry in the series. If you liked the previous games, I'd say get this one. If you haven't played any of them yet, buy them and play them. The first one is excellent and the remaining two are good.

Of course, I do have some gripes. My most significant regards the story's pacing. It's a two-part issue. First, at the point where you start to go to the Beach area, the game sticks you on a virtual express train (conceptually, not an actual train) and railroads you to the story's end (i.e., you can't go back to the "hub" and try to solve other puzzles while you think about why you're stuck in the main quest -- you have to finish that main storyline). You lose all ability to play the game the way you want to. IOW, you HAVE to play the game depth first instead of breadth first.
And that leads to the second part: once I reached that forced ending and "won" (i.e., reached the end of the story) I was at 54% complete (roughly 19 hours in). Granted, the story isn't exactly Shakespeare. It's basically a trivial bit of standard, "capitalism is eeeeeeeevil" tripe. But, it does provide the framework for moving through the game. Of course, once you reach the "end," you start Act 2 and can continue solving puzzles without trouble. But, I really wish they had continued the story until something approaching completion. And, the really irritating thing is that there's no reason they had to push us to the ending and force us to play their way.

My only other notable issue is that my final chest was in a ridiculous location that couldn't be seen and didn't register on the locator we get near the end. AFAIK, the only way to find it is to search the forums or the internet. But, that's a fairly trivial thing.

Anyway, I finished the game (100% completion) with 39.4 hours of good gameplay and it cost me about $16. So, I'm happy with it and am Recommending it.
 
DALCOhstangultion
319 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
7.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 mai 2022
이거 말이 7시간이지 길 헤맨거 따지면 4~5시간.

1편 - 오~ 우오~ 와~ 오 이런데도 있네, 오~ 언제끝나? 아직도 ? 와, 아직 더 있네. 와 알차다.

2편 - 오~ 오~.. 어디로 가야되냐... 이런데도 있군. 오~ 새로운 곳인... 응? 뭐냐? 벌써 엔딩이라고?

싶을 정도로 1편에 비해서 볼륨이 굉장히 적음.
아마, 전투의 비중이 엄청나게 적어져서 그럴 수도 있음.

1편에서는 전투의 비중이 커서, 코인도 많이 주고, 몬스터도 많이 나오고 했던 거에 비해서, 2편은 그냥 진짜 퍼즐만 푼다는 생각으로, 주 전투가 딱 3~4번? 정도 밖에 없음. 심지어 공격 강화 1도 안했는데, 몬스터들도 약함.

그냥 진짜 말했듯이 퍼즐에만 비중을 98% 둔 느낌임.

뭔가 1편도 너무 어려웠던 퍼즐도 있기도 했고, 어찌됐든 가격에 비해 볼륨이 엄청나게 컸어서 2편도 좀 기대했는데, 2편 볼륨은 좀... 너무 심각할 정도로 적긴 함.

거기다가, 엔딩보러 가는 길도 좀 어이 없던게, 스토리 진행하다가 뚝 잘라먹고 바로 엔딩보러 가는 느낌이였음.
그냥 "어? 여기 이게 있네~" 하고 넘어갔더니 메인 스토리 아니라더만 바로 엔딩이였음 ㅅㅂ;;

1편 때의 그 느낌이 아직도 남아있어서 그런가, 2편이 많이 아쉽다.

그래도 재미는 있었음. 퍼즐 요소 좋아하면 할만하고, 1편 생각하고 하는 사람들은 좀 실망할 수도 있음.

WienerBoop
329 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
21.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 octobre 2022
Supraland的續作
這是一款類傳送門解謎的遊戲
------------------
遊戲內容主要分為三個部分
有劇情的簡單解謎關卡(第一章)
破關後的困難解謎關卡(第二章)
以及收集寶箱跟獎盃探索

直衝劇情的話第一章的時數很短
跟著劇情跑遇到的解謎
你大概率都不會卡關(大概!?)

第二章的解謎關卡有些反人類思考
可能要找去看影片才知道怎破解
有些會用到一代的功能
但是二代根本沒有教過
所以沒玩過一代可能會卡很久

最後的寶箱跟獎盃探索
有偵測器提示你大概位置
算是破關後的一種樂趣
(前提是你要先獲得探測器)
你可能在寶箱獲得新能力
例如 跳躍次數+1 攻擊距離增加 這種
只是我覺得沒啥用就是了
-------------------------
這代遊戲著重在關卡解謎
野怪的戰鬥成分被拿掉了

野怪這點體驗有好有壞
你可以專注在解謎上面
但是拿到金幣變得無感
升級變得沒有的成就感

金幣的作用是買新能力
商店買完後有很長的空窗期
以致於後面遇到金幣都無感
造成探索拿寶箱幾乎沒成就感
這點給人的感覺比前代還差
----------------------
 
小貓到處跑
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
11.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 juillet 2023
Öncelikle ilk oyunun incelemesini şöyle bırakıyorum, bu incelemeyi de onun üzerinden birkaç değişiklik yaparak yazacağım. Farklı hikayeleri, yeni bulmacaları olması nedeniyle farklı hissettirse de artıları da eksileri de temelde aynı aslında o yüzden biri için dediğimi öbürü için de diyebilirim.
https://steamcommunity.com/id/TheHumanSpectre/recommended/813630

Bir açık dünya oyunu çıktığında genelde GTA ile kıyaslarız değil mi? Ben de bir bulmaca oyununu oynarken Portal ile kıyaslarım çünkü bu türün en iyisi odur benim gözümde. Çoğu bulmaca oyununda da benzer mekanikler görürüz o yüzden ne kadar sevsem de "bir Portal değil" derim. Supraland de Portal'a benzer yönler taşıyor ama oyunu bulmacadan ibaret yapmayarak büyük bir fark koymuş. Oyun %40 bulmaca, %40 keşif ve %20 aksiyondan oluşuyor. Baya bildiğiniz Skyrim oynar gibi etrafta geziyorsunuz, ufak yan görevler bile yapabiliyorsunuz. Aksiyon tarafında ise sürekli gelişen silahlarınız var bunlar da oyunu 10 saatten sonra bile canlı tutmaya yetiyor. Hikaye olarak da ufak bir çocuğun oyun bahçesindeki ufak karakterleri oynuyoruz, bu karakterlerin hikayesi çok orijinal olmuş. Oyunda "backtrack" denilen bir mantık da var, bazı oyunlarda karakterimiz en başta bir yere ulaşamaz ama ileride güçlenip geri döndüğünde ulaşabilir ya buna backtrack deniyor. İLk oyunda olduğu gibi bu oyunda da uyuşturucu arayan polis köpeği gibi backtrack arıyorum desem abartmış olmam. Oyunu bitirdim ilk bölgelere döndüm var mı yapamadığım bir şey diye aramaya başladım. İlk oyunu tamamen bitirmenin getirdiği yorgunluk olsun bu sefer tamamen bitirmeye yönelmedim, jenerik sonrası kısımda biraz gezindikten sonra bana yeter diyerek bıraktım. Puan vermek gerekirse rahatlıkla 8.5/10 verebilirim.

Artılar
-Çok güzel bulmaca tasarımı
-Güzel tasarlanmış açık dünyası
-Sürekli gelişen aksiyonu
-Mizahi hikaye anlatımı
-Orijinal ve güzel bir hikaye
-Popüler kültür göndermeleri
-Grafikleri oldukça güzel
-Türkçe çevirisi oldukça başarılı

Eksiler
-Hikaye bittikten sonraki kısım, beni oyunda tutmak için yeterli gelmedi.
-Hikayesi yarım bitiyor hissi bıraktı kırmızı prensi hapisten kurtardıktan sonra kayboldu, daha bulamadım.

İlk oyunda eksilere yazdığım ve bu oyunda düzelmiş sorunlar
-Optimizasyon ilk oyuna göre daha iyi geldi.
-İlk oyunun aksine bölgeler daha ufak olduğu için yardım almak ve nerede olduğunuzu anlamak daha kolay.
 
Commander Shepard
614 produits enregistrés

Recommandé
17.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 janvier 2022
約15時間ほど、宝箱実績共に100%達成しました。
結論としては値段に見合った、ほど良いボリュームの謎解きメトロイドヴァニア系ゲーム。
全体的に謎解きが易しくなっておりサクサク進める。答えが思いつきにくい謎もメインにかかわらないおまけでチラチラあり、やりごたえもある。今作は探索メインで沢山の宝箱が見つかるのでそういったものが好きならば買うのもアリ。
新アビリティは謎解きの深みを出す訳でも無かったのでsupralandのおかわりというイメージで問題ない。
不満点は中盤以降コインが溜まる一方使い道がない点、そして後半の宝箱はほぼコイン入りなのでがっかり感がある点。

TSMAC88
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
10.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 octobre 2022
a bit of story, a lot of puzzles, a lot of upgrades and still some of the worst combat.
I have two problems with the combat:
- It isn't part of the normal game flow. There are a few arenas with waves of enemies but most of the time, the game is peaceful
- The only thing you'd lose without combat is 'meaningful collectibles'. In a game without combat you don't need health/regeneration/critical/range/damage/... upgrades so there is little you can still put into chests as rewards.

So the only reason combat exists is to make exploration more rewarding. Not a problem in other metroid variants since combat is ever present there, but it becomes a problem when combat is so grafted and very finite.
Still a good game
 
Nab
10
46 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
9 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
3
Recommandé
14.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 juillet 2023
Oh Lord the title of this game is the story of my life.

I said I’d take my wife to Supraland, but sadly could only manage 4 inches… 🤷‍♂️ fortunately she has a boyfriend for the extra inches she needs…

There really isn't anything like the Supraland games and just by the original look people might get turned away because it kinda resembles a Roblox clone, but it is so addicting and the puzzles are very well thought out and satisfying when you finish them.

I thought Six Inches Under was a much more focused and polished experience than it’s predecessor overall, would even go as far as to recommend it in place of the original. The game just looks so charming, specially the quirky art style they use in its presentation. And it is hysterical and an overall great game. Six inches under is a great follow up.

For those unfamiliar with the series, It's a first person puzzle game in the vein of Portal spliced with an exploration metroidvania, kinda. You explore the map and solve puzzles, both giving you currency to buy new skills that open up new locations to search and new puzzles to solve.

You get new abilities and tools basically through the entire game, making exploration quicker and more fun and interesting. You'll find things and new paths in early areas that you couldn't reach before, which is very satisfying if you like metroidvanias.

It's very charming, lots of quality humor and references, and has an under-used aesthetic of being a tiny toy, so you'll climb across pencils, forks, etc... It's clever and fun all the things they do with that scale.

These games are just fun, the gameplay is perfectly suited for the Steam Deck and work great with sleep mode as the game auto saves very frequently.

Honestly, this game and series is a breath of fresh air in the current gaming environment where almost every game just wants to be a cash grab or be generic as hell and it’s hard to find a game like this that strives to be something different and make you think outside the box.

Ultimately, six inches is a great game that expands upon the story and world that you got in the first game, and if you liked the original, you’ll likely enjoy this one too, regardless of which you get to play first.

8/10
 
Flavius Claudius Julianus

Recommandé
6.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 mars 2022
比起一代来，邪性真的是有增无减！！
好家伙，你敢信这玩意儿，居然和一代剧情还形成联动了？？

不客气的说，游戏工作室完全可以将supraland打造成一个系列IP进行运营，优化下游戏的画面（ 没有说现在画面不好的意思 ），配合上着游戏的丰富想象力，这不就一妥妥的单机版 双人成行 ？！！

抛开简单的剧情和画面，这却是一个真正优秀的游戏，沙盒RPG并没有让它变得单调重复，反倒是一直让人充满了新鲜感，玩这个游戏的感觉，就像是在探索宝藏，你永远不知道下一个箱子里装的是个啥。

这种简单，但又持续的快乐，毫无疑问是回归了游戏的本质

Dr. Peppermill
228 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
13.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 février 2022
Supraland was my game of the year 2021. While I don't suspect Six Inches Under will be my game of the year for 2022, I did enjoy it.

SIU gives a lot of the same mechanics and puzzle elements that made Surpaland great. There are new ways to use familiar tools and new equipment altogether that gives the game a different feel. However, this fails to replicate or surpass the beauty of the first game. You experience the same blending of puzzles into exploration, but having played Supraland, now I know to expect this. The novelty is lost. The puzzles here lack the "Aha! I can use this--" moments that made the original Supraland utterly charming.

All that said I still thoroughly enjoyed this game. I beat the game in about 7 hours. It took me another 5 hours to reach 100% completion. There are a lot of post-game puzzles that seem to be content the developers made but couldn't find a way to fit into the story. I certainly don't mind having this extra content, but it feels very disjointed and uncessary.

I should mention that everything that Supraland Crash was terrible at was fixed in this DLC. This game is a great addition to the Supraland series.
 
wizcreations
912 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
21.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 juin 2022
There's something undefinable about the atmosphere of the Supraland games that invokes a wonderfully nostalgic feeling of childhood in a way that's hard to explain. This game, like its predecessor, is more than the sum of its parts in that although they might not initially appear impressive, the art and sound direction and controls come together in a cohesive whole to create a world that is astoundingly fun to move through and explore. It just feels right and that's something that's extremely hard to do. The little touches of humour here and there that have inspired the occasional actual chuckle are the icing on a very well made cake.
 
Pete

4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
51.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 janvier 2022
Hab zwar erst angefangen zu spielen, bin aber schon voll begeistert. Der zweite Teil ist mindestens gleich gut wie der Erste, und zudem dazu nicht nur eine aufgehübschte Kopie. Die Rätsel bauen grundsätzlich auf neue Ideen auf, sind dabei nicht zu leicht aber auch nicht zu schwer - perfekt! Es steckt wieder sehr viel Liebe in diesem Werk und man spürt es, es ist meiner Meinung nach jeden Cent wert. Wenn man sich etwas Zeit lässt und gründlich erkundet, sind viele Stunden Spielspaß enthalten. Absolute Kaufempfehlung!!!
Ich wünsche dem Entwicklerteam viel Erfolg, danke für diese wunderbare Fortsetzung. Und jetzt zurück zum Spiel! ;-)

Edit: Hab das Spiel jetzt durch und bin noch mehr begeistert als ich es ohnehin schon nach zwei Stunden spielen war. Die derzeitige Bewertung von 98% beim Steam ist absolut berechtigt!!! Ich würde mir noch viele Spiele vom David und dem Entwicklerteam in der Zukunft wünschen, hoffentlich kommt es auch so!

I've only just started playing, but I'm already hooked. The second part is at least as good as the first, and moreover not just a prettied copy. The puzzles are basically based on new ideas, are not too easy but not too difficult - perfect! There is again a lot of love in this work and you can feel it, in my opinion it is worth every penny. If you take your time and explore thoroughly, there are many hours of gameplay included. Absolutely recommended!!!
I wish the development team every success, thanks for this wonderful sequel. And now back to the game! ;-)

Edit: Finished the game now and I'm even more excited than I was anyway after two hours of playing. The current rating of 98% on Steam is absolutely justified!!! I would like to see many more games from David and the development team in the future, hopefully it will happen!

Non recommandé
12.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 janvier 2022
Unlike the original, Supraland 6IU has taken a non-linear approach where the game can be completed with less than 50% of the content. This approach makes the game less rewarding and the puzzles suffer since puzzle design has to assume you may or may not have certain tools/weapons, meaning that much of its content is kinda pointless. The game also has puzzles that are down minute precision of jumps rather than figuring things out through brainpower. All in all, it just doesn't compare to the original.

107 produits enregistrés

3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
15.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 novembre 2022
3D箱庭一人称視点パズルアクション（とはいってもやはり一本道）

スタッフロールまで6.5時間（達成度43%）
全実績解除で追加7.5時間、トータル14時間

1の正統進化なので、それ以上に書くことがあまりありません。まずは1をやりましょう。
DLC（Crash）の方はちょっと毛色が違ったので、やらなくてもかな、と思います。（一部DLC絡みの話もありますが、ストーリーが重要なゲームでもないので、気にしなくてよいでしょう）

1と比べて良かったところ
  • 戦闘がドア開放のために一度だけ発生、のような形式になった
  • エリアが明確に区切られ、ショートカットも把握しやすくなった
  • 比較的序盤から機動力が高くなる能力が手に入り、操作していて面白かった



3D酔いは相変わらず激しいです。DLCから2週間ほど空いてのプレイだったのですが、誇張なく開始して数分で酔いました。
キャラクターの視点が低いことが影響しているように思うので、ウインドウの配置を少し下目にするとよいかもしれません。
ちなみに自分は諦めて酔い止めを服用しました。
 
clclicl
179 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
15.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 janvier 2022
One of the best 3D Metroidvanias I know! The exploration and puzzles are as neat and interesting to discover as ever, and combat has been *significantly* improved from the last game - while also being significantly reduced, so any combat you are in usually feels like a unique encounter, especially since you usually have new items to make use of every few combats.
I have not finished it all yet, but it has been very compelling and fun so far, and I certainly plain to play it for significantly longer too! I hope you have fun with it as well. ^w^

Recommandé
2.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 janvier 2022
Si jugaste Supraland este juego al menos en lo que llevo se ve igual de bueno, los mismos principios y algunas mismas armas y herramientas pero mucho más refinado y corrigiendo o mejorando cosas que flojeaban en el primero como el combate, o el movimiento en general que creo que ahora es más fluido.

Si no has jugado el primero te lo recomiendo mucho, no es necesario jugarlo para entender este ya que la historia no es algo muy importante pero es muy bueno. Al igual que este, es un juego de puzzles en 3D ♥♥♥ mucha énfasis en la exploración, sus puzzles son muy originales y de una dificultad muy adecuada, no te dan demasiada información y debes aprender cómo funcionan y qué pueden hacer tus herramientas, los puzzles en su mayoría no son muy fáciles y te hacen pensar un poco pero tampoco son tan difíciles o tan poco obvios que sean frustrantes, cada detalle del mundo y objeto que hay en el escenario es importante e incluso muchas veces te permite abordar los puzzles de distintas maneras, es una aventura muy divertida.
 
ompegon34
299 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
38.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 janvier 2022
I started smiling as soon as I saw the game released and didn't stop smiling until I finished it. :) It's so great to be back in this hilarious, wacky world of head-scratching, satisfying puzzles.

If you loved the original Supraland, you'll love this, too. It does away with some of the more frustrating elements introduced in the Crash DLC and offers (for the most part) straightforward, logic-based puzzles. It also greatly reduces the amount of combat, and there's only one time-based challenge (and it's really solved by logic, not speed). Six Inches Under even introduces a map to help orient yourself. So, in many ways this is actually the most streamlined entry in the series so far.

That said, it doesn't quite have the magnificently broad scope of the first game, in terms of both the diversity of areas and the spread of the narrative. I was actually a bit surprised by how quickly the main story came to an end, although there's still plenty of stuff to do after in order to get to the coveted, well-earned 100% completion. Indeed, the coolest puzzles are located after the endgame.

Now I can't wait for the next Supraland.
 
Emblem Parade
7,575 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
29.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 janvier 2022
Проигрывает первым двум, но все равно отличная игра. Есть пара душных моментов, где надо успеть выполнить определенные действия за довольно короткий промежуток времени, но остальное проходится на чиле.

Что понравилось:
Есть хорошие, изобретательные головоломки.
Враги не напрягают, и после прохождения сюжета можно спокойно заняться исследованиями, вообще о них не вспоминая.
Карта большая, система телепортов между локами удобная - всегда можно довольно быстро добраться до любой точки.
Юмор и отсылки - на высоте.

Что не понравилось:
Прежде всего это невидимые стены - это очень ограничивает мотивацию что-то искать. Заберешься куда-нибудь, а там шиш, игра просто не дает тебе идти дальше.
Мотивации исследовать в принципе мало, потому что ты получишь или монетки, или буст к урону/хп, хотя врагов уже и не осталось (или почти не осталось), они ведь не ресаются.
Некоторые головоломки построены на неявных механиках - например, кости у пляжа. Для них хотелось бы побольше подсказок.

Моя оценка 8/10. Вряд ли ее будут проходить те, кто не играл в основную - и это правильно. Для ознакомления с Supraland она не подходит, всё-таки есть определенные недостатки, которые могут отбить желание знакомиться с остальными играми. Но судя по % нашедших все сундуки, в нее и так играют только заядлые фанаты)
 
scremblhay

0
Non recommandé
51.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 février 2022
Supraland is one of the best games I've ever played! Near perfect in design, every part of the terrain was well thought out and perfectly designed. This game...is the complete opposite. You never know if you're not supposed to go somewhere because you don't have the right powerup yet, or if it's simply bad design. Most of the time it turns out to be the latter. This turns the game into an exercise in frustration.

The mid-air control is still pants. I think it's actually worse than the first game. This, combined with the bad terrain design, makes the game tedious and boring. I'm just not enjoying this game. Such a pity, as I love Supraland and played it through twice, something I rarely do.

Now, if I hadn't played the first game I would've contemplated giving this one a thumbs up, except for the fact of having timed puzzles. I am almost 60 years old and physically disabled. I found it impossible to complete these puzzles. Even setting the game speed to slowest, I took hours of trying to finally get past these. It would've been fine if it was a side quest, but this blocks you from playing the game any further.

I'm about halfway through the game and I'm seriously thinking of quitting and going to play something else. I wish I had refunded the game when I still could. So, so disappointed.

Edit: I would like to add, there is a lot that is good about this game. I had great fun exploring this world! The funny references were good as well, the puzzles were fine. Having to get the jumps pixel-perfect to make them was very annoying but still I would've given a positive rating. The timed puzzle a third of the way in was the final straw. It left me with painful hands and wrists after hours of trying to get it. That makes the game exclusionary to me.

Response to dev: The one where you have to press the circle, square and triangle in order, in cage city, to let down the ramp. That is definitely not optional!

Very faithful to the original. It's literally more of the same. New puzzles, sure, and a few new gimmics. 60 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
16.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 janvier 2022
Штош, Supraland Six Inches Under соответствует словам автора [Эту часть можно назвать "Supraland 1.5"]. Немного старого и немного нового. Локации достаточно интересные чтоб их хотелось исследовать, введенная карта, к слову крайне полезна на поздних этапах игры когда сундуков осталось мизерное количество, а найти их все хочется.
Шутки как и в оригинале хорошие но те самые две реально смешные, заявленные в описании, я то ли не нашел, то ли не выкупил. Шутка, ставшая традицонной про стальные шары не в счет. Из отсылок больше запомнились Боб Росс, Захир из легенды о Корре, серый человечек восхваляющий солнце и синий или голубой чувак стучавшийся в дверь с криком LET ME IIIIIIIN!!!
Головоломки в целом ощущаются проще, чем в оригинале за исключением некоторых со специфическими таймингами (фиолетовые кольца возле лавы). Не хватило синергии между устройствами, хочется верить, что в сиквеле это исправят. Чисто субъективно, но песня из оригинала прикольней была.
По итогу, 100% прохождение заняло 14 часов 37 минут, из которых 6 часов сюжетная кампания. По эмоциям игра однозначно положительная, особенно понравился момент в тюрьме, перекликающийся с Supraland Crash. В начале увидев знакомое окружение, заподозрил банальный самоповтор, но все оказалось куда интереснее. Этот эпизод плюс еще один в пляжном биоме показывают события Supraland Crash с противоположной стороны, что возимело больший эффект, так как длц я проходил совсем недавно.

P.S.
Недавно вышло видео с демонстрацией ассетов сиквела на движке UE5 вглядит круто, надеюсь ПК потянет.

 
Сырный Гедонист
203 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
9.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 décembre 2023
Идеальный духовный последователь Supraland.
Очень озорная, мультяшная, и при этом не самая простая головоломка-метроидвания. Я не знаю известных игр такого жанра, обычно метроидвании ставят в основу борьбу с врагами, а не способности типа нажатия на кнопки и прочее. Самое близкое, что можно представить к Supraland - это Portal, наверное. Но если бы там был (условно) открытый мир и сайд-квесты.
Сюжет в игре есть, но он есть ровно настолько, чтобы придавать форму геймплею. И ещё он очень смешной.
Отличие от Supraland - играть немного интереснее, потому что разделение игры на районы ОЧЕНЬ помогает ориентироваться. Я помню, что в первой части был очень недоволен отсутствием адекватной карты; здесь же карта есть, но устройство игры настолько интуитивно понятно, что она не очень нужна. Возможно, головоломки от этого стали полегче, хотя не уверен.
Способности примерно те же, что и в первом Supraland-е, но даются в другом порядке, в комплекте с другим оборудованием, поэтому скучать не приходится. Примерно как всё было перевёрнуто в DLC, но перевёрнуто уже в третьем направлении.
Я пока не прошёл на 100%, но прошёл главный квест - это где-то половина игры, если не меньше, поэтому, возможно, будут ещё нудные обыскивания тонн скал, распрыжки и прочее. Но пока этого не было.

Рекомендую всем кому зашла Supraland; а тем кому Supraland кажется слишком сложной - это отличная альтернатива чтобы с неё начать.
 
sirtafeb
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
1
Recommandé
28.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 janvier 2022
At the time of this review, I finished the game "campaign" (still not completed all "side quests")

In a few words, this game is nothing like Supraland but a lot like Supraland.
It reinvents the previous game adding new mechanics, with better visuals, and a fun history!

The only thing that I would like, is the game to be longer. But this is a side-history, so is not a flaw, is intended! (see ps3)

The only complain that I can come up with, is the fact that the game doesn't gave u an achievement for burning the poor people houses, I want to know which of my friends are as evil as me hehehe

Audio: 8 (it was good)
Visuals: 10 (it looks f..ing amazing)
Performance: 8 (some lag spikes here and there, I had everything in ultra though, so bear that in mind)
History: 10 (cant say much without spoiling, it has some surprises, and its interesting)
Achievements: 0 (¡¡¡want more evil achievements!!!)
Price: 10 (is like ur stealing the dev. Dev at least make a soundtrack that has "bruh" sound effects dude, I want to give u more money)

Ps: Because it deserves to be enjoyed slowly, try not to rush the game like a psycopath, like I did by accident, bcos i was pooping (thx steam) myself at that time and, I wanted to play a little more

Ps2: As a man that involves himself very deeply in politics, I didn't catch if the dev was trying to joke about corrupted authoritarian governments that veils themselves as Capitalists, or if he was openly ranting on Capitalism. But on the other side, this is just a game meant just to play with, don't read to much into it, just enjoy it!

Ps3: There is a lot of content to do post end-game, I was expecting that, giving that the game is a metroidvania, but I didn't expect the developer to go full on "We are done when i say we're done". The difficulty even steps up, and is very very fun

Ps4: Just finished the game (100% completion). When is the next one coming out? pls

1.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 février 2022
Игра вроде неплохая, но не для всех. За 2 часа она не смогла меня удивить или заинтересовать. Только под конец второго часа начинают появляться интересные инструменты и задачи.

* Начальные головоломки: найди предмет в одном месте > принеси предмет в другое место.
* Способности, которые надо открыть в начале игры: приседания, адекватные бег и прыжок.
* Часть способностей открывается за собираемые монеты. Одной является кирка; улучшая ее, сможете разрушать более твердые блоки.
* Абсолютно ненужные и скучные битвы с мобами.
* Невзрачная музыка.
* Диалоги с NPC нельзя пропускать в катсценах.

RolLinG_P
411 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
19.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 janvier 2022
I am a huge fan of the Supraland series. I’ve got 100% on both the previous games and am eagerly awaiting the next one. I enjoyed this game immensely and it is certainly deserving of positive reviews and praise for its creative puzzle design. However, I have some harsh grievances I'd like to get off my chest first.

The combat is horrendous. Clipping, levitating, falling out of the world, pathing issues, attacking without animations, abrupt performance issues, enemies hiding or running away. Apart from the bomb thrower and the boss, there is no ingenuity to their attacks. Even the art style of the enemies is completely out of place. All the weapons have virtually no creative applications in combat and are unsatisfying to use. The combat is genuinely the worst I've ever seen in a game before, it really is that bad. Not to spoil the story for this game but there isn’t one. The ending couldn’t even be anticlimactic due to that fact. You just collect some abilities and then it just ends really.

What makes this game worth playing is the puzzles and exploration. They are consistently creative and satisfying to complete. Some of the puzzles remarkably managed to captivate my attention for hours without feeling the slightest bit frustrating. Sometimes I found solutions that the devs clearly didn’t intend people to discover which felt merited rather than cheated due to how meticulously crafted each of the puzzles are. Certainly a welcome feature was a sign outside puzzles to tell you if you have the abilities required to complete the task. It was such a simple reinsurance that you weren’t just chasing a pipe dream. The more complex ones were usually found through exploration making it feel even more rewarding to solve. The map itself tessellates so damn well leaving no space for aimless walking and fantastic pacing throughout.

Overall it is a bloody good game that I highly recommend playing. I just hope to god the devs completely reevaluate combat and story when releasing Supraland 2.
 
Kitmerino

I liked the first one better, more upgrades and they felt more impactful.

This one was a bit shorter, which I don't mind, most of the puzzles were a lot easier, and there were fewer things I needed to look up.

The one thing that bothers me about this game is sometimes the puzzles break, and you have to reload the game, but it's not always clear what's wrong or missing.

But ultimately it was still enough fun for me to finish and recommend it.

652 produits enregistrés

3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Non recommandé
15.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 aout 2023
I liked the first one a lot. A lot a lot. This one not so much. Did I change? Or did the developer work with less care?

In a nutshell Supraland is sort of an FPV Zelda in an engaging world with a significantly heavier focus on puzzle than action (which is sparse).

Problem is that puzzle design is so so - sometimes it's good but often it relies on absolutely untold rules. So that's one way it can be infuriating (like that time where I looked for a guide, applied it, it didn't work like in the video but somehow worked later and I have no clue why). But the real bad part is that for a game that rely a lot on moving, the move are horrible. Jumps is an absolute PITA, clunky af, you'll be constantly interrupted in the middle of puzzle solving by endless, pointless cliping on details of the floor surface.
Music isn't horrible but it gets old real fast while you're struggling to understand what quirky solution is the only one the level designer sought of implementing (like hey water will remove paint, but not a puddle of water for some reason), stumbling on the landscape.

Story could have been a strong point but ultimately is delivered with such a lack of care. Games try to shrug it of with a ton of 4th wall breaking but I'd rather have the dev work harder on something as compelling as the first one (which, again, was great).

When you end the game you're left with "50%" content which a predicated to you going back in all the (not so many levels) and search blindly for skulls with your complete gear. Thx but no thx.

Wouldn't even recomment on a sale. Game is reasonably catchy but spit on your time.
 
One Fart Man

1,241 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
18.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 décembre 2023
I recommend all the Supraland games for people who want a lighthearted, engaging, tongue-in-cheek self-aware exploration/puzzle solving game. The original Supraland's trailer compares the scale of the game worlds from well known AAA games to itself, and that's the kind of summary that spotlights why these games are a great craft. This developer has a keen sense as to what makes Supraland unique and strong.

Though the game world is small in proportion, there's no way that Supraland feels tiny, but at the same time with its expanse and humorous plot, it's as if the entire game and it's main quest is made just in order for it to be packed full of secrets and nods from the developer. Six Inches Under embodies that very well. Many times I'd explore and there'd be a joke or a map design element that shows they expected to see you there, and it makes the whole place feel more grand and thoughtful. I highly recommend these games.
 
Eli
445 produits enregistrés

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
12.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 décembre 2023
Love this game and the previous. Its a fun, very exploitative puzzle 3D platformer. I highly recommend it. I 100% in 2 or 3 days with some help from some guides. Let me tell you some of these puzzles are very clever and I would of never thought of the solution. And others I feel like I would of eventually figured out but I don't got time for that. lol

It also has a lot of references and humor that isn't everyone's cup of tea but made me chuckle.

10/10
 
Milantique
131 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
20.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 septembre 2023
Supraland SIU ha sido una decepción total después de haber jugado a su predecesor. En éste caso las reviews negativas tienen razón en casi todo. El juego original hacía todo tan bien que éste hace lo contrario sin plantearte retos interesantes o justos y ♥♥♥ una jugabilidad plana y absurda.

Empecemos por los gráficos, siguen siendo los mismos pero el rendimiento es mucho peor, en muchas zonas hay microstuttering y lagueos.
Hablando del sandbox, es mucho más pequeño que el primero y muy lineal, te hartas de ir por pasillos hasta una gran sala que en teoría es un bioma donde hacer los puzles. Puzles muy parcos en creatividad y muchos de ellos absurdos donde si no fuera gracias a guías en la vida sabrías resolverlos, primero porque las habilidades no están bien detalladas y no sabes cómo exprimirlas al máximo, y segundo porque en muchos puzles o búsqueda de cofres tienes que mirar cualquier resquicio por pequeño que sea para llegar a un hueco absurdo donde encontrarlos.
El gameplay se ha vuelto demasiado "plataformero", donde tienes que ir de resquicios a salientes una y otra vez intentando ser muy preciso ♥♥♥ los movimientos y en muchas zonas cansa.
La historia es mala y los diálogos de los muñequitos no aportan mucho, hay algunos ♥♥♥ humor pero la mayoría son relleno a mansalva, porque hay muchísimos npcs que están por estar.

Es una lástima que después de haber entregado un producto muy notable ♥♥♥ su primer juego donde conseguías unas sensaciones muy agradables éste segundo sea tan decepcionante, supongo que es la técnica de aprovechar el tirón del éxito para sacar cualquier cosa y conseguir algo más de beneficios.

Lo Bueno:
-Algún puzle es interesante.
-Alguna nueva arma y habilidad.
-El combate ha mejorado un poco ♥♥♥ nuevos tipos de enemigos.

Lo Malo:
-El gameplay es horrible: plataformeo de precisión incoherente.
-Puzles poco lógicos y nada gratificantes.
-Secretos absurdos en zonas puestas al azar y recovecos inimaginables (búsqueda de huesos, cofres y trofeos).
-La mayoría de secretos y cofres dan monedas que sirven para poco.
-Música repetitiva y poco evocadora.
-Mala optimización en diversas zonas.
-El End-game empieza al completar el juego al 50%.
-Acabas harto de muchas zonas y mecánicas.
-Muchas zonas vastas vacías.
-Casi ninguna referencia a la cultura pop y muy pocos easter eggs.

Nota:5,8/10

16.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 janvier 2022
I feel like with each iteration of the Supraland series you're really improving on how the game should be like. What I mean is, with the original base game, while I enjoyed it a lot, a few things felt a bit off like combat or progression (which in itself was improved on with game updates). The DLC already was a great improvement. Now with this release I actually enjoy combat, and the progression feels so much better too. I have no doubt Supraland 2 will be even better and polished. This is one of those rare Kickstarter stories that actually turn out great. Keep up the good work David and team!
 
greyscale
2,147 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
23.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 janvier 2022
A charming Metroidvania with a a huge play area (mainly because you're a little toy man). The devs really spoil you not only with a big arena full of puzzles and exploration as you follow the main story, but by completion time you're probably not even half done! There are whole areas still to discover, including a "post completion bonus area".

There's an abundance of secrets and treasure... and if you complete enough of it, the game also gives you tools to track down the last few items so you never have to worry about finding them. Ideal for completionists.

Compared to the previous game, there is more focus on puzzles and exploration: there is still combat, but there is less of it, it doesn't interrupt exploring, and once you kill monsters, they stay dead! Much more satisfying.
 
Kyzer

Évaluation publiée le 22 janvier 2022
After submitting my comment below, the developers have added difficulty options to the game. THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU. This is customer service at the highest level! I now recommend this game without reservation.

(I love Supraland (all versions) and hate it. The puzzles and exploration are great and compelling. But for me THE COMBAT IS TOO DIFFICULT AND RUINS THE GAME. PLEASE PROVIDE A WAY TO MAKE COMBAT EASIER OR TO BYPASS IT. It's just too much for my 75 year old nervous system. I won't purchase future Supraland games unless you provide a way to avoid combat or make it it easier. How about providing difficulty levels? How about providing GOD mode? PLEASE, I love your games but can't take the frustration of failing to get through combat sequences.)
