tptesar
1
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Non recommandé
16.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 janvier 2022
Supraland Six Inches Under, la segunda entrega que no pudo superarse a sí mismo quedando muy por detrás del primer juego.

El primer juego era ingenioso, su puzzles no eran difíciles pero desafiantes, un combate que si bien dejaba que desear lo usabas a menudo para limpiar las zonas y seguir ♥♥♥ la exploración, conseguías muchos bonus para mejorar tu equipo ofensivo y de exploración, ♥♥♥ un mundo muy amplio y mucho por explorar. Esta segunda entrega no supera nada, cosa que comentaré ahora.

Lo que mejora o destaca:
- Añadieron diferentes formas de resolver los puzzles para intentar que se sintieran únicos.
- Cuando quieres ir a una zona anterior es muy accesible y no es como el 1 que había zonas que debías pasar por varias zonas para llegar, aquí tienes un "centro de tuberías" para ir a donde quieras casi al instante.
- Sin hacer spoilers, hay una mejora nueva muy divertida y que cambia la forma de explorar por completo.

Lo peor:
- Los puzzles en su mayoría son aburridos, muchos son muy fáciles. Muchas veces el puzzle se hacía tan aburrido sin la carisma del primero que acababa por no saber que hacer del poco interés que tenía cosa que en el primero no me pasó.
- Como dije antes, la carisma del primero se esfumó, no me saco ninguna sonrisa, la traducción a veces está mal o es que intentan que hablen como indios, una de dos.
- ¿Referencias? El primero estaba inundando de ellas, ¿aquí? De verdad que no vi ninguna, quizás no las viera porque llevo varios años sin ver series y si es referencias a otra cosa tampoco las vi o me enteré de que era una referencia.
- Los diálogos son muy aburridos que ni parece de la misma empresa que hizo Supraland, todo se siente relleno, apenas me dieron ganas de leer lo que tenían que decir todos cosa que en el primero lo hice.
- El mapa a pesar de ser muy accesible para el backtracking, es soso. Zonas ♥♥♥ 2-3 cosas que hacer, simples y ♥♥♥ la falta de carisma y referencias acabas viendo un mundo aburrido que ni ganas de explorar tienes.
- El combate es casi inexistente y bien no importa porque te avisan pero lo que no veo sentido en planificar que nuevos enemigos poner, mecánicas nuevas y la forma de derrotarlos si al final el combate es tan insulso e irrelevante que es un gasto innecesario de recursos, pudieron haber ampliado el mapa o nuevas habilidades, por ejemplo. Desaprovechado.
- Por ser quisquillosos hasta los logros son creados ♥♥♥ pocas ganas, enserio hay logros que son la misma imagen y que cuando te salen mientras juegas te da una buena patada en los huevos.

Intento ser lo más objetivo que puedo, pero para lo que para mi puede ser aburrido para otros no. Pero al pensar que el primero fue una absoluta maravilla y ahora en este quedo ♥♥♥ un un simple "meh las ganas de más me hicieron tirar el dinero", debía hacer una reseña por si alguien por pocos que sean queden advertidos. No es mal juego si es tu primer Supraland, pero estando el primero no veo porque comprar este juego si no aporta nada más que una habilidad "chula". Demasiado caro te saldría solo por eso, en mi opinión.
 
Maikuro

0

Non recommandé
3.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 décembre 2022
I absolutely LOVED Supraland. Probably one of my favorite puzzle games of all time. This game though just doesn't have the same level of thought out design. In Supraland I had to only look up a handful of puzzles I could figure out and all of those were for getting all the achievements, not for completing the story and when I looked it up I felt like an idiot for not figuring it out. With Six Inches Under I had to lookup solutions to puzzles for the main story within an hour and when I saw the solution it ended up being something I would've never figured out on my own. I felt more like I had to just run around and get lucky to figure out the solution instead of just sitting and thinking to figure it out. I was very sad.

I liked the first game, but this one is just better in every single way.

- less/no meaningless combat
- fun puzzles like the first game, boss puzzle is much more interesting
- plot pacing and humour is denser and wackier

Seems like the devs definitely figured out what did and didn't work in the first game. I'm looking forward to the next title!

Very much enjoy this game. There are quite a few abilities and was pleasantly surprised when I experienced a new one and even more ecstatic when there were cool upgrades. I really enjoy that each time I esplored downa rabbit hole there was something at the end of the tunnel. This game has a large variety of puzzles and I found myself forgetting a key ability once or twice and just overcomplicating the puzzle. Also important at times.. platforming skills xD. I would definitely put this in line with a puzzler like Portal 2.

Zaprong
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
9.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 janvier 2022
爷来教你怎么学塞尔达才能不被骂
前作玩过但是没通关，这部demo玩了五分钟就即刻购入。解密方面讲纯纯10/10，沉浸感好的超乎想象，佐以柔和而不失美感的独特美术风格，堪称老少皆宜的高质量第一人称puzzle game。谜题设计方面很大程度上有机融合了来自很多游戏的灵感，比如很明显的塞尔达和传送门的元素，道具设计也别出心裁，战斗烈度不强，侧重于解密。个人实在是太喜欢这个微观世界的设计了，二极管也好LED灯泡也好擦火柴什么的也好，可爱
少数缺点集中在略微僵硬的谜题设计和视角问题上，有些关卡设计是相当的烧脑，卡关是日常，但是很棒的是和前作一样有极细密的保存点设计，试错成本无限接近于0，极大降低了失败带来的挫折感。视角多多少少有点晕是真的，3D晕眩症估计受大苦
好玩，真的好玩，还有很多梗，30金币买个弯膝盖的技能我笑死，明天就带五十个不死人去制作组门口跳街舞

灵感≠抄袭，望周知

Гибискус
170 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
18.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 janvier 2022
剧情：
主线剧情很简单，在前作的剧情之后，村庄里的一个NPC，因灾难带领村民逃回地面的故事。
不过，本作的剧情相对独立，即使没有玩过前作及其DLC也不会蒙圈。游戏的时间线与前作DLC相同，游戏过程中，会有几次偶遇前作中“玩家”操纵的主角，如果玩过前作，看到那些场景应该会会心一笑。（让我想起了《半条命：蓝色沸点》里的巴尼）

通关时间：
这类探索、解密为主的游戏，通关时间不同人差异很大，我个人是主线11小时，额外内容+找遗漏宝箱5小时。
注意，片尾曲建议不要跳过。跟前作一样，片尾曲会把玩家一路走来的各个地方依次巡回游览一遍，让玩家能够一起回忆下自己在过去的几个小时的点点滴滴。同时还会给出一些阴间藏宝点的位置提示（即使已经打开对应宝箱，他也会给你看一眼）。

游戏难度：
个人觉得解谜难度和动作要素的操作都是中上难度。解密苦手、第一人称动作游戏苦手慎入。

推荐价格：
原价70，如果喜欢前作的，或者玩了Demo对味儿的，可以无脑入。探索解密类爱好者可以等打折。

Évaluation publiée le 25 septembre 2023
В целом неплохо, но первая часть была более цельной игрой. Был баланс между исследованиями и сражениями, тут же сражения для галочки, а исследования местами очень душные не считая основных сюжетных головоломок. Получилась каша из идей, где то отлично, а где то хотелось вычислить автора задумки и приехать к нему домой. Первую часть делал один человек, и придерживался своего виденья, вторую же делала целая команда, и виденье у всех было разное.

6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
17.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 janvier 2022
После прохождения сюжетки:
Не сказал бы, что на том же уровне, но тоже занимательно. Можно пройти, если сильно хочется.
В длс наблюдалась атмосфера первой части, а здесь вижу потерю "души" данной вселенной, а жаль, ведь весь прошлый контент пройден на сто процентов.
Быть может, не стоит так писать, но надеюсь, что в следующий раз такой "халтуры" не увижу.

P.S. хейчу болота и подземелья в играх, а о втором здесь всё, спасибо.

///

После прохождения на 100%:
Негатив несколько спал, но теперь видится конкретная проблема: абсолютно нулевое внедрение побочных квестов к сюжетке. Такого эффекта не было в предыдущих частях, там увлекательно было всё, а когда что-то забывалось или не находилось, то проходилось после сюжета, такой геймплей мне по душе. Сейчас же я за 7 часов прохожу сюжет, затем почти 11 бегаю в полном "одиночестве" без лампового "синематика" или диалогов нпс.
 
HiQuiYuki
2,129 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
16.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 janvier
I give this game a rank B- (70-75%)
Nice game - try if you are interested
See my profile for more details about my reviews.

Additional notes: well I must say Six Inches Under is still a good game, but out of the 3 available Supraland experiences... I think it might be the weakest? It is good, for sure, it is not bad, but is it great? I don't think so. Supraland was much more innovative, longer, went further in terms of level design etc. Here? You can basically finish the game in a couple of sittings, but then the game wants you to go back to every places to complete it 100%, arguing THIS is the game. To finish the game 100% IS the game. I kind of disagree with that, finishing a game 100% used to be an added value (albeit, an amazing one if consequent and varied) to an either great or bad game. That does not make the game! So here, I was having relatively good fun (the story is okay although a bit more dull and heavier than the original one) until the credits appeared... and I thought it would be like in Supraland Crash, a joke, the game would continue... but no, what continues was literally "now go back and collect everything!"... That was a bit disappointing. At my age, with the time and all, I have no luxury (and most of the times neither the intention) to go back and finish a game 100%. There is not much point to it for me!
So yeah, there was some good stuff (nice big easter egg story wise linked with Crash DLC), some parts of the world are well designed, but some puzzles are a bit too "wtf" (the beach), and overall the game arc feels wrong. I think this game should have been a DLC like Crash, and now I think that Crash was much better designed in terms of story arc, game arc, and puzzles.
Now I really look forward to Supraworld, hoping the series can renew itself or sublime itself in a different way!

Évaluation publiée le 4 décembre 2023
There really aren't many games like this one, except maybe for the first Supraland, a true exploration-first platforming puzzle experience, this game simply delivers in spades if you think its fun to do something that feels like breaking out of the gameplay area, only to discover a hidden chest there, and THEN finding another secret area, INSIDE the secret area.

Beautiful, handcrafted world, that is extremely rewarding to explore, this is the most fun i've had searching for hidden areas in years. (Well, maybe except the final hidden chest, that one has been placed by Satan ;)

Évaluation publiée le 10 octobre 2023
Если вы думаете что это игра для детей вы глубоко ошибаетесь. Эта местами юморная "метроидвания" от первого лица, конкретно так заставит пошевелить мозгами. Несмотря на то, что я прошел оригинальный Supraland, над некоторыми головоломками я страдал достаточно долгое время.
Так же как и в Supraland левелдизайн просто шикарен, секреты и монеты бывают там запрятаны, что порой удивляешься, как такое вообще возможно придумать.
Так что если вы не боитесь мозгового насилия, категорически рекомендую данное дополнение.

rammerthered
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
14.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 février 2023
Supraland Six Inches Under manages to improve on all aspects of the previous game in minor yet noticeable ways. It's just more Supraland to play, on a new map and with an overall even better feel.

Everything we've all come to love about this series (the impeccable level design, the insane degree of player freedom, the sense of progress and discovery) is here and slightly improved. Given the level of quality shown in the previous game, it is impressive that the devs managed to improve of what was already arguably a near-flawless product.

Simply incredible.

587 produits enregistrés

Recommandé
30.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 janvier 2023
Mówili, że chcą zapoznać nowych ludzi ze światem supraland; mówili, że chcą zrobić małą grę; mówili, że.... a stworzyli genialne arcydzieło. Supraland six inches under to godny następca serii supraland. Zdecydowanie krótszy, ale dający tyle samo radości ile pierwotna produkcja. Dobre zagadki, mnóstwo sekretów, tajemnic, ukrytych przejść i przede wszystkim nowości. Gra oferuje nowe mechaniki względem wcześniejszej. Fani gier logicznych powinni ograć ten tytuł.
 
Piooorun
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
17.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 janvier 2023
Worth playing if you liked the original. If you didn't then just do that instead first!

+ combat is mostly focused in specific arenas instead of being a constant annoyance during puzzles and traversal
+ enemies don't drop coins, so no reason to grind
+ decent amount of content after the official ending credits (other than just grabbing all of the missed chest coins)

+/- more of the same, changes from the original are minor - you mostly use the same tools, often in similar ways, although there is some noticeable new stuff

- underground setting turned out to be worse than the more open world in the predecessor - it was much more interconnected and indirectly gave goals to the player (reaching interesting spots) as well as a sense of accomplishment when these goals were reached
- there aren't enough upgrades to buy for the coins far too soon
 
Lex
762 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
9.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 janvier 2023
Supraland Six Inches Under is more of what Supraland had to offer and that is great puzzles, fun and rewarding exploration, as well as a neat kind of humor with lots of references to other franchises. It is visually pleasing as well, just a shame that the game suffers from the usual Unreal Engine 4 stuttering.

Évaluation publiée le 22 novembre 2022
實在太好玩了!!! 完全不夠玩! 快點出下一集!!!!!!!!
與第一作相比, 因為在第一作中有一部份的升級是戰鬥的升級,
而本作大幅減少了戰鬥部份, 所以大量寶箱變成了只是金幣, 而且金幣也沒什麼用, 千辛萬苦找到的寶箱打開發現又是金幣難免有點失望.. 但是 ! 少了煩人的戰鬥, 可以更專心的解謎!
本作的謎題和地圖設計依然非常出色和多元 !
爆機後新的幾個區域和隱藏地圖的謎題真的明顯難很多!
不多說了, 推薦給喜歡解謎的人 ! 還有, 麻煩快點出下一集!
ps : 自己的完成度是96%, 剩下的幾個寶箱沒找到放棄了..
唯二看了攻略的是隱藏寶箱三級跳的位置(這個不看攻略, 正常人根本不可能找到)
第二是最後隱藏地圖中地下開木門的方法( 這個超難...)

Recommandé
6.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 novembre 2022
Very solid sequel that still manages to come up with new ideas. Game starts slow but delivers pretty well. Every now and then I found a puzzle that I had to look up for the answer but I figured out most of them after some thinking.

Level design is on point and the upgrades are original. Story is... there and I think the game could make some improvements in the audio department, but overall, I can't complain much. Post game content is there for completionists but I didn't bother.

8/10 - Recommended.

Mikor elkezdtem az eredeti Supralandot, (ingyenes volt Epicen) néztem hogy mi ez a gyerekjáték. Kiléptem és elfelejtettem. Egyszer csak észreveszem hogy fent van a gépen és megint belekezdtem... Tomatenherr

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
21.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 février 2022
I already thought highly of Supraland for its thoughtful, creative, difficult but not infuriating puzzles, and SIU somehow improves on that formula. Compared to the original game, the puzzles feel like they are much more at the center of the game. Rather than having combat, travel, and exploration competing for your attention in each puzzle area, SIU distills the experience down to just puzzle solving, still keeping the fun, irreverent, and original tone of the original. The upgrades are well constructed and thoroughly explored, and I can only commend the developers on how many different types of puzzles they were able to make without ever feeling like something was being repeated. The only thing that really felt off to me was the "hub and spokes" format of the game map, which felt a little unnecessary to the progression of the game. If the hub had been more developed or if there had been more story reason to have the hub, then maybe it would have felt better, but if that's my biggest complaint, then this is an extremely well designed game.
 
azetoh
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
18.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 février 2022
Very underrated!! Super fun! Great puzzles. The creator is a genius and it shows, he knows that we played many games before this one. The game doesn't hold our hands, we have to test things to see how different mechanics or abilities interact with each other, allowing us to solve the puzzles. Some area requires skills and timing, which feels rewarding when succeeding.
One minor negative point is, I wish chests (especially Gold Coin Chests) were more meaningful. Post-ending chests are basically 90% useless. Maybe adding some purchasable upgrades would fix this issue. Purchasable upgrades like, having opened chest marked in the map (and would be retroactive for past chests) or a fast travel that would allows us to teleport back to town (example in the pipe room) would improve the game without changing anything at the core design.

170 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
26.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 février 2022
Unbelievable! David Nails it Again!

Supraland Six Inches Under will take you below the ever so familiar sandbox on an adventure to rescue and free your people. Without giving any spoilers, the game is a solid choice with TONS of post-game content. In fact, the post-game content pretty much doubles the length of the game and it's all interesting stuff. New puzzles that challenge the way that you use your tools, a whole new area (or two or three, who knows! poke around where you think you shouldn't :D ).

Supraland set a new standard of adventure gameplay with countless pop culture and gaming references, Crash took it a step further (DLC but it's actually a full game), and SIU really sets the stage for the next installment of this Journey that David has taken us on: Supraworld!

I gotta say, in his postmortem David was pretty critical of SIU.

The game had different pacing and style from the prior two, but each of those also were unique in those respects. I will agree that some of the chest hunting wasn't as rewarding. Yet, do not the less rewarding ones make the others far more exciting when juxtaposed?

SIU brings some new items and abilities and truly only limits you by your creativity with what you're given to work with....except an invisible wall or two...I guess we don't get out of the sandbox this time?

Buy SIU. You won't regret it. If you do, send me nasty messages but still play it.

Enjoy!
 
NowThenGoodBad
879 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
29.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 février 2022
!!!MINOR SPOILERS!!! (About gameplay features and areas, not story.)

Supraland interweaves puzzles perfectly into the gameplay that you don't even realise half the time that you're solving a puzzle. Supraland: Six Inches Under continues what Supraland and the Crash DLC started. This game does not have hand-holding through puzzles, nor will it make things obvious to you. There are moments where you will scratch your head wondering where to go, or what to do next. This is what is so enjoyable about the Supraland games.

SIU is a good continuation from Supraland, however falls short in many regards. The world is great, but not as immersive as Supraland and Crash (probably because underground). The game didn't really play on the whole, underground thing too much. Just felt like a normal game but with a roof. Would have loved to see things fitting to the "buried under a sandbox" theme that Supraland has.

The puzzles were unique, but ultimately lacked satisfaction, which the dev nailed in one of their "dev feedback" posts. The abilities you unlock were neat, but not amazing. I still wish Supraland had a "Teleport back to city" button for those moments you get lost or just want a fast way back. This game felt less optimised and was harder for my PC to run well.

The inclusion of a map was neat, heavily hindered by the fact that the game is underground, but still served as a decent approach to finding your way around. Having a map meant I felt lost a lot less, and meant I understood the map much better than I would have otherwise. The map design of SIU is far worse than Supraland and Crash. I would also appreciate a completion status for areas, individually. Say once you unlock the statistics and you enter the industrial area, it would state that you have x amount of collectables left in that area. This would save me from the end of the game headaches where I'm running around trying to 100% going to all previous areas to find that last secret area, or just staring at the chest detector waiting for it to beep.

They talked about changing combat, and it was clear that combat involved a lot more thought than previously, however, the pickaxe was really still the best weapon in my opinion. Mainly because movement is key in Supraland. I still want the ability to go even fast for those times you need to run all the way back to a previous area. The extra hearts feel useless after a point, where I don't even need to worry about taking damage because I have so much health, heal naturally so much, and health pickups are plentiful and replenish your health quickly.

The shops felt more like an annoyance in this game than in previous games. Not sure why, possibly because the upgrades they offered didn't really feel impactful. The pickaxe upgrade path was not immersive. Felt shoe-horned in and was a weak way to gate progression. I loved in Supraland finding the new secret pickaxes. I think I would like to see more upgrades to abilities and guns directly.

Overall a great continuation of what has now become one of my favourite game series!
 
Jackie Aych

Recommandé
20.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 février 2022
20h全成就撒花~
通关大约6-7h来着，刚通时差点就打差评了，谜题太简单，基本就是1代的简单到中等难度，有1代经验甚至都没有卡关查攻略。后来跑全收集才发现是把难关放在通关额外关卡了，设计很有意思，想想也合理，剧情谜题太复杂很难受，1代最终boss那一套巨复杂的解谜差点把我打劝退。这代通关后没那么强的执念硬刚，不会就算了，想玩就打打，反而有意外之喜。
另外玩全收集，地图标记很好用，通关后拿到宝箱骨头探测器和探测范围x2，把各大区域跑一圈基本不会漏了，暂时不会解的宝箱在哔哔处画个圈，骨头画个叉，回头能力全了或者干脆查攻略再找起来都很方便，另外也可以给管道画个标记，本路痴就经常忘了从哪来的怎么回去...
最后是我查攻略用的工具 https://koenigskind.github.io/supraland-siu-map/
标记了所有收集物的位置，点了可以直接看这个东西的收集攻略，不过是youtube的视频，应该需要翻墙

kinch28
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
22.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 janvier 2022
If you enjoyed the original Supraland, I think you'll like this one too.

However, it's worth noting that most of it is endgame cleanup. The main story is over before you know it, but you'll only be at 30% completion or so. That remaining 70% comes in the form of hidden treasure chests, collectibles, upgrades, side-missions, etc. In terms of overall game length, it's about half compared to the first game + its DLC (22 vs. 41 hours for me).

Don't let the reduced length fool you, though. The secret areas are tougher to find this time around. It's an impressive feat in terms of level design -- the chests are both everywhere and nowhere!
 
Eulerian

16.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 janvier 2022
A very fun sequel and improves even more over Supraland 1 and Crash DLC. The puzzles feel very refined but open to multiple solutions but might need a few more eyes during development/testing due to very easy work arounds/exploits. The only real improvement i want to see is further refinement of enemies and combat.

I rank this a 9.9/10 game and a very worthy 1.5 game. Ill continue to support these devs and look forward to supraland 2.

Recommandé
19.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 janvier 2022
Great followup game to the original. If you like puzzle games and good level design, with a wide variety of challenges ranging from dead easy to out of the box head scratchers, it's 100% worth playing the Supraland games. Not to mention the map is really amazing for a Metroidvania with collectables and the detectors are great.

However, I did everything and stuck at 99% missing one health upgrade because of the slums rebuilding not triggering no matter what I tried. I wandered around for hours just trying to find the trigger but it's just bugged most likely because of when I burnt the camps down. Disappointing end to an otherwise really bug free experience.

120 produits enregistrés

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
11.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 janvier 2022
A very fun open-world puzzle metroidvania with secrets lurking around every corner. Many mechanics are reused from the first game, but the puzzles are brand new, so it's more of the same in a good way. There is less combat, and the fights are now more meaningful and have a puzzly feel to them. The main quest progression is also made more clear.

The puzzles just keep getting better.
 
PolarVodka
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
9.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 janvier 2022
Muy buen juego, habiendo jugado el primero puedo decir que es una secuela que vale la pena comprar y jugar.

En lo que respecta al tema técnico, los gráficos son muy buenos, se nota una mejoría en la calidad de las texturas ♥♥♥ respecto a la primera entrega, así también tiene un mejor teselado, que hace que el terreno se vea mucho mas acorde ♥♥♥ como se debería ver. El estilo visual se mantiene y sigue siendo un juego muy agradable a la vista por sus gráficos estilizados.

En lo que vendría a ser rendimiento, al principio en el menú parecía que no sería tan bueno, pero ya en juego es constante, no tiene tirones y el frametime es consistente. Lo unico malo es que el juego tiene una tendencia a crashear, en mis casi 9 horas de juego, crasheo 5 veces, lo cual es poco deseable, pero no afecta tanto por el sistema de autoguardado que se da de forma frecuente y por lo tanto casi no se pierde progreso.

Historia: en este punto puedo decir que el ritmo en el que avanza la historia es un paso adelante en comparación ♥♥♥ la primera entrega (que ya de por si era buena), en cuanto a la historia en sí es buena, esta bien escrita (obviamente para el tipo de juego que es) y acompaña bien a los puzzles, sin embargo disfrute mas de la historia del 1 (aunque esto es simplemente preferencia personal)

En cuanto al gameplay, bueno y consistente, se mantienen mecánicas del juego anterior y se perfeccionan ♥♥♥ algunos cambios que complementan muy bien a estas mecánicas, aunque me hubiera gustado un poco mas de libertad de movimiento al estilo del primero, mas que nada en cuanto a los saltos, que en esta entrega se sienten mucho mas limitantes que en la primera.

Finalmente en cuanto a bugs: la experiencia en general fue 90% buena en este aspecto, lo cual también se dio de esa forma por las posibilidades que te da el juego de solucionar los puzzles de distintas maneras. Los únicos bugs que encontré que fueron un poco molestos fueron en la zona del banco, en la cual las pepitas de oro no se pueden pintar, haciendo que sea mas difícil encontrar una solución para poder sacarlas de donde están sin que el guardia las rechace, aunque esto ya fue parcheado. Y el otro es que en una parte donde necesitamos mover una roca pesada para activar un interruptor, podemos simplemente usar una pepita y unos libros, los cuales tienen un peso excesivo, para activarlo, saltándonos de esta forma un powerup que después va a ser necesario para avanzar en el juego.

En conclusión: Muy buen juego, muy recomendable, si jugaste el primero y te gustó este te va a gustar mucho también, en resumen, es mas supraland, y eso es todo lo que esta bien en esta vida

♥♥: Por cierto, lo que hicieron al final ♥♥♥ el contenido que nos dan post-juego es algo que muy pocos devs hacen y que merece una mención especial. Pero no voy a dar spoilers

KOTandGAME
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
20.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 janvier 2022
You ever get the feeling that a video game wall is just low enough that you might be able to jump out of the level? Maybe you're always checking every shadowy corner thinking the developer hid something there, however inconsequential? Or maybe you get excited when you find out you can move physics objects around AND stand on them, and your mind whirls with possibility? Have you spent 30 minutes trying to jump over a mountain to save 5 minutes of walking around it?

That feeling is this ENTIRE game. If the above questions elicit a sense of mischievous glee, this is the game for you.

I've 100%'d Supraland 1, Crash and now this. It's a completionist's dream and it will constantly surprise and delight you for your exploration and cleverness.

The one downside is that Supraland's combat is extremely shallow, and this game is no different. While it doesn't detract from the experience, it will probably rank as one of the weaker features. Don't expect much.

NOOT NOOT
886 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
17.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 septembre 2023
KAMGUSTA's mini Review

This is the "sequel" (they call it "version 1.5") of Supraland, a truly hidden gem I liked a lot.
As the first one, it's an interesting mix of 3D Platform, 3D Puzzle, Metroidvania, Zelda. In some ways it reminds me of the LEGO games, but it has a superior depth. It has a quite nice sense of humour (maybe a little "forced", the first one was better) and some references to pop and game cultures.
Graphic is colourful and more polished than in first one. Music is nice, although a little repetitive. Controls are snappy, as usual.
The enemies now need some strategies to be defeated and you cannot evade all the fights. There are some new puzzles and also new ways to complete them, but they are not so logical as in the first one. The exploration is more limited and the World is way smaller.
Confirmed zero loading screens, zero crashes and zero bugs. Great performance even on medium PC.
Buy it only if you have already finished the first one. It's way shorter and the sense of progression and the story are lacking (that's why they call it "version 1,5"). Looking forward to Supraland 2.0!
Overall, fun!

Score 8,5/10
 
Kamgusta

0

Farklı oyun tarzı ve hikayesi ile gerçekten insanı içine sürükleyen bir oyun. Gerçekten nereden başlayacağımı bilemiyorum, hikaye bitmesine rağmen hala oyunda bulamadığım yerler var ve keşfetmekte istiyorum. Tasarımı olsun, renkler olsun her şey harika tasarlanmış ve her karakterin konuşması çok şeker olmuş arada bakıyorum acaba ne diyorlar diye.Ayrıca oyun hiçbir şekilde sıkmıyor da kesinlikle kuruşu kuruşuna değer alın yani.Bana arkadaşım almıştı doğum günümde iyi ki almış çok eğlendim oynarken güzel bir deneyimdi benim için diğer oyununu da oynamayı düşünüyorum.

Tats
348 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
18.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 février 2022
매트로바니아 스타일로 해금되는 도구를 이용해 퍼즐을 풀고 장애물들을 개척해나가는 게임입니다.
월드 탐험과 퍼즐이 적절하게 분배되어 있고, 난이도는 포탈2 정도인것 같네요. 포탈2보다는 직접적으로 다뤄야하는 도구 수가 많아서 약간 피지컬을 타는 것 같습니다.

여기에 약을 빨아먹은 연출과 이스터에그는 다음 퍼즐로 향하는 원동력이 되어줍니다.
게다가 그 연출을 있는 그대로 살려주는 로컬라이징도 정말 훌륭합니다.
처음 게임을 시작했을때 굴림체가 아니라 게임과 완벽하게 어울리는 폰트로 이루어진 메인화면을 보고 이것은 갓겜일거라고 짐작했을 정도입니다.
흔한 대작게임조차 파파고 번역이 난무하는 와중에 언어유희까지 섬세하게 번역한걸 보고 감동했습니다.
그만큼 제작자도 약빤 내용에 대한 자신감이 있었고, 거기에 대한 투자를 한 것이겠죠.

덕분에 아주 재미있게 플레이했습니다. 같은 게임사에서 만든 전작도 구매해서 플레이 해보고 싶을 정도로요.
 
Primul
0

0

●▬◣ NOTE GLOBALE : 16/20 ◢▬●


Avis détaillé
Supraland SIU apporte son lot de nouveauté par rapport au 1. Les nouveaux éléments de gameplay sont top ! bref encore une réussite !

❑ Je ne conseillerais pas ce jeu même à mon pire ennemi

❑ Les casual gamers
☑ Tout public
❑ Les hardcore gamers
❑ Les PGM sud-coréens

❑ À vomir par terre
❑ Très mauvais
❑ Mauvais

❑ Complètement abusif

La prise en main

❑ Nécessite quelques heures

❑ Inné

❑ Moins longtemps qu'une mouche
❑ Brève
❑ Plusieurs heures
☑ Une dizaine d’heures
❑ Plusieurs dizaines d'heures
❑ Une centaine d’heures
❑ Plusieurs centaines d'heures

❑ Le jeu est codé avec le ♥♥♥
❑ Les bugs gênent le gameplay
❑ Les bugs ne gênent pas le gameplay mais sont présents
❑ Quelques bugs
☑ Le jeu est codé à la perfection (Aucun bug rencontré tout au long de mon aventure)


Avis général

Évaluation publiée le 15 janvier 2022
Awespme experience! A new world to explore. It's more of a standalone Supraland 1's DLC rather than Supraland 2. You must play Supraland 1. then Crash, then this game. It will be more fun that way. And as always the achievements "OCD Fixed" are there.
Must try game for any adventure and puzzle lover.

There are some stuttering issues and some places where people are getting stuck but all of these minor issues will get fixed over future updates, not a big deal.

Respect to the developers.
I didn't want to get the pirated copy. cuz i really want to support their work

Évaluation publiée le 20 aout 2022
Однозначный рекомендейшен. Интересный квесты и головоломки, которые иной раз заставят вас крепко подумать. я так застрял на самом последнем ребусе! К моему стыду, разгадка всё время была под носом...
Разработчикам впору задуматься о разработке полноценной RPG в сеттинге Supraland, - со скиллами, древом прокачки, экипировкой, магией и т.д. Надеюсь когда-нибудь это увидеть =)
 
Dreadnaughty
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
18.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 janvier 2022
【真正的3D银河城关卡！】
之前我一度觉得3d地图很难做到像2d地图那样紧凑
3d的能力锁也比2d要难做得多，玩家很容易就会变得过于强大难以设计边界
Supraland给出了一个很棒的答案
虽然我并没有通关前作，但这作很明显在能力锁的设计上显得成熟了很多
紫块的能力后移了，因为这种距离型能力的过早获得会导致关卡的台阶很难做出层次
相应地，玩家应该在前期获得一些特殊的不影响基本行为的能力
木板连线和磁力就很棒，这种基于材质的能力，既足够强大，又在获得前足够隐蔽，同时也很方便去做边界限制玩家

唯一缺点在于有点晕，我也不太清楚原因
总的来讲我打7分，优秀的3d银河恶魔城！
相较之下老任的prime则并不足够3d，希望prime4能让我们眼前一亮吧
 
Secdoge

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
12.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 janvier 2022
More Supraland is just always a great thing.
This game feels like a stand-alone expansion to the original with slightly better graphics. If you've played the original Supraland, you'll probably solve all the main storyline puzzles in less than 10 hours because you're already familiar with many of its mechanics - only to then discover that you've solved just about 50% of all its puzzles and secrets.
It's a game well worth its price if you like to wrap your mind around phyiscal and exploratory puzzles and like games that have a play- and colorful artstyle.

rɘmm
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
11.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 janvier 2022
Very fun game. Good puzzles that require a bit of lateral thinking but never so much as to feel like moon logic. The pacing of upgrades is nice -- just as you get comfortable with one power, another is on the way. Combat is very much minimized from the first game, but I think that's overall a good thing. It really wasn't the highlight the highlight before or in Six Inches Under.

It took me 11 hours to get through the main quest while doing some exploration along the way. There are several fully optional areas, including some post credits. Given that I most likely missed some secrets along the way, I'd guess that I have 5 hours of new content to play remaining, plus some secret hunting if I feel like it.

I definitely recommend giving this one a go if you're a fun of puzzle games and/or combat-lite metroidvania style games.

Recommandé
11.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 janvier 2022
Разраб сошел с ума и ввел здесь гомосеков! Ну вот что тебе поставить за эту игру? Хочется диз влепить, но ведь сама игра крутая, почти как и оригинал, только меньше по размерам.

2 огромных минуса

- Персонажи-гомосеки. Я двух таких встретил. То что они гомосеки видно по их репликам. В оригинале их не было.
- Сюжет целиком завязан на политике. Для такой игры это не совсем уместно. В оригинале была религия и философия.

80 из 100.

Even getting healed felt super cool and is super funny at the same time! ♥ ♥ ♥

eGGman
113 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
25.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 janvier 2022
Gutes spiel. Ich habe bereits Supraland 1 gespielt, die zweite Version wirkt auf mich einfacher. Ich weiß nicht ob es daran liegt das ich bereits viele mechanics durch Supraland 1 kannte, oder ob es einfach einfacher ist. Das spiel habe ich in 15 Stunden auf 100% bekommen und seinen Vorgänger in 20 Stunden. Ich vermisse es ein wenig sowas wie das Happines Upgrade kaufen zu können, da ich am ende noch über 200 Münzen übrig habe. Ebenso fand ich das der Feuerspeier nicht wirklich oft im spiel gebraucht wurde. Außer 2-3 Papp-wände konnte man alles ohne den Speier machen, ich habe ihn erst nach der Story bekommen und habe ihn für fast nichts benutzt. Was ich ein wenig schade finde da ich mich über die anderen neuen Items mit den neuen mechanics sehr gefreut habe. Außerdem gab es für meinen Geschmack zu viele Waffen Upgrades, dafür dass es fast keine Kampf "Szenen" gab, und die meisten Waffen Upgrades habe ich erst nach den Kampf "Szenen" gefunden, wodurch sie relative nutzlos waren. Trotzdem ein ziemlich gelungenes spiel mit einigen coolen neuen mechanics und ein paar ziemlich schweren Rätseln, für die man um die Ecke denken musste. Auch die Grafik ist wirklich sehr schön und die Story war auch spannend.
Für mich hat sich der kauf definitiv gelohnt.
 
Just_Cathrine
115 produits enregistrés
1
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
12.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 janvier 2022
能看出来新鲜血液的加入让这个工作室有了更多灵感，解谜思路方面肉眼可见的有了更多花样。但是这个dlc作为解谜游戏的“谜题”部分还不足够，“解谜游戏”最重要的就是一个“谜”字，但是《六英尺之下》缺少一些能够让人深度思考揣摩的谜题，很多谜题只是停留在“去一个地方拿一个东西过来开门”的层面。个人认为这方面需要更多打磨
同时大多数关卡的空间利用率不够，很多地方还能再塞一些更有意思的谜题，希望supraland2能够注意到我说的这些问题，并且更好的进步

This game is AMAZING:

Great and good puzzles, therefore very challenging.
Great and good mechanics, therefore very very much intuitive.
Great and good music/graphics, therefore calming and peaceful in a manner I do not know how to say.
Amazing references (eastereggs), from games, TV shows, religion, history etc...

This game made me hooked on it even after the end of it, and it's very intuitive to find and solve the achievements. Just trust me and buy it.
 
Ph4rad0x
1,600 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
19.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 avril 2023
+++ Amazing level design - whoever did the levels and puzzles deserves an award.
+++ Very good puzzles - there's often multiple solutions as the puzzle like, "figure out how to get to here". The puzzles are sometimes REALLY HARD. No mechanics become "useless" late game, you need to keep everything in mind at all times. At the same time, you can beat puzzles "your own way. I somehow managed to skip 3 mechanics and still beat every puzzle somehow.
+/- As you gain tools and mechanics some early game puzzles become trivialised. Personally I enjoyed the power fantasy here as after all that work I can demolish earlier puzzles not designed for my toolset, but I can see others disliking this.
- I found the sense of humour a bit childish personally. No way to speed up dialogue so often you will have to sit there staring at a text bubble for 10 seconds.
- The game "trains" you to look for secrets and break the map. Unfortunately there's some areas (especially in the epilogue) where you can actually get out of bounds, stuck, and break the game. It's sometimes hard to tell what's a secret or a waste of time.

Excellent metroidvania / puzzle game. Reminds me a lot of something like Zelda: Minish Cap or Banjo Kazooie.

Супраленд - это самая крутая игра с классным коммьюнити :) очень радует, как разработчики поддерживают игру и шлифуют её до совершенства. А ещё это идеальное сочетание игрового баланса - короткая (относительно) основная линия и море секретов для тех, кому это интересно. Жду с нетерпением следующую часть!
 
Zitrine
153 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
28.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 janvier 2022
The good: It's more Supraland

The bad: It's more Supraland

If you liked Supraland, this is a big new world to explore, but also mostly the same old powerups as in the original. They also went all in on tons of secrets - there are multiple areas that you won't even see during a main plot playthrough (I had less than 50% secrets found, and I thought I was thorough)

I really like it, but I still think the Supraland Crash DLC was a bit better, even though it supposedly was a bit smaller. I guess the repetition in that made it seem bigger somehow.
 
threedotonefour
4,001 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
50.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 janvier 2022
Produit reçu gratuitement

Great game!
If you liked Supraland and Supraland: Crash DLC then you will probably like this.
A lot of mechanics improved over previous games but also a lot new interesting mechanics came.
It's much shorter than SL1 and has a lot less backtracking compared to both SL1 and Crash.
As I was part of beta tests I recieved it for free, but looking at the price I would still buy it and be satisfied with amount of content, difficulty level and overall gameplay. :D

Edit:
Also a lot of people dislike combat in SL1, in SIU it is different and forces you to have some level of strategy against certain enemies, but also isn't as intrusive as in SL1. So I think you might find it better.
 
Kraken sups.gg

Vous pouvez l'acheter sans hésiter c'est une pure merveille. J’espère qu'il y aura une suite dans les années a venir !

Évaluation publiée le 15 janvier 2022
Отличное продолжение Supraland'а.
Видно, что разработчик развивается и не стагнирует. Механики из предыдущей части и DLC получили развитие, а графику с оптимизацией подтягивают. Сюжет составляет примерно 50% от игры, всё остальное - опциональный контент для желающих провести в игре больше времени. Большое количество отсылок, например на dark souls. Порадовала сложность головоломок в конце и музыка в титрах. Цена не кусается, ещё и скидку в 15% сделали на выходе.

Évaluation publiée le 15 janvier 2022
I'm only at the start of this game, but I love it. The pacing is perfect - you are always on the verge of giving up when you find the next thing and want to keep going to the next challenge. It's nicely narrated, with minimal interaction that is just enough to keep you on track and pushing on. Supraland I was great but this is a masterpiece. Buy it!

PS get onto Discord for tips, if you get really stuck. They are careful not to give too much away, but stop you getting frustrated.
 
justposted
0
8 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
14.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 février 2022
My review page.
Follow me on twitch![www.twitch.tv]

The gist of it:
Supraland Six Inches Under(your girlfriend, heh) is the sequel, sorta, to a fantastic 3D metroidvania puzzle/platformer and I'm happy to say it's just as good.

👍 The good parts:
+Great level design
+Great puzzle design
+Lots of secrets to find

👎The bad parts:
-The story needs to be better for the real sequel
-Combat is still kinda su*ky

Story
So Six Inches Under is not the real sequel to Supraland but more of a side-project sequel thingamajig however that does not mean I will ignore the story aspect of it.

So it starts off where you left off from the previous game but now as a different hero, this time around from the blue "people". Things go bad as you watch the previous hero venture off on his new adventure, and you are plunged along with the other citizens into the underworld.

You shortly discover this new town where some ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ is bleeding its citizens of their coins and in order to escape the underworld, you also have to deal with that individual. Not much else to say about the main story, it is what it is, nothing really good or bad, just a basic story to help you push through to the end. The same style of humor from the previous game makes a return so at least you'll laugh at some of the "dialogue" in the game but that's pretty much all the interesting thing you'll ever encounter regarding the story.

Obviously, the game's focus is not the story and as such, I won't downvote it much but it does have one and it does have the potential to be better, especially for the true sequel.

Story rating: 7/10

Gameplay
If you have not played the first game then what the hell are you doing here? Go ahead and play the first and come back here after. Six Inches Under is mostly the same game as the previous one, maybe a bit less in scope but with the same creative puzzle ideas. It's a 3D metroidvania game where exploration and environmental puzzle-solving are the main elements.

You have the main zone and you have to ascend higher and higher until you reach your goal but in order to do so, you have to acquire and find certain gadgets that will help you throughout the entire game. They are the same as the previous game if you're wondering such as the purple box or the beam that helps you connect wood or metal platforms. There's also a lightning gun though I'm not sure if that was in the previous game as well. Either way, every zone is interconnected just as you'd expect from a metroidvania and it's the reason why both Supraland games get so much love. I'll talk more about the level design later.

Puzzles range from very easy to scratching your head "a-ha!" moments. It's not a very long game but it is certainly full of things to find and stuff to solve. You'll never get bored if you're into these kinds of games even if just a little. There will be always things to do in the game even after the credits finish.

Sadly the combat still su*ks and similarly the boss fight as well although this one was a tad bit more creative than the previous one(the gravity puzzles were really creative). The series needs more bosses for example have a mini-boss or a boss for every end of a zone and make use of the tools found in that area to the max against that boss. As for the small enemies either just get rid of them completely or make something more creative with them. They tried a bit with this game like having skeletons with shields and you have to stun them and then kill them but too little to care.

Gameplay rating: 8.5/10

Audio
Audio design is overall, pretty good. There is no voice acting besides random words and mumbling and as for the sound effects, they are all as good as you'd expect from this kind of game.

The soundtrack is pretty good as well, nothing really outstanding, but just enough to keep you entertained throughout the game.

Audio rating: 7.5/10

Graphics, performance and tech analysis
The performance is just ok thanks to DLSS, though it seems most indie des are now actually relying more on DLSS for games to run good instead of actually optimizing their games. This is not ideal in the long run and while I truly believe DLSS is incredible, games should run first and foremost good without it and then afterwards add this cool feature for gamers who have high-end PC's and want more frames.

That being said, even with DLSS, the game has a lot of frame-skips, small stutters that are not big enough to be an issue but small enough that you'll notice them, especially moving around the main town. Not ideal but luckily most of the game is butter smooth.

Level design, as I mentioned briefly in gameplay, is a huge part of the Supraland series, and Six Inches Under does an excellent job as well. Zones are connected, tons of secrets to find though very copy-pasted/similar to the previous game, and overall the maps are carefully crafted in tandem with the puzzles. I still wish the zones were a bit less boring to look at and I am tired of seeing so much rock but the main town and some other areas such as the castle and the bank were really nice.

Graphics, performance and tech analysis score: 8/10

Conclusion
If you're a fan of Supraland there's no reason why you should not be buying and playing this. If you're new, just go ahead and buy the first and then come back here and buy this one as well.

Final score: 7.7/10
 
Nightserg

Karınca kadar küçük karakterlerin dünyasında maceralarla dolu bir keşfe çıktığınız bu oyunda; etraftaki karakterler adeta kurtarıcı gözüyle yüzünüze bakarken siz de türlü türlü bulmacayı çözüme kavuşturuyorsunuz. Yalnız bulmacaları çözerken öyle ipucu, öneri gibi kopya araçlarından faydalanmayı beklemeyin. Sorunların içinden nasıl çıkılacağını yaratıcı düşünerek kendi kendinize buluyor ve bu renkli dünyadaki keşfinize kaldığınız yerden devam ediyorsunuz.

Non recommandé
16.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 janvier 2022
Leider nicht so gut wie Supraland. Allerdings sind die Rätsel manchmal echt Bock schwer.

Viele Änderungen wie den Magnet Jump oder das Streichhölzer endlich mit der Reibefläche der Schachtel angemacht werden können. Allerdings wurden auch einige nützliche Skills entfernt.

Es gibt auch endlich wieder einiges zu entdecken. Leider, fällt die Belohnung eher mager aus. Man macht ein Sprungrätsel, löst viele kleine Aufgaben und stirbt am laufenden Band und was erwartet einen am Ende? Eine Truhe mit Münzen oder selten auch eine einzelne Münze.
Dazu anzumerken sei, bei ungefähr der hälfte des Spieles hat man bereits alle kaufbaren Upgrade ersteigert, wofür dann noch Münzen finden?

Es gibt sehr viele Kampfupgrades, wie öfters Critten oder mehr DMG. Blöd nur, man kämpft im gesamten Spiel vielleicht gerade mal 5 mal.

Für den Preis ganz okay. Hatte mir aber mehr erhofft. Spielzeit für 100% ungefähr 12 Stunden.

Как по мне это не дополнение а полноценная игра с переплетающимся сюжетом (Supraland). Я бы не стал забывать эту игру так как можно продолжить этот сюжет. Игра классная, самое сложное в игре это не головоломки во время сюжета, а после него, хоть я и не нашёл все сундуки, кости и трофеи, но искать секретную комнату с зелёным обжорой... это сложно.

As for me, this is not an add-on, but a full-fledged game with an intertwining plot (Supraland). I would not forget this game as it is possible to continue this plot. The game is cool, the most difficult thing in the game is not puzzles during the plot, but after it, although I did not find all the chests, bones and trophies, but to look for a secret room with a green glutton... it is difficult.

NeRFHeXeA
262 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
54.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 janvier 2022
Supraland Six Inches Under takes everything you loved about the first game and its DLC (You DID play the DLC right???) and delivers on its promises to bring you the same energy that made me (and hopefully you) love the first game and its teeny tiny, yet absolutely massive, world. While there is considerably less fighting than in the original, the Puzzles are more numerous and the amount of parkour and exploration needed to find all those sweet, sweet, secret areas make up for that tenfold. The main story takes around 7+ hours depending on how fast you go, but there is nearly as much to do after the story is over as during story itself. If you enjoyed the Supraland and Supraland Crash (seriously go and play the DLC) then this is a must buy, even at full price.
 
Zaazaboo
2,510 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
14.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 janvier 2022
Very good game just like the first one.

But it runs like garbage. It seems to be very poorly optimized. I played the DX11 version and I had to go down to lowest settings for it to run. Supraland 1 I could run on max no problem and even though this game uses basically the same assets through out it somehow drops frames left and right. If I look in on one side of the room its 60 fps and if I turn around I am down to 24. The Devs are probably aware of this, why else would they have game telemetry and fps on by default?

But if you can get it to run it remains a good game.
 
Metzelmax

Non recommandé
33.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 juin 2023
This is an emotional reaction to not getting the very last chest in the game, so do with that what you will. Spoilers ahead. I've watched let's plays, walkthroughs and applied various methods to get up that wooden wall that feels higher than the ice one in that popular TV series. Is it my mouse? Is it my misunderstanding of the purple and green gun and their limitations? I don't know, I don't care, not anymore anyway. It's a game I came so close to perfecting and while I am happy for the fans that played the older builds, recorded their let's plays and put them on YT, I'm not having the same experience as them. The nature of early access and kickstarted games, I suppose. I read from forums that it's been made easier, to get to that last chest, but I just keep falling, hearing that beeping sound of the detector for that very last chest, mocking me.

The game is great, it's both an improvement and a step back from the first game. Overall it's a Supraland 1.5 if you will, before we get a chance to play Supraworld, which is looking beautiful. In Six Inches Under there are far too many health upgrades plastered on the screen. Great puzzles, great new mechanics and additions to the game. It's still witty and lovely all around and I look forward getting out of the sandbox in the next game. Since there's no middle thumb on Steam, I'm gonna put this down as a no for people who like perfecting games. This is the type of collectathon I enjoy, it's Ubisoft that goes way overboard with it.

That wooden ledge though, standing between I and the last chest, it's not appreciated. I have all the upgrades, I've tried getting over that ledge from the bucket side, the cliff side, but that wooden ledge persists. So if this is constructive feedback, I hope the devs put a nail in that wooden ledge, cos I know how to get up there, but I can't get over that ledge. If a nail appears in a future update then this thumb will go up immediately. It's your game, your creation, do with it as you will, but I wouldn't be making a case for it if there was only one build available to fans across the development cycle. Since there have been older builds that date back a year or farther, then a simple nail in that wooden ledge wouldn't feel out of place now would it?

The whole game is about reaching higher and higher, to get out of that sandbox, to see what's beyond, to be rewarded by the next chest or gold coins, but also having the satisfaction of going higher than before. Let me grab a nail, please, so I can put a bow on this experience.
 
supernaut

33.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 janvier 2022
Produit reçu gratuitement

I was given the amazing opportunity to beta test this game in its final weeks before release.

The dev team was extremely receptive to feedback and engaged with the testers to make sure every found bug was fixed.

Six Inches Under is a fantastic addition to the Supraland family. It's sense of combat and exploration are wonderfully paired with an expertly crafted world, making it a genuine joy to explore and discover its secrets.

If you liked Supraland 1 and Supraland: Crash, you'll love this game.

首先这款本就是在原本是第一部的第二款dlc的内容上增加删改而发售的游戏，所以基本可以说没有任何形式上的创新，我甚至怀疑就是因为只卖dlc赚不到热度和利润，所以直接一刀切掉原本的计划，翻烂账成新本继续割草。
和第一部有着完全一样的毛病，什么都要去找，虽然已经极大程度上的修改了卡关的地方，但是你个什么东西都要自己去找的游戏，卡死不是很伤玩家的信心？而且啊，你自己都没修改好就敢卖了，真的是相当的牛啊。“永远没有人会记得一款按时发售的游戏”是吧？

Contains anti capitalist messaging and some communist undertones. If you don't want your kid railroaded onto early indoctrination, maybe don't get this for them.

Besides that, great fun - About 10 hours of content if you're not stumped a lot, took me around 20 to get nearly everything (missing a couple of trophies and secrets).
I'd recommend waiting for a sale, for around the €10 mark, 20 is too much.

Évaluation publiée le 24 janvier 2022
Only for fans (but don't get your hopes up)

Puzzles: either trivial or weird (like technically I passed them, but feel like I did it the wrong, somewhat exploity way), I don't miss extensive setting up required just to turn on a jumppad, but you can do most of the puzzles in this one without really stoping to think for a second

Humor: very little, none compared to the base game and first expansion

Combat: still very meh, at least you get 2 combat puzzles which is something I guess

Exploration: literally all there is to this expansion, but even then, most of it is just looking into tiny nooks for no particular reason (and yeah, the rewards are still very much useless)

Adamska
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
23.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 janvier 2023
Für mich war dieses Spiel eine herbe Enttäuschung. Vielleicht habe ich deswegen lange darauf gewartet, es zu kaufen. Die Befürchtung, dass es nicht mit dem ersten Teil mithalten könnte, hielt mich davon ab. Und ich hätte es lassen sollen.

Supraland - Six Inches Under macht in meinen Augen alles falsch, was man hätte falsch machen können. Warum?

1. Kampf
Supraland lebte von fights und wie man sie in Zukunft umgeht. SIU hingegen hat ein paar kleine Kampfsequenzen und das wars. Und die Upgrades, die man für's kämpfen bekommt, sind Schrott

2. Upgraes
Wie viel Spass hat das gemacht, im ersten Teil tonnenweise Upgrades kaufen zu können. Die hatten Bedeutung und fühlten sich wie Progress an. Der pure Hohn mit 5-fach Jump, den man nicht bekommen kann, und die 27 Herzen in Kisten waren so frustrierend

3. Truhen
Im ersten Teil hatten die Truhen geilen Scheiss drin: Loot, Waffenschaden, etc. Es hat Spass gemacht, sie aufzumachen. Im Zweiten Teil: Münzen, Extraherz, Lifereg. That's it. Es hat Spass gemacht, die Truhen zu suchen, sie zu öffnen war einfach nur frustrierend

4. Der Truhenfinder und sein Upgrade
Wie krass asozial ist das denn, Spielern ein Tool zum Finden von Truhen zu geben, inklusive x2 Range Upgrade und Kisten dann immer noch so zu positionieren, dass man sie auch damit niemals finden wird. Das ist so ein toxischer Move.

5. Politik und Lebenshass
Unser Entwickler hat in diesem Spiel wohl so ziemlich alle seine politischen und gesellschaftlichen Ansichten eingebracht und ich denke mir: Warum? Die Verbreitung einer Meinung über ein Videospiel ist so kalter Krieg russisch, dass sich einem die Fussnägel hochziehen, wenn man die subtilen Nachrichten verstanden hat.

Alles in allem genau die Enttäuschung, die ich befürchtet hatte.
100% nach 24 Stunden und über alle Masse enttäuscht
 
Taran Tau
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
14.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 février 2023
It describes itself with a mix of Portal, Zelda, and Metroid but never comes close to living up to anything remotely close to those titles.

It's mostly a slog both to get through the main game and the collectathon in the post game, with none of the puzzles being particularly challenging or engaging and the physics elements have a minor tendancy towards jank whenever it asks you to do anything then use the mechanics in the most obvious ways. The actual abilities that you get could have been interesting but we only get glimpses of them being used in ways that are interesting.

I could almost recommend it for the theming of the game, but even that was poorly done. Maybe there's something that makes it make sense from the first game, but the enemies in this game are such a contrast to the rest of the world that it makes it feel like an asset flip. And, as much as I enjoy the salt of people mad that someone would dare criticise capitalism, the writing itself was really poor and doesn't add much only to end really quickly without any real build up. Once again the final boss feels completely unrelated to the world or the plot.
Once the story is all done all that is left is to go back and get what you missed because you didn't have the abilities to do so which is a lot of finding newly accessible cracks in the wall to find chests in.
Not really worth the time if you've played any of the games that inspired it, and if you haven't go play those instead
 
Bread
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
16.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 février 2022
Штош, 14 часов геймлея. Все сундуки, все кости, все трофеи, все улучшения и т.д.
Опыт по нахождению таких штук их первой части игры крайне пригодился.

Я видел в нескольких обзорах, что игру хейтили за малое количество прибамбасов по сравнению с оригинальной игрой, но лично я таких проблем не заметил, по мне так все примерно в таком же количестве, весь шик начинается после прохождения сюжетки, где попадаешь в постгейм и встречаются крайне сложные головоломки с использованием механик, которые так и не вошли в игру но по своему интересны. Ну и использование механик 1 части тоже есть.

В общем 100% рекомендую эту игру любителям головоломок и прошлогодних мемасов.

15.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 janvier 2022
Ich spiele das Spiel bis jetzt 4 Stunden, bin bei 28% Fortschritt und muss schon wieder aufpassen es nicht am Stück durchzuspielen. Wie schon der erste Teil ist Six Inches Under sehr süchtig machend. Man wird nie fertig alles zu erkunden, immer wieder aufs neue, da man ja beim ersten Besuch in einem Gebiet noch gar nicht alle Möglichkeiten ausschöpfen kann.

Sehr positiv finde ich, dass sich die Rätsel und das Handling, wie angekündigt, nicht wie im ersten Teil anfühlt. Ich konnte keine Wiederholungen entdecken.

Ich bin gespannt was das Spiel noch für Überraschungen bereithält und freue mich jetzt schon auf Supraland 2!

 
Keksemeister
225 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
46.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 janvier 2022
Produit reçu gratuitement

Free: I was a beta tester, and it transitioned to the full game upon release. I want(ed) to support the devs though, so I bought a 2nd copy for another account!

This 3rd Supraland game is great for sure, but before playing it, you should check out:
Supraland 1:
https://steamcommunity.com/id/Yoodiv/recommended/813630
Supraland 2: Crash:
https://steamcommunity.com/id/Yoodiv/recommended/1093730
which is a separate game, but it's sold as DLC for SL1.

This one somehow still manages to be original, novel, and have all new puzzles and techniques, and is also more of the same top-tier game that made the original great. You will see some of the same equipment returning, and a whole lot of 'new'. Very impressed with this team's work consistently.

Some of the puzzles are tough! But if you get stuck, there's an active discord server ( https://discord.gg/PxnZCsJKXD ) and plenty of online guides.

Combat has always been a relatively minor part of this series, but for this game it has been made smoother and more interesting with some cool puzzle elements!

As with the other 2 games, I love the visuals. In the moments where you're flying far above the world and can see everything, it's SO cool.

I've now 100%'d this one as well, including all the post-ending stuff, and had a great time.

Edit: The team is in development full-steam-ahead on their next game, SupraWorld, and it's getting closer, so I'm replaying these, and they're also great the 2nd time around!

SupraWorld looks AMAZING based on the previews they've given out; looking forward to it:
 
!Supreme Grand Wizard Yoodiv
3,583 produits enregistrés
0
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
18.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 janvier 2022
It's alright but I was expecting much more from it. Feels more like a DLC than an actual sequel although it's not a big deal considering the price. Somehow this one is not that fun as the first one was. The puzzles are tedious and repetitive, enemy encounters feel totaly out of place like they are there just for you to spend a little bit more time with the game. Also developers went with almost the same set of tools for solving puzzles. It's worse optimised than the first one and has multiple bugs. Last but not least the blunt political satire presented in the game, I have enough of that in my everyday life and it's just not fun.

UPD: I saw the developers' response and decided to update my review a bit. You say that the description clearly states that it's a "standalone DLC", whatether it could be. Alright, this might've been my bad that I didn't notice this before. But then again, there's a dialogue in the game where the lava coffee mug is which roughly states something like: "The developers are so cool they decided to give you this half of the game for free altough they could've sold it as a DLC". I've personally never heard of a DLC for a DLC so that sounds a bit weird even as a joke. And that's not event the main point of my frustration with the game (or DLC). Moreover I never accused you of making false promises or something, I just said that this one unfortunately isn't for me because of these reasons. Which is sad, but I'm looking forward for whatever you're going to create in the future.

Again a marvel. Exploration is key in this episode, and also the fights have been improved quite a bit. The soundtrack is awesome and the little tid-bits are just great: like the sound effect after a fight, which resembles the Skyrim sound a little. Or other tie-ins to popular games.

All in all a no-brainer, if you liked the original Supraland. Great game from a great team!

19.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 janvier 2022
Produit reçu gratuitement

Supraland: Six Inches Under (SIU) is another gem in the Supraland franchise. Keeping with the pattern set down by its predecessors, SIU contains rewarding puzzles, a light-but-interactive fighting system, and a feed-back loop that rewards exploration.

I greatly enjoyed the time I spent finding and solving puzzles, looking for power-ups, and striving for that ever elusive 100% completion.

8/10
 
Lews Therin
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
1
Recommandé
17.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 janvier 2022
Produit reçu gratuitement

Si quieres leer más reviews así, visita el mentor haciendo click aquí

Una mezcla de Portal, Zelda y Metroid es como el desarrollador define este juego, y no podría estar más de acuerdo. Supraland es un juego de puzles y exploración, ♥♥♥ un poco de combate, que nos meterá de lleno en un mundo en miniatura super atractivo, lleno de personajes y situaciones hilarantes.
Para mi, uno de los mejores juegos de puzzles en primera persona que he jugado. Una aventura que recordaras sin duda.

Jugabilidad y mecánicas
Manejaremos a un personaje en lo que de primeras será un simple walking simulator. Pero enseguida podremos ir desbloqueando decenas de mejoras y habilidades de todo tipo que tendremos que aprender a dominar y combinar tanto para resolver puzzles como para navegar por el escenario y descubrir los cientos de secretos ocultos por todas las esquinas.

La sensación de progreso es constante y enorme, y estaremos deseando tanto ver las nuevas zonas que desbloqueemos, como volver a las ya visitadas para poder aprovechar nuestros nuevos poderes para alcanzar lugares que antes eran inaccesibles para nosotros.

La saga
Six Inches Under es una secuela, que aunque no venga numerada, es una segunda parte ♥♥♥ todas las letras, lleno de contenido, novedades aunque ♥♥♥ una duración y tamaño muy algo menor al del juego original.
Si no has jugado al original, debes hacerlo, para entender tanto la historia, como las mecánicas, ya que, aunque este juego es totalmente independiente, yo al menos lo veo muy enfocado a los veteranos de la franquicia, ya que hay cosas que no explica, y que el juego da por hecho que sabes.
Nada que impida a un nuevo jugador poder disfrutar del titulo, acabara aprendiendo todo, pero la curva de aprendizaje y dificultad, son más elevadas desde el principio.

Puedes leer mi reseña de Supraland haciendo click aquí

Mejoras y diferencias
Six Inches Under es un juego muy continuista, tanto a nivel técnico como jugable. Es simplemente más de lo mismo, pero ♥♥♥ una gran calidad y lleno de contenido trabajadísimo.
Muchas de las mejoras que teníamos en el primer juego, las tendremos aquí también, pero muchas otras serán nuevas. Estas nuevas mecánicas van desde conceptos totalmente originales, hasta mejoras de las habilidades que ya teníamos en el juego original, por lo que el juego se siente conocido, pero a la vez te mantiene enganchadísimo gracias a las nuevas ideas.

El orden en el que desbloqueamos las mejoras, incluso las más básicas, también es totalmente diferente, por lo que aunque tengamos viejas conocidas, la ausencia de otras habilidades que estábamos acostumbradísimos a utilizar, nos obligaran a buscar nuevas formas de enfrentarnos a los retos.

Respecto al combate, ha mejorado muchísimo. Todos los enemigos son nuevos, e introducen mecánicas algo más interesantes que las de los enemigos simples que veíamos durante el primer juego.
Sigue siendo algo totalmente secundario, pero ahora, ya no nos cansara ni resultara tedioso, ya que se han reducido estas partes, y además, ahora los enemigos no reaparecen, por lo que una vez muertos, lo estarán para siempre.

Se agradece también muchísimo la inclusión de un mapa en el que podemos dibujar y tomar notas. Era un añadido que le hacia muchísima falta y está perfectamente integrado.

Fuera de eso, el juego es realmente continuista, sin grandes cambios ni variaciones. Diría que es lo único malo que puedo decir de este juego... pero teniendo una esencia tan buena, el seguir manteniéndola intacta no puede ser malo de ninguna manera.

Apartado técnico
Ninguna mejora significativa, pero sigue cumpliendo a la perfección en todos los aspectos. Visualmente es simple, pero ♥♥♥ un diseño super atractivo y relajante. A nivel sonoro muy buena música y efectos, y en rendimiento, un juego fluido y sin problemas técnicos ni bugs.

Lamentablemente, la traducción al castellano deja algo que desear y no es para nada profesional. Pero nada que estropee el juego.

Además, como de costumbre, el desarrollador ha pensado en todo, y todo lo que se te ocurra hacer ♥♥♥ las mecánicas del juego, estará contemplado y se podrá realizar. Además, muchos puzzles tienen diferentes soluciones, premiando la originalidad y el pensamiento lateral a la hora de explotar las mecánicas del juego.

Historia
Simple, de relleno, pero muy entretenida y divertida. Continuación directa de la ya vivida en el primer juego, centrada en el humor y muy bien dosificada.

Conclusión
Si te gusta la exploración y los puzzles, lánzate de cabeza a por este juego. Es una verdadera maravilla. Esta realizado por un único desarrollador y le da mil vueltas incluso a muchos triples A.
Es original, divertido y adictivo. Los puzzles son lo suficientemente sencillos como para que nadie se atasque, pero también suficientemente retantes para dar un gran satisfacción.
-Si ya has jugado el juego original, lánzate sin ninguna duda a por este. Aun siendo muy conservador, introduce un montón de nuevas mecánicas e ideas y está más que justificado, tanto en calidad como en duración.
-Si no conocías, o no has jugado al original, ve de cabeza a por ese primero. Y después, no te quede ninguna duda de que te quedaran ganas de sobra para volver y continuar ♥♥♥ este.

Nota: 9.25/10
 
Nyper

DrGolden_01
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
7.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 janvier 2022
На шесть дюймов (и два балла) ниже
Игры-головоломки нечасто обзаводятся продолжениями. Возможно, всё дело в повторении рабочей механики, которая требует грамотного совершенствования либо же какого-то глобального сюжетного сопровождения. Supraland, помимо массы прочих своих достоинств, была хороша и открытостью к нововведениям, ограниченным только фантазией разработчиков. Которые, к слову, напланировали уже аж до сиквела в разработке, перед которым решив побаловать нас двумя дополнениями. Первое – Crash – было унылой попыткой в «День Сурка» с нелепым гриндом и с минимумом жанровых изысков оригинала. Второе, собственно Six Inches Under, разрослось аж на полноценный спин-офф. А вот получилось ли исправить разровнять старые комья в блины и при этом завести к ним свежего варенья – давайте разберёмся.

Хотя Supraland никогда не блистал супер-закрученным сюжетом, прелесть оригинала заключалась в универсальном по большой части добром юморе с тонкими оммажами на поп-культуру и изящной деконструкцией клише компьютерных игр. И к сожалению, как и в Crash, «Шесть дюймов под» может предоставлять лишь бледную тень, копирку, с совершенно нелепыми попытками в сатиру, которая взрослым будет несмешной, а детям неинтересной, и исключительно плохими, очевидными, зачастую просто кринжовыми шутками, а ещё сугубо неудачными отсылками к оригиналу. Завязка такая: жители красного и синего королевств провалились под песочницу, где обитают серые человечки, и вывести жителей поверхности, коли главный герой предыдущих двух историй где-то там летает, обратно домой предстоит обыкновенному синему водопроводчику, который со временем, вооружённый киркой, превратится в настоящую местную помесь Марио и Индианы Джонса, и не только.

Формула игрового процесса не изменилась, разве что слегка сдвинулись приоритеты. Перед нами вновь открывают широкий к исследованию в стиле метроидвании мир из нескольких связанных локаций, наполненный головоломками и периодическими стычками с монстрами. Но головоломки стали попроще, сражения и вовсе редки, а мир игры получился не только меньше, но и куда доступнее для перемещения по нему. Что, на самом деле, не может не радовать, ведь весь излишний раздражающий бэктрекинг исчез, и в целом игру можно похвалить за бодрый темп движения по сюжету, подкрепляемый заметным упором на платформинг, например, с помощью магнитной пряжки. Так что хуже геймплей не стал, наоборот, баланс выровнялся, острые углы сгладились, головоломки по-прежнему заставляют включать фантазию и ругаться на собственную недогадливость, постоянный респаун врагов больше не бесит, и без новшеств, к счастью, не обошлось. Добавилось несколько новых механик в головоломки и взаимодействие с окружением, рассказывать о которых я не буду, чтобы ничего не спойлерить, упомяну лишь умение бросаться киркой в противников по принципу бумеранга, из-за которого лично мне не довелось вообще добраться до пушки, хотя она в игре вроде как и присутствует. А вот что до сих пор не только не было исправлено, но и усугубилось ввиду нового темпа и элементов геймплея, так это кошмарно неудобное, неотзывчивое, постоянно руинящее сложные моменты управление, особенно в паркуре и боёвке. Видимо, оно останется извечной причиной материться в этой милой игре для всех возрастов.

Что же получается в итоге. Supraland Six Inches Under не может порадовать сюжетом, персонажами и юмором (хотя местного карикатурного злодея вы точно возненавидите, он абсолютно омерзителен), но зато прежний геймплей обновился и избавился от шероховатостей, пополнился новыми вполне уместными приёмами, в игре по-прежнему есть интересные и забавные моменты, и картинка с эффектами красивые и приятные. И всё бы хорошо... Если бы я не прошёл игру за шесть с небольшим часов, пропустив, причём, максимум процентов двадцать из встреченных паззлов и секретов, наводящих меня на мысль, что я не видел дополнительного контента где-то ну ещё часа на три в лучшем случае, поэтому ума не приложу, про какие двадцать часов сказано в описании игры в «стиме». Но даже если после титров и есть дополнительные паззлы, проходить их без сюжетной подоплёки уже попросту неинтересно. А стоит SIU, к слову, столько же, сколько и оригинал минимум часов на 15-20, так что... И к тому же крутого саундтрека не завезли. Спасибо, что в третий раз не Warum Warum, но остальные треки либо просто неплохие, либо чересчур повторяются, а финальная песня ей, увы, проиграла. Таким образом, я советую данный приквел к ознакомлению с осторожностью, при условии, что вы прямо сильно соскучились по оригиналу, но при этом не хотите перепроходить то же самое, ну или желающим максимально ненапряжного приключения на пару-тройку вечеров. Остальным же я бы рекомендовал подождать полноценного продолжения под названием Supraworld. И я очень надеюсь, что все достоинства этой «полторашки» авторы используют в нём, сделав игру как минимум на уровне оригинала. Идут в правильном направлении, это точно. А до тех пор – что имеем.

6 из 10 – удовлетворительно
P.S. Оценки предыдущим играм серии:
Supraland (2019): 8 из 10 – отлично.
Supraland Crash (DLC) (2020): 4 из 10 – плохо (не пройдено).

Спасибо, что прочли этот обзор! Если не трудно, оцените, насколько он был вам полезен, и можете посмотреть другие обзоры в моём профиле ;)
 
Condor Freedman

Évaluation publiée le 27 mai 2023
Great game but why the hell did they put such a stupid irritating noise on the final boss? Want to think about this puzzle for a few minutes? Let me help distract and irritate you whilst you do. Damned near perfect Surpaland otherwise

Edit: Nice to see a devloper respond, but let me say I know it's the mechanic of the area, especially having completed it. My complaint is that with all the possible sounds in life you chose this. Others might not find it irritating, but I did, I am not so dim as to not know it's the mechanic for the area, but frankly I'd have rather had a ticking clock sound than the meditative groaning.

Note the review is positive, I am simply feeding back my one gripe. I have the same gripe with other games, especially with FPS as they tend to all have 1 small mob which makes the most irritating screeching sound possible. After listening to them for some time they grate on me is all.

Metafazx
23 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
18.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 septembre 2022
怎么说呢，可能是一代带给我的印象太过惊艳，无论是一代DLC还是二代，都给不了我心中期待的东西。

从剧情上来说，二代是一个合格的续作，不正经的玩法，不正经的角色，不正经的剧情，你甚至能看见一代中玻璃之后的自己（这个地方真的是一个亮点），是一代的味道。

从玩法上，二代可以说是有点垃圾，没有特色的升级，甚至不如一代，升级升不了几次，钱也多的用不掉，搞得开箱子开出金币都想骂人。电击枪作为一个有时有伤害，有时没伤害的设定，我都不清楚到底怎么回事，需要电枪作用的机关更多是起到派蒙的作用“前面的区域，以后再来探索吧” 。

和一代相比，最大的区别还是，即使通了关，开始养老了，你身上的升级也不能让你像一代一样上天入地，平庸至极，玩着不够爽。

总之。建议为了情怀的人购买。
 
No say, No listen, No study

Recommandé
32.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 aout 2022
SUPRALAND、crashと遊んできてSix Inches Underも無事クリアしほぼ宝箱の回収も終えました。
他の方のレビューでも評価が高いので、ここでは恐らく最高難易度の位置にある宝箱の簡単 (?) な取り方を明記しておきます。


エンディング後に解放される、所謂「虹の根元には幸せがある」のエリアです。
骨は全回収してトランスロケーター距離2倍、更にジャンプ＋1を入手しておくとかなり楽に到達出来ます。
先ず操作前に設定からfpsの数値を最大限まで上げ、ゲーム速度も60か70に落としておきます。
前述のアビリティ2種を用い (なければ木の壁をひたすらフォースビームのターザン登りで) 桶の麓まで辿り着きます。
次にフロートバックルをONにして、桶側でフォースビームを使い桶の中間地点まで登って行ってください。
fpsを最大値にしている影響で挙動がゆっくりになっている分、操作は楽になっていると思います。
中間地点ではフロートバックルが効きます。それを利用して更に上の持ち手までフォースビームで上がっていきます。
持ち手も金属なのでフロートバックルが有効です。可能な限り上まで上がってから木の壁側を向くと、てっぺんの縁にちょこっとコインが見える場所があります。そこに宝箱があります。
到達するには返し状態になっている木の天井部分をひたすらフォースビームでターザンの様に伝いながら進んでいきます。
挙動が遅い分操作が容易になっているので、苦行度は下がっている筈です。
何とか端まで辿り着いたら、向かいの木の天井と90度重なっている部分よりやや向かい側の天井のすぐ真下辺りにどうにかして着地して下さい。状況が許せば位置は確認出来るかも知れません。
そこには僅かながらですが出っ張りがあり、引っ掛かるようになっています。
無事着地出来たらトランスロケーターを頂上に飛ばして行ける位置に一旦移動、そこからフォースビームで宝箱の隠されたエリアへ渡る事が出来ます。
隠された宝箱の中身はジャンプ＋1なので、最終的に三段階ジャンプが可能になります。
もしこの時点でレッド王子とスクラップ回収イベントをクリアしていない場合、更に五段階ジャンプが (無料で) 手に入る可能性があります。実はそこにレッド王子もいたりします。
YouTubeで入手法を紹介している動画があるので、一度ご覧になってみると面白いかも知れません。
 
kemecoro

Supraland original was a decent game in my book, I was surprised when picking up this one that they seemed to fail so much at teaching the player how the game mechanics worked. There are some cases where I feel that figuring it out is the solution, but multiple times had me wondering why a more straight-forward puzzle wasn't introduced.

Also any combat encounter the starting music is jump-scare levels of loud. That's just annoying.
